text: Bready, nice bitters, hint of candisugar, lightly sour prunes, dry finish, not metallic at all
Bottle at antwerpen. Deep chestnutty brown, almost black colour small brown lacing. Nose is roased, light cocoa faint rhum. Taste is low bitterness, low sweetness. Zserbo.
One of the best beer I have ever had. Rich taste and aroma with a slightly nutty after taste.
Backlog. Draught in Geel, Belgium. Pours beautiful dark brown with off-white head. Nice balance.

Bottle. Dark brown, hazy with small, beige but long lasting head, not good lacing. Mainly aromas of Dark fruits with some caramel sweet tones. Not very strong but very stable. Taste is sweet, with strong caramel flavors and balanced with medium bitterness in the finish. Pleasant oily mouthfeel and right carbonation. Very good.
33cl Flasche. Mahagonifarben. Fester heller Schaum. Trauben und Malz Duft. Tolle Nase. Trockenobst im Antrunk.malz und Karamel. Weicher Abgang. Rosinen.

Bottle from Six Degrees North, Glasgow. Fantastic right through. Fruit dominates the smell, though there is bread and booze there too...bit of burnt cocoa against the berries and sweet fruit in the palate. The aftertaste just keeps on keeping on. I know general consensus is that Westmalle Triple is the boy...but I think this is the best thing the brewery does...
Geproefd met LiekevdV. Het is een donker bruin helder bier met medium schuim. Het heeft een licht zoete afdronk, beetje drop achtig.
33cl bottle. dark ruby red. medium to big white head. malts, dried fruits, caramel. medium bitterness. medium carbonation. well balanced.
as described a perpetual favorite and holder of the style. reliable, full of flavor and soul.

Reddish brown, pale beige head. Aroma is full fruity. Subtle notes of caramel, biscuit, licorice, spices. Feels balanced. Not too sweet, easy to drink. Flavors are dark fruit, caramel, over-ripe banana. Very nice dubbel.
Tja, er zijn van die bieren die nu eenmaal goed zijn. Fors van smaak, prikkelend op de tong (geen lange afdronk) en een klassieker. Een van die bieren waar niks op af te dingen is.

Bottle: Poured unclear dark brown with a nice creamy tan head. Faint aroma: all I got were some muted raisins, plums and alcohol. Had some fruity sweetness and bitter finish but I got a lot of alcohol in the taste. The body was overly light and thin and the carbonation was quite high. Overall I had high expectations for this one and it completely missed the mark. Maybe I drank it too quickly and didnt let it warm and show its characteristics better. Or maybe I got a bad bottle. Nevertheless, Ill revisit it some time later.
Not usually a fan of Dubbel beers, but this is splendid. Sweet but satisfying, with a malty, dried fruit flavour.
Karmel, banany, drożdże. Ciemny, brązowy kolor. Słodki smak. Daje radę choć piłem lepsze warki.
Greetings from Bydgoszcz, Poland to all Beer Geeks and Hopheads around the world!
It was different as I remembered. I couldnt really feel the harmony. But all together it is still a master piece.
Dark brown colour , real hazy, with medium tanned head, aroma of caramel, roasted malt, raisins, taste is caramel, brown sugar , caramel, boozy at the end, fine beer!
Tres belle robe brune. La mousse se dissipe vite, un peu trop gazeuse. Bien équilibréentendu et fruitée, légère amertume mais finale acide, dommage.

Very deep dark red color with huge sand color foam. Aromas of ripe fruits, raisins, banana peel, caramel, biscuits and a light touch of wood. Palate, medium to full body with disappointingly light-ish texture leaving nice dry finish. Taste sweet of with notes of malt, burned sugar, dried fruits, and caramel. Overall, okay not bad but expected bit more from a Trappist beer, but still nice.

Bruin/rood kleurig bier met een crème kleurige schuimkraag.

Aroma: moutig, bruine suiker en wat gist.

Smaak: moutig, bruine suiker, iets van drop en wat gist.

Veel koolzuur en romig mondgevoel.
0.33l bottle. Very dark brown color with nice browny head. Aroma of caramel, banana, raisins and yeast. Taste is sweet and bitter.

Clear dark amber color with a significant long lasting tan foam; aroma of clove, caramel, ripe fruit, red fruit above all, banana, black pepper; a good balance between sweetness and bitterness; medium body but thin feel; lively carbonation; bitter finish and a little astringent. This beer is the paradigm of a belgian dubbel: great yeast with all its esters and phenols, thin texture and not cloying at all. its hard to explain how its organoleptic profile is clean but "dirty", as all the belgian beers are, at the same time. Complex, pleasant, a peerless masterpiece.

Im not always in the mood for a dubbel, but holy cow, this one is amazing. Spot on for style, of course, and is just so well balanced and tasty. Do not pass up if you are in the mood for a belgian red that wont knock you down after one beer.

Bought on a beer buying expedition at Total Wine in Plano. Poured out of a 750 ml bottle into my favorite Chimay chalice. Fantastic entrance, a very dark black-amber topped by an expansive off-white head. The nose is mighty fine, peach, a touch of banana and cotton candy. I find the taste much subdued after the promising scent. Mango, floral slightly, green apple too. Really nice for a dubbel, I find myself preferring the exuberance of a quadrupel. But I digress.

2016 catch up - A smooth and quoffable beer, with malts, yeast and gentle bitter hops. But not really a huge amount beyond that. At least it didnt have the crazy carbonation that I dislike about so many Belgian beers.

Bottiglia da 0,33. Schiuma abbondante e molto corposa. Colore bruno intenso. Carbonatura abbondante. Aromi di bosco e muschio. Sentori di cioccolata amara e caffè. Gusto deciso ma breve con retrogusto amarognolo. Consiglio 8/10
Bottle from Waitrose, Shepherds Bush. Great combination of aroma, palate and taste. Slightly too strong for me personally.

330 ml bottle served in Trappist glass. Dark brown, big fluffy foam head. Aroma of dried peach, raisin, cocoa, nutmeg. Hoppy bitterness and slight malty sweetness, very balanced. Soft carbonated, full body, oily-watery texture. Bitter, slight metallic finish. Great!

Bottle from M&S, Team Valley Gateshead and Rehills, Newcastle. Hazy dark brown with bright red tinges. It pours with a large foamy head and has a rich red and dried fruit flavours, Christmas cake hints, almond and a smooth chocolatey and vanilla finish. Very good.

Poured from the bottle into a chalice at the World of Beer in Savannah, GA. The appearance is a dark mahogany brown color with a small off white head. The aroma is full of fruit and chocolate. The taste is matches the nose to a "T". An excellent beer.

Bottle. BB 10/2018. Almost black colour, off-white head that stays quite well. Aroma: apple, spices, not very roasty. medium carbonation, plums, spices, alcohol at the end, apple pie sweetness throughout. Alcohol mostly coovered. Palate sweet with bitter notes, probably from hops. Flavour is not so strong but rather balanced and leaves delicate, long-lasting complex mouthfeel.
Bottle. Cant believe I havent rated this yet. Last beer at 37. Pours dark brown tan head - nose/taste of caramel, bubblegum, yeasty esters, dark fruits and banana peel - medium body
Aroma of dark fruits, raisins, figs, sweetness, caramel, banana, malt. Taste sweet, raisin, banana, brown sugar,bready notes, hint of spices. Medium body, sweet and slightly bitter aftertaste.

Aromas of bready malt along with some spice and fruit.

Color is a dark brown with a very large light brown to yellow head.

Taste is light to medium sweetness, surprisingly dry for such a malt oriented beer. Bitterness is light.

Body is medium; texture is oily to creamy; carbonation average to slightly lively; finish is medium length with malt, light fruit and a bit of spice.

Overall an interesting beer; not spectacular but a little different;I like the fruity/spicy esters.

Wasnt expecting to prefer this to Westvleteren 8, but, well, here we are. Sweet but not overly so, with a nice fig, cherry and raisin fruitiness propped up by a buttered caramel malt undertone. Bitterness remains mostly restrained, instead letting the yeast take over the back end, offering up bread and fruit as it fades into sweet bliss. Creamy texture seems the slightest bit thin, but overall a great Dubbel.
Mousse beige persistante, bière belge assez riche, pas tellement amère, passe plutôt bien.
Birra dal colore marrone scuro. Schiuma beige, fine e persiatente. Al naso sentori malto, caramello e toffee. Al palato corposa, con note si malto, toffee e caramello. Un ottima birra.

Barwa ciemna, pod światło przebłyski. Średnio pęcherzykowa piana, utrzymuje się długo. Aromat słodkawy, bardzo mało intensywny. Czuć trochę rodzynek. W smaku czuć alkohol, goryczka niska, trochę śliwki i rodzynek. Mało ciała. Ocena na podstawie notatek pisanych przed założeniem konta na RB.

Bottle from Saveur beer. Pours brown with fluffy tan head. Aroma is dough, nut, hints of banana, chocolate, spice. Flavour is a medium sweet bread, nut, chocolate with a high carbonated effervescent finish. Dry plum spice finish. Lovely.

Aromas a levadura y caramelo
Buen aspecto caoba, espuma persistente, buen encaje de bruselas.
En boca bompleja y balanceada
banana, woody, caramel, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, light sweetness,

0.33l. Pours in dark ruby colour with large brownish head. Aroma of perfumes, hay, wood. Lightly sweet, lightly bitter with light sourness notes. Medium body, thick feel, medium lasting very light burned and sour aftertaste

33cl-fles van bij Tabac&Co - Palais des bières te Dottenijs (in Famiflora). U: Donker bruin met een donkerbeige schuimkraag. G: Chocolade en esters. S: Zoet met een lichte moutbitterheid. Chocolade en fruitige esters. M: Medium body en medium carbonatie.
Lovely mild banana aroma, with a very long lasting head. There is a biscuity maltiness and its very smooth on your tongue.
Draft keg at Slaters Wolverhampton. Dark brown almost black cream head. Dark fruits caramel chocolate malts. Semi dry finish. Good!

#1267Bottle. Hazy mahogany body, yellowish head. Aroma of pears, pomegranates, lichi, caramel, baked apples. Taste is neutral, a bit sweet. Apples, caramel, fennel, pears, baked tones. Fuller body, moderately carbonated. Nice one!

Botella en Doemens. 

Vierte en color castaño con un toque rojizo, brillante y transparente. Espuma media, cremosa, que baja rápido pero luego permanece.

Franca y directa en nariz, de intensidad media. Predominan las notas afrutadas con pasas, castañas y manzana roja. Entre los tostados encontramos cacao y melaza. Algo licorosa.

De entre los gustos básicos muestra un dulzor claro, aunque compensado por la marcada acidez. También un punto salado claro y un amargor tenue.

De cuerpo medio-alto en boca y textura acaramelada, chispeante y aterciopelada. Clara sensación de calidez, algo astringente. Con la evolución en boca, los torrefactos salen claros con el dulzor del caramelo y la acidez que lo equilibra. El amargor de regaliz está siempre de fondo. Permanencia media en boca.

Una cerveza para pensar, para tomar como copa al llegar a casa o en una sobremesa de conversación tranquila. Marida con carnes estofadas como un codillo, un ragout, un rabo de toro o un ossobuco.

Bottle 0.33l. Hazy, deep copper colored. AROMA- pear, pomegranate, caramel. FLAVOR- neutral, moderately bitter, pear, pomegranate, bitter caramel, spicy, touch of dates. Medium to fuller bodied. Very good.
Brown almost red colour with white foam. Dark and malted aroma with apples and other fruit.

Lively dark brown pour, soda head that dissipates but leaves a persistent trace. Aroma is malty and rich with dark fruit - raisin, fig, cherry, rum, booze. Taste is astringent to start and gets progressively ripe - starts grapey and tart, then cherry, rum, booze, banana, nutmeg to finish. Bubbly palate suits the beer. "Love" would be too strong a term, but its very good.

The stage lights go up the curtain is drawn and centre stage is a glass of Ruby brown Ale with a one finger, off white foamy head that melted slowly to a thin layer. As she spins in the glass her aromas emanate filling airwaves with malty dark fruits, a note sweet caramel and a hint of herbs. Enticed by this you notice her rounded and smooth body, with a good carbonation giving a swanky mouthfeel. She continues her performance with gathering intensity but as you taste her delights she is dryer than expected. A bitter twist to her performance given by hard hitting herbs that challenges, her promise of malty fruits make little appearance, there is no reprise of the sweet fruity promise just unrelenting dryness. Like the dark talented artiste she is you were duped and drawn into her deception and yet you still just want to drink deeper of this mordant biting babe.

FB group "The Beer Journal"

Une brune foncée bien opaque, une mousse moyenne de couleur crème à la surface, texture mi-épaisse et assez pétillante. Nez de vin et de sucre dorge, avec des fruits rouges. Bouche plus sèche que prévue, moins ronde, mais les saveurs en font un classique : caramel, fruits séchés et encore du sucre dorge. Elle est peut-être un peu trop carbonatée, ce qui coupe quelque peu sa richesse. Pas la meilleure trappiste ni la meilleure dubbel du monde, mais sa belle complexité et ses saveurs justes réussissent à charmer.
Bouteille achetée chez Intercaves. Bulles persistantes, parfums fruités mais final trop sec.
Glas. Dark red brown beer. Small head. Aroma is caramel, malt, sweet. Taste is the same. Too sweet for my taste.

Bottle as gift. Pours dark ruby-brown with big beige foam head. Aromas start as barley sugars softening to treacle toffees. Freshly dug earth, brown bread and apple juice. Flavour of caramel, a light lemony presence and an earthy bitter hop finish. A cracking sharp bubbly body. It has a cola-drink moreishness but swaps the sickly, syrupy body with a hugely refreshing light citrus finish.
Banana caramel yeasty flavours. Dark brown colour, cant see through it. Sweet soft taste.

Brown coloured with reddish hints if seen through light. Light yellow coloured creamy head, average, decent persistence and lacing. Aroma has brown sugar, strong fruity esters (expecially ripe banana) and a touch of pricklyness/pepper. Average intensity. Taste is dominantly sweet with toffee malts, brown sugar, fruity notes (slight dark fruits but mostly banana) and pretty much no bittering counterpart. Also a slight hint of spiciness. Fairly intense. Medium bodied with average to high carbonation, slightly creamy. Overall a fair beer, a tad too much on the sweet/banana side for my taste.
Det er en god øl .. der en ikke så meget mere at sige. Måske "er der mere?" Køb når de er på tilbud...
Trübes rotbraun mit reichlich Schaum. Malzig, etwas Karamell, fruchtig, reife Bananen, leicht cremig, sehr süffig.

Pours a dark opaque brownish red, with a large bubbly head. Aroma has notes of fruity esters, most noticeably ripe bananas, and some peppery yeast.Tasting notes include banana, pear, and slightly bitterness with a dry finish. Excellent beer!!!
Very dark brown with a light tan head. Dark fruit flavor and aroma. Very digestible.

Pours very dark reddish brown with a thick tan head that recedes leaving lacing but never goes away. Aroma is malty. Taste is slightly bitter with notes of dark malt, plums, tobacco, and plenty of yeasty flavours including spices, banana and basement. Creamy, medium bodied mouthfeel and medium carbonation.

Wielki plus za to, że nie było gorzkie. Słodkie też niespecjalnie, ale dobre. Ładny aromat, ogólnie taki przeciętniak - ani ziębi, ani grzeje, a to, że nie ziębi to już zdecydowany plus dla mnie. Spoko piwko

Bottle: 330 ml, Price: 1,27 eur
Labai tamsi raudonai ruda spalva, didelė puta. Labai geras skonis.

UPDATED: FEB 5, 2017 Bottle at home. Pours brown dark orange. Tastes like bread , sweet banana, toffee, sweet malts. Medium carbonation, long drinkability, great aftertaste. Soft, smooth and creamy. Lovely.

Aromat - dużo miękkiego karmelu, rodzynki, nuty słodowe kojarzące się z barleywine, banan raczej delikatny, na samym końcu nuta tytoniu.
Średnio niskie nasycenie. Śliwki, nuty tostowe, kompot z suszu. Długi wytrawny finisz. Goryczka średnio niska. Nieco pustawe.

Pours dark amber, small head. Aroma of dark fruits, raisins, figs, sweetness, caramel, banana, malt. Taste sweet, raisin, banana, bready notes, hint of spices. Medium body, sweet and slightly bitter aftertaste.

0,33 l bottle. Pours hazy brown with a finger of tan head. Aroma is malt, dried ripe bananas, fruity, some candied sugar. Flavor is similar - malty, fruity, dried fruit, slight alcohol, candied sugar. Light sweetness is complemented with light bitterness. Body is full, almost sticky texture, carbonation is medium. Finish is very long and dry. Highly drinkable.

Slightly fruity, yeast and overripe fruit. The taste is malty, yeast, alcohol and slightly bitter. Much carbonic acid. Okay bitterness that fills the mouth for a long time. Not a bad beer, but theres something special that does not quite fit. Follow me @ Kung av öl @ Facebook for more pictures and ratings.
UPDATED: MAR 28, 2017 highly drinkable dubbel. roasted malts, slightly caramel and chocolate taste.

Smells bread, malt. Creamy beige head. Taste is bread, malt, brown sugar. Some bitterness in the end. Well balanced. Slightly sour aftertaste. Very drainkable overall, but their tripel is slightly better.

Bottle. Ruby Red Brown in colour. Good creamy beige head. Fair lacing. Very Fruity; dark fruits, raisins, plums, prunes, cherries, banana notes. Very Malty; toasty bready malts, caramel, candy sugar, chocolate notes. Mildly spicy. Yeasty. Moderately hoppy. Great fruit/malt/hop balance. Sweet and sour very fruity malty and spicy throughout. Hoppy drying bitterness in the long finish. Complex. Enjoyed this. Terrific Abbey Dubbel! (2016-04-06)

Bursztynowo rubinowa barwa. Poprawna drobnopęcherzykowa piana.
W aromacie dominuje śliwka. Zapach achy słodowe.

W smaku wyczuwalny alkohol. Mocno nasycone, Koźlak.

UPDATED: JAN 20, 2017 330 ml bottle. Pours a clear copper with a beige head. Malty aroma of caramel, marzipan, brown sugar along with fruity notes - cherry and ripe apples and pears - and some alcohol. Medium to full body with a medium carbonation, a medium to heavy but not cloying sweetness and a light to medium bitterness. Taste of ripe pear with spices - cinnamon - brown sugar, some alcohol with a lightly bitter hoppy finish.

Bottle from Beerbods. Pours dark with generous foamy tan had. Sweet malty aroma, which is what you get on the taste. Good stuff, but lacking complexity and for a Belgian Dubbel its a little lightweight. Nice but not a big hitter.
Fine et délicate, pas de lourdeur, légère sur le caramel. Mousse épaisse au nez puissant. Une très belle double équilibrée dotée dune très belle longueur.

0.33 l bottle from Pivoteka, Zagreb. Clear dark amber, huge creamy off-white head. Nice dry fruits and toffee aroma, some spices. Light dry. Medium body, medium carbonation, moderate finish. Body a bit to thin, but aromas are nice.

Inconsistent beer. Ive had it on its own and its been superb, but drank with Rochefort 8 and it highlighted all the imperfections in this beer. Not dry enough. Not enough phenols. Still, great beer. Dont need to take you through the rest, because its all here.
Bottle. Dark brown color, tan foam. Complex aroma: caramel, toffee, cream, wine, dark raisins, dried fruits. Taste: wine, strong, toffee, dried fruits, caramel malt.

Brun i färgen. Jäst toner med skumbanan och godis. Möts upp med fyllighet från malt vilket skapar en lätt och trevlig öl

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bière brune sans trop de mousse, un arôme de grillé quon ne retrouve pas au goût. Assez pétillante, on e sent pas ce côté amer ou trop houblonné. Une biere que je recommande pour s initier aux trappistes et aux bières brunes.

It pours dark amber with reddish hues. There is a large head that is tannish in color. It has good head retention. There are aromas of dried caramel, toast, cherries and plums. There are hints of rose and spices in the nose as well. The flavors are highlighted by the raisin and dried cherry flavors with wonderful interplay from the caramel and toast. The balance is towards the malt with a low spicy hop flavor and low bitterness. It has a medium-full body that has a slight alcohol warming to it. It has a smooth texture to it with a dry finish. Overall the beer is highlighted by the complex interplay between the malts and fruity esters. There are pleasant spicy notes and bitterness from the hops.

Donkerrood/bruin, lichtbruine schuimkraag die snel zakt.
Aroma: Rood fruit, zelf een licht zuurtje, wijnachtig. Ook fruitige tonen van banaan vanuit de Gisting. 
Smaak: Fruitig, gedroogd fruit, zoet, karamel, rozijnen, en ook een bessen achtig zuurtje.
Zoete mouten, fruitige esters/banaan vanuit de gist. Florale hopbitter...iets kruidig.
Heel mooi in balans......veel smaak.
Volle body, veel koolzuur prikkeling, afdronk is mooi lang fruitig en bitterzoet. 
Prachtig bier!

Bottle. Ruby brown. Beautiful head with lots of lacing. Aroma of sugar, yeast, malts and red fruits. Taste is caramell, plums, malts, sugar and dried fruits. Highly carbonated. Sweet and some hoppy bitterness in the aftertaste. Creamy and oily mouthfeel. Very balanced and delicious.
Donker Bordeaux met licht beige schuimkraag. De geur is overweldigend zoet. De smaak is suikerig en eindigt heel bitter. Voor mij te zoet en te bitter.
complex malty aromas. dark brown in color with huge long lasting light brown head. taste malty and fairly dry with notes of dark caramel malts, raison, and plum.
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer.
Bottle. Clear dark amber pour with small tan head. Aroma had grapes and light malt. Taste is balanced with light sweet malt

Fiel a una Dubbel trapense, tiene el aspecto que esperas de este tipo de birras al abrirlas: color marrón rojizo muy oscuro y gran cabeza de espuma beis.
Aroma a caramelo, pasas, chocolate y a pesar de no ser demasiado alcohólica tiene ese punto licoroso que acompaña todo el rato.
Su sabor es delicioso. Regaliz, plátano y un combo café-chocolate que te deja muy loco. Su final comparte caramelo y un amargo muy personal y atrevido.
Se diferencia claramente de otras del estilo en que, sin perder textura aceitosa, tiene un cuerpo mucho más delgado y también en que a pesar de su doble fermentación en botella (y por tanto adición extra de azúcar) es menos dulzona que la mayoría. Resultado: una Dubbel trapense deliciosa y mucho más refrescante de lo acostumbrado.
De diez!!
Dark Brown with of white head. Nose is light caramel and some molass. Taste rich with sweetness and some rich malts. Palate is lastning and with some bitterness.

Aroma: malt, dominated by the smell of wheat and yeasts, a bit chocolate.
Appearance: brown, haze with small brown head.
Taste: malt, bread, fruits, chocolate, a bit bitterness in finish.
Palate: middle carbonation, full body.

Legacy rating.

LOVE this! Pours rich brown with deep head. Aroma fruity and yeasty with caramel, but quite savoury. Smooth finish.

Bottle. MId- intensive aroma- mainly banana and apricot. Dark red, clear with beige head, whick quickly disappears. In the taste. it feels a bit empty and wwatery- ok, therere some bananas, apricots and delicate maltyness in the aftertaste, but the alcohol is noticeable, the carbonation is high and its low-bodied. I respect this icon, but its not my kind of beer.

Cor marrom escuro com leve brilho rubi; espuma amarelada de alta formação, média persistência e quase sem lacing.
Aroma de frutas secas (ameixa, uva-passa e um toque de banana) com um toque licoroso.
Sabor inicial maltado seguindo o aroma com final seco, levemente amargo e alcóolico; retrogosto alcoólico com um leve toque amadeirado que aquece a boca.
Corpo leve e baixa carbonatação.

330ml Bottle: Pours a dark brown, reddish highlights with a frothy tan head that persists. Aroma of caramel, prunes and a slight alcohol note. Flavours of caramel, candy floss with a slight alcohol warmth, fruity. Big bodied with medium carbonation. Finishes sweet with a little hoppiness. Bitterness is medium to light. Overall a very nice beer, happy to have another.
Aroma is sweet, light cocoa, berries, alcohol and belgian yeast. Colour is dark. Very easygoing! Taste starting with yeasts, middle is light roasty cocoa, low bitter finnish. Good Beer
Bottle @ home. Aroma of caramel malt, dark fruits, esters. Light hazy brown with off-white head, lasting. Taste is moderate sweet and light bitter. Full body, oily feel and sweet malty finish.

Bottle approx. 1 year after bottling date. Beautiful dark beer with lasting thick head. Aroma: malty, plums, bread and a hint of alcohol. Taste the same: complex and very balanced with a pleasant bitter aftertaste ( burned malts? ). Not a one-taste-bomb but a subtle gem. Mouthfeel very nice: full bodied, soft carbonation, slight alcoholic tingle.

UPDATED: JAN 28, 2017 First time on tap at Herman, Berlin; at the time of review 33 cl. bottle at home. Almost black, opaque with a frothy beige head. Aroma is caramel, toffee, licorice, dark raisins, dry fruit. Fruity flavour (ripe fruits), malts and some alcohol. It has a well-balanced and pleasant savoury taste -- it is quite sweet with a light to medium bitterness. Full bodied and creamy textured. Carbonation is average, finish is long and bittersweet. It is a great beer to enjoy once in a while.
moutig en gezoet met gekarameliseerde suiker en aangenaam bittertje mooie balans mij persoonlijk iets aan de zoete kant
Aspetto scuro, schiuma cremosa fine e persistente. Aroma di maldo, caramello. Speziata.Tutti i sapori e i profumi concentrati in una birra. ECCEZZIONALE
33cl @ bottle. Aroma alcolico, aspetto scuro, inferiore rispetto alla tripel sempre di questa abbazia. In ogni caso ottimo rapporto qualità prezzo, una birra che si beve bene.

330 ml bottle from Theatre of Wine. Pours hazy brown with beige head, not lasting long. Aroma of caramel, marzipan, malt, slight alcohol. Taste is yeasty and malty, no bitterness, marzipan and dark fruits.Full-bodied, heavy, warm and smooth. Very good beer.

UPDATED: JAN 20, 2017 Jai re-testé ce breuvage, je remets une meilleure note avec le recul...

Par défaut, je mets toujours 5 à lapparence, car une bière cest avant tout des arômes, des saveurs, du plaisir gustatif... Bref, belle brune transparente avec des reflets grenat, surmontée dune mousse fine ivoire. Nez charnu, caramel, chocolat au lait, raisin sec, cassonade, sirop dérable, pain dépice, sirop de canne, pomme et poire cuites, vanille... Très gourmande ! Houblons et alcool très discrets, avec des effluves de mandarine, dorange... Carbonatation moyenne. En bouche, plus de sécheresse quattendue. Première gorgée brute avec une pointe damertume et dastringence qui persistent sur la deuxième. Saveurs minérales, longueur assez courte, je reste sur ma faim. Troisième gorgée qui confirme les précédentes, avec un arrière goût sur les céréales et toujours cette amertume qui colle au palet. La texture est un peu sur leau, elle gagnerait à être plus consistante. Lalcool est bien dosé mais trop peu exploité. Final sur les herbes, la terre, le bois, les levures. Pas une mauvaise bière du tout, mais pas forcément la meilleure Dubbel dabbaye. Je préfère nettement la Maredsous 8 ou la St. Bernardus Pior 8, voir la Chimey Red dans ce style... Bouteille 33cl, V&B Grenoble.

330ml bottle pours very dark brown with pale tan head. Remarkable aromas of caramel, dried fruit and bread. Tastes of ginger bread, caramel malt, molasses, fermented fruit, marzipan and alcohol. The complex layering and delicate balance make this beer very special. Long sweet finish with honey and fruit characters. Almost no bitterness. Cant wait to try again!

Nice brownish color small white head
Good smell of caramel slightly sourish.
Malty breadish and nicely sweet caramelised taste 
Light sweetness and grainy on the palate. finish slighty waterish
Very good !
Ottima dubbel, colore tonaca di frate con schiuma sottile. Aroma di malto, caramello, dark fruits. Al palato dolce, speziata, bel corpo. Carbonazione media.
Очень вкусный Бельгий& эль, красивы& цвет, хороший аромат и вкус, приятно& послевк& хорошая плотнос& качеств& пиво! Дата розлива 24.02.2016. (Bottle 0,33/ 7%)

I was looking forward to this one. I was a bit disappointed. 
Aroma - thick and malty.
Appearance - Dark slightly red/brown. The head was cream coloured and a bit dirty looking.
Taste - Malty a little sweet, a bit over sharp through the middle, longer finish.
Palate - A little oily
Overall - It was ok. Its not as good as I expected based on the scores I see here, but it might not be to my taste.
Grumlig brun öl med ett mörkbeige skum. Doft av fruktestrar, jäst, viss kryddighet och viss maltighet. I smaken tillkommer karamell och jästigheten är lättare än i aromen.

Pours dark brown with an off-white head, good lacing and medium carbonation.

Aroma is marshmallow, plums, ripe banana, marzipan, molasses, yeast and orange peel. Taste is sweet, unctuous and a touch thin for its ABV.

Nice dark abbey beer that got better as it warmed up.
UPDATED: NOV 16, 2016 Brown, good and beautiful head. Aroma is caramel, plums, bananas, nuts, dark fruits. Taste is spicy, caramel, plums, bananas, nuts, dark fruits repeats.

Bottle. Pours hazy mahogany, medium beige head, creamy with nice lacing. Aroma is a bit dusty, Belgian yeast, raisin, dig, cocoa. Flavor is light sweet, hint of tartness, dark fruits. Medium body. No banana. I used to like this a lot. Now, not so much. Where is the tartness coming from? Not what I remember. Bummer dude.

330ml bottle from The Beerhive.
Big off white head, nice lacing. Clear dark reddish brown body. Fruity, malty nose, some banana, pear, bread. Flavour is bread, yeast, banana notes, gentle fruity bitterness on the finish. Medium carbonation, good full mouthfeel, dry finish.
aroma is a great full bready smell, actually making me hungry. flavor drops the dough and gives a bit more of a floral flavor. a great wee taste.
Bottle to tulip. Spicy ester and liquid bread aroma. Mostly clear brown with tan head that quickly fades. Rich malt. Slight fruit. Dry finish.
Bottle at home. Pours dark brown with a huge beige head. Aroma has yeast, malts and banana. Taste is malts, banana and booze. Soft mouthfeel. Really nice.

Dégustée avec mon Appiantiqua.Jolie robe brune avec une mousse ivoire peu persistante et une bonne carbonatation.Le nez nous offre des odeurs de prunes,pruneaux et malts.La bouche nous amène sur des saveurs de fruits rouges,figues , banane...et nous laisse sur une belle douceur mêlée à une bonne amertume.Une très bonne trappiste avec beaucoup de "rondeur" pour une double!

UPDATED: OCT 14, 2016 Goûtée avec mon Kittenbieer dans un verre Kasteel.
Température de début 10 à 11 °.
Très belle robe brune surmontée dune mousse café au lait qui retombe assez vite; bonne carbonatation.
Nez très agréable sur le pruneau et les malts.
Goût dominé par une saveur de banane mais aussi de fruits noirs, le tout dans une belle harmonie.
Finale longue avec un parfait équilibre douceur/amertume.
Une très bonne trappiste et une excellente double.
16,5/20

Pours a deep brown on tap with fluffy tan head that dissipates to leave good lacing. Aroma of mild Belgian dark fruity esters, hint of chocolate and spice. Taste is the esters up front, spice in the middle, and then a dry burnt sugar finish. Soft carbonation, mild bitterness, really the best dubbel I may have ever had.

Very high in plums and dried cherries. Slightly spicy. Caramel. Bit of chocolate. Appearance acc. to description in bjcp style. A bit more brownish note in colour. Very raisinous, malty taste. Cloves. Follows aroma. Overall nice beer with a bit watery/dry finish in the end. I know it is said so, but..:)

Color marrón muy oscuro, casi negro, completamente turbio, con capa de espuma amarronada de dos dedos de grosor (buena retención, mejor de lo esperado). Carbonatación media (perfecta en boca) Aroma a levadura, frutal y floral. Sabor frutal, con algo como tostado por ahí perdido, con un deje de amargor (no tan dulce como esperaba). El alcohol no se percibe ni en aroma ni en sabor. No capto el plátano y no capto el final seco. Muy buena.
330my bottle. Dark brown with large beige head and plenty of lacing. Some sediments. Sweet taste.

Belle brune foncée. Mousse retombant vite. Nez : raisins, fruits noirs, chocolat, caramel et quelques effluves dalcool doux. En bouche, goûts de fruits rouges et sucres mais pas trop, quelques épices. Arrière-bouche un peu amère. Bon produit !

Big tan frothy head with very good retention.
Dark, coppery brown colour.
Aroma is dark ripe fruit (prune), caramel and yeasty.
Complex taste, bitter-sweet, dark fruit(prune), banana, toasted caramel, almond and cherry.
Yeasty, very trappist.

Bottle, 0.33l. Pours hazy, deep amber/brown body with thick, medium sized, lasting beige head. Smell is very pleasant, floral and fruity, a touch of sour cherry and vanilla. 

Full body with thick and oily texture. Carbonation is on the higher end, but really soft on the tongue. Really nice mouthfeel. Lovely balanced bittersweet taste. Rich and complex aroma - yeast, caramel malts, brown sugar, herbs, flowers, dark fruits and berries. Long finish with slight alcohol burn on the tongue.

Overall, delicious.

Tap. Pours clear reddish brown with beige head. Aroma has light malt, crystal malt, caramel, winegum and is slightly roasted with a sweet end to it. Taste is malty with light malts, caramel, toffee, winegum, roasted notes, a little grassy hops and is semi-sweet yet balanced. A great dubbel!

Bottle. Pours brown with a beige head. Aroma of classic sweet Belgian yeast, dark sweet fruits, toffee, vanilla and butterscotch. Taste is sweet and has gentle notes of hops. Dark fruits, caramel, fruity esters and a weak Spice note at the end. A good classic.

Bottle. Aroma of caramel, chocolate, nuts malts. Amber / brown color, cloudy liquid , rocky brown head. Moderate bitter, taste of nuts, caramel, fruit. Medium body, slick texture, fizzy carbonation, long light bitter finish. Nice beer

750ml bottle. Dark fruit and vineous aroma. Super malty and yeasty on the palate, almost zero bitterness, prunes and figs. Alcohol well hidden. Not my favorite style but I cant imagine it being executed better!

A dark fruit wine aroma. A close to pitch black with hint of ruby body. The head settles to a bubbly half inch or so. A dried fruit taste. Reminds me of heavy wine. Has bold tartness. Bubbly with clean warming finish.

Bottle till: 03/02/18
Batch no (?): 7 001751

No carbonation pour flat, smell is soury sulfurics, tastes flat, sour with loads of off flavors I cant even name. To the sink

Una trappist Dubbel de color caramelo oscuro y espuma suave con tonos ámbar. Su aroma es intenso a levadura con toques de plátano. Con sabor a frutos secos, caramelo y alcohol con un leve amargor final.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Espuma beige que permanece durante la cata, color chocolate bastante oscuro que no deja pasar la luz, se aprecia burbuja muy fina, rico aroma en nariz con notas dulces, sabor agradable con matices dulces y regusto persistente con notas amargas.

Barwa ciemno miedziana, piękna, długo utrzymująca się piana. W aromacie nuty rumowe, rodzynki. W smaku ciemne pieczywo, ciasto, trochę suszonych owoców. Trochę za wysokie wysycenie, wyczuwalny alkohol. Liczyłem na więcej.

- dunkelbraune Farbe mit guter, schnell zerfallender Schaumbildung
- Aromen nach geröstetem Malz, Dörrobst und etwas Karamell
- die Carbonisierung ist mir entschieden zu hoch
- geschmacklich ist von den Geruchsaromen dann leider nicht mehr viel
 übrig
- die Bitternote übertönt alles und lässt anderen Geschmacksrichtungen
 fast keine Entfaltungsmöglichkeiten
- im Abgang hinterlässt der hohe Kohlensäuregehalt ein unangenehm
 prickelndes Mundgefühl
Fazit: Eine bittere Kohlensäurebombe

Bottle traded from YantarCoast. Thanks a lot. Deep brown. Opaque. Dense off-white to tan head. Stays as a thick creamy layer on beer surface. The aroma unfurls with temperature rising. Vinous. Nice dark fruit. Prune. Candy. Light to medium body.Oily. The flavour is a model of the style. Very vinous, fruity, spicy from yeast, the sweetness is subdued properly. A bready note hides behind that mentioned luxury. Light bitterness makes the band sound perfect. A must try by any means.

A bottle from Jasons in the basement of 101, drunk at home. Aroma: malty, caramel. Appearance: dark, verging on black. Minimal tan head remains throughout. Palate: full bodied and creamy, soft carbonation, long finish. Taste: very complex, malty, theres some fruit in there at the end. I do believe this one actually tastes better than the tripel, but without the alcoholic kick. Lovely stuff.

Kolor ciemno rdzawy z rubinowym błyskiem, mętne. Piana obfita i utrzymująca się. W zapachu banan, karmel, rodzynki, czekolada. W smaku słodkie, głównie suszone owoce, banan, wiśnie, rodzynki, goździki, trochę przypieczonego ciasta, toffi i czekolady. Lekko odczuwalny też likierowy alkohol. Niska kwaśność owocowa. Pełne i bogate.
Карамел& но, как и все "бельги слишком дрожжев&

Bottle (and plastic glass in a Talys to Amsterdam : damn I love Belgium/Netherlands). Big creamy head, strong carbonation : a 1cm head lasted all along the drink! First nose is fruit, then caramel and dried fruit, but malt overall and a bit sour. Medium and long lasting bitter. Its one of the dubbel defining dubbel style, so yes... its a must drink!

Pullotettu 24.8.2011 ja parasta ennen 24.8.2013. Reilut 3 vuotta vanhaa tavaraa siis tarjolla. Keskiruskea samea olut hyvin pienellä ja nopeasti katoavalla vaahdolla. Maltaisen karamellinen, luumuinen ja tumman hedelmäinen tuoksu. Maultaan täyteläisen maltainen, makean karamellinen ja tumman hedelmäinen. Pehmeä kokonaisuus ja hiilihappoisuus selvästi taittunut ikäännyttämisen myötä.

UPDATED: AUG 11, 2016 Weinig aroma, bevat toetsen van gist, malt, beetje fruitig, noot. De smaak is fruitig en (artificieel) zoet, kruidig, caramel en koffie duidelijk aanwezig. Spijtig genoeg overheerst het zoete.

Aroma is dry, bananas, figs, wood, super dry, bitter. Appearance is dark brown, light brown head, hazy. Taste is dry, spice, wood, dark fruit, banana, bitter malt, robust even. Mouthfeel is medium body, light crisp carbonation, dry dark fruit and bitter malt aftertaste. Overall, this is good for a dubbel.

Pours brown with medium head. Aroma is caramel, cinnamon, croissant, fresh pie, some yeast. Taste is quite bitter, sweet, raisin, dried cherry, cinnamon, cardamom, nutmeg, caramel, some spices. Little bit more carbonisation than in average Belgian beer. Quite good one!
Bottle. Pours reddish brown. Malty and yeasty aroma with dried fruit. Well balanced sweet, sour and bitter. Good beer.
UPDATED: AUG 6, 2016 Clear, dark red with not much head. Strong aroma of malt, a dash of sour fruit. Tastes its strength. Rich fruit, malt, licorice, some dark chocolate, sourness in the aftertaste.
Opening one of these is like bringing on Christmas in the mouth, every time. Amazing

Brown color(22), medium/full body creamy texture long and light final bitter.
Very complex aromas of dry dark fruits, licor, coffee and cocoa powder.

Very dark brown. Malty caramel and dried fruit constitute the aroma and flavour, in addition to the spicy yeast. The taste is rich and sweet, with a dry and lightly bitter finish. Medium body, with high carbonation. Overall, a very good dubbel. I really appreciate this style, which is fantastic when done right. Westmalle Dubbel is tasty, complex, well balanced, drinkable - and one of the best of its kind.

Great beer. Great malt profile, great yeast profile. Love the body, weak bitterness that is perfect. Little Delirium Brussels.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Heerlijk bier, zowel koel in de zomer als op een koude winterdag! Zo hoort een dubbel te smaken.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Mörk brunröd till färgen. Luktar bröd, banan frukt. Smaken är lagom söt ingen bitterhet alls. Smakerna är lika som lukten.

Aroma of banana, dried figs, nuts, bread, some other fruits.
Great taste, sweet but not cloying, low bitterness. Flavor is pretty much the same as aroma.
Great beer

Pours a burnt amber brown color with a khaki head. Caramel, toffee, molasses, raisin, date, banana, clove, biscuit and yeast aroma and flavors. Medium body and lively carbonation. Caramel, toffee and yeast finish.
UPDATED: JUL 18, 2016 Bottle. Shared with JD and Olesen. Nose of bread and peanuts. Taste is mild but sparkling. Not so long lasting. OK beer, maybe better with food.
330ml. Bottle. Shared with junes and Chris. Medium head fast diminishing. Semi lacing. Sweet aroma and taste. Fine beer
Noir et rouge, goût de réglisse, épices et caramel...sucré et longue en bouche. Très agréable...jaime
Brown color. Overripe bananas, yeast and fruit aromas. Sweet fruits, banana, brown sugar, yeast flavors. Dry finish, some hops.
UPDATED: APR 20, 2017 Karmel, owoce, czekolada, wyczuwalny alkohol. Nieco cierpkie, zbyt lekko się pije, nie powala treściwością. Nieprzyjemnie wysokie wysycenie.

Aroma: fruits, caramel, bubblegum, banana, yeast. Very little hints of alcohol.
Appearance: brown color, it seems hazy but its too dark to know, thick tan-to-brown creamy head with low retention (probably because its alcohol volume).
Taste: medium-to-high sweetness, low bitterness, very light sour.
Palate: medium body, creamy texture, average to lively carbonation, efervescent effect in mouth, long bitter and slightly sour finish. Maybe too dry.
Overall: sweet caramel fruity spicy flavor, with nice mouthfeel and very nice appearance. Good beer.

Nez tout plein de levures, de caramel, dépices (dominante cannelle, un peu réglisse).
La bouche ne triche pas. Leffervescence, la levure et les épices lui donnent un joli petit caractère explosif en bouche. Le caramel se retrouve dans la longueur, très douce et ronde.
Köpt på flaska i Brugge. Mörkbrun färg med smutsvit skumkrona. Doft av torkad frukt, farinsocker och mörk sirap. Mediumsöt och torr kropp. Smak av sirap, anis, daddlar, karamell och torkade frukter.
Flaska snabbköp, brygge. Mörkbrun kulör. Doft av torkad frukt, övermogna äpplen och säd. Knäckig smak med nötig karaktär. Torkad frukt och lite kaffe. Lätt torr avslutning.

Obfita piana, która redukuje się do ładnej cieniutkiej warstewki. Kolor piwa czarny z jasniejszymi przebłyskami. W zapachu fenolowo, bananowo,, suszone owoce. lekko alkoholowo ale do dobrze to sie komponuje ze sobą. Wysoko wysycone. Raczej pełne. W smaku ładnie przykryty alkohol, chociaż go czuc, znowu owoce, banany. Goryczka raczej srednia. W ustach bardzo sliskie, przez co dosc przyemnie sie je pije. Troche przegazowane.

330ml bottle. Marks and Spencer. Dark red with a beige head. Aroma is predominantly banana, with sweet caramel and brown sugar. Some alcohol and bread. Tastes sweet with a light bitterness and a dry light spicy finish. Very nice.

Bottle from Alko. Pours very dark brown with beige head. Aroma and taste are both fruity and malty, and also have a bit of licorice. Taste is also soft and bitter. Alcohol is well hidden, and the finish is sweet instead of tasting strongly alcohol.

Bottle @ Friends/chef. Appearance: pours clear copper-brown with good tan soapy head and lacing. aroma/taste: caramel, bread, chocolate, brown sugar, light dried fruit and spices. palette: medium malty and yeasty aroma, average to sparkling carbonation, medium body, medium to notable sweetness, balanced by a medium bitterness, average duration and an oily texture. overall: smooth and well balanced dubbel.

This brew is smooth and fine. I really wish it was mine. However I am terrible at making comments so in making up time.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours ruby with dense tan head. Some bitterness when cold but balances out when it warms up. Less of the estery flavour than other trappists. Short finish.  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android

Chocolate, toffee, raisins, plums, liquorice, ripe bananas on the nose. Chocolate, caramel and toasted malt flavors. Full body, but a dry finish with a pronounced bitterness which surprises the palate. One of the best dubbels i have ever tried

Gyenge, gyorsan eltűnő hab. Homályos, lebegő üledékekkel teli, szép barna szín. Erősen szénsavas, kissé karamelles. A háttérben leheletnyi pörkölt, feketecsokis jelleg. Enyhe tapadósság érezhető. Utóízében komlós fűszeresség, kis keserűsséggel. Naná, hogy testes.

20160605 Home; 33 cl bottle; BB 20180310: A rubbish dark beer, which clear and have a crème thin foam layer. A smell of dark malt. Little chocolate and fruity (raisins, prums). A taste of sweet brown malt, somewhat chocolate, dark fruit (raisins, grape). In the somewhat sticky aftertaste we find a bitterness from mainly dark malt but also from aromatic hops. The body is medium and the carbonisation is somewhat high.

0.33 l bottle. Dark brown, almost black color, beige head. Fruits, malts and sweet alcohol in aroma. The taste is quite the same, but the alcohol is well hidden. The finish is quite short. Medium to heavy body.
0.33 l bottle. Pours clear brown colour with a medium head. Aroma has chocolate. Taste has also chocolate with warm smooth taste of malts. This is really not sweet but not bitter either.

33cl bottle. Very dark ruby-brown pour with a tall beige head. Chocolate, dried fruit, grapes, caramel, overripe banana. Dry finish, medium body with medium to hight carbonation and a lively chocolate-bitter aftertaste.

Mörk brun färg. Malt, kryddor, torkad frukt, jäst. Smakar mycket men lent och är relativt lättdrucken. Mycket god

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Dried fruits, malts, reddish with a huge and persistant tan head, medium body, medium carbonation, bitter for the hops, spices and malts, fruits in the aftertaste...a solid dubbel, not the best for me but this is trappist quality.

A 330ml bottle with a best before date of 24th July 2016 and poured into a Chimay goblet glass. It poured a dark brown colour with a slight reddish hue and a two finger beige head that slowly settles to a nice thin but creamy puffy layer while leaving nice curtain lacing. Strong dark fruit aromas with cherry, plum, prune, raisin, grape and a hint of banana, toffee and caramel in the background. Some toffee and caramel flavours before a blast of lightly sweet dark stone fruits, cherry, plum, grape, fig and raisin. Dry, medium to full bodied with moderate to high carbonation. Overall an excellent Dubbel, excellent beer. Nice complexity and balance in the aromas and taste and is definitely a must buy beer for me.
bottle @ antwep. dark brown color heavy body, malty but some fruit aroma, quite good belgian abbey beer

UPDATED: NOV 11, 2016 This is my first Belgium beer. Malty smells with interesting yeast spice. Complex tastes of both malts and yeast. Lovely texture. I will elaborate further after another, ( note to self)  yes this is good still, took a couple sips but now Im all in. Vimto like fruits, meaty malts, long sweet finish. Yeast esters and sweet malts.
One of the best Belgian type beer for me. Cakes and chokolat , very balanced beer.

Bottle. Dark brown colour with small lasting head. Aroma is fruity yeasters, mostly pear, dried fruits and som malty notes. Taste is the same, but dominated by the malt. A good dubbel, but not the best....

0,33l bottle out of Craftbeer Calendar. I hate it when a beer foams over on opening the bottle....Anyhow, the beer is malty, accompanied by a nice fruitiness and followed by a lightly bitter finish. Well-balanced, the alcohol is not noticeable.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Dubbel muy buena. Tiene un poco más de gas de lo habitual. Cuerpo medio. Al final deja un sabor a caramelo.
Helder donkerbruin bier met matig schuim. Weinig aroma. Ietsje tintelend in de mond met een vleugje zoethout. Smaak ebt snel weg.

Tasted from the pint bottle. Nice head that lasted a long time. Dark bronze color. Nose was caramel, malt and hops plus a little fruity. Rich full mouth feel. Delicious malt, hops and caramel flavor. Enjoyed a lot!

F Avey---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Nice frothiness to it. A very dry taste with a treacle finish. Its a little too carbonated for me but pretty decent. Sharp with just the right amount of sweetness. Good dubbel.

Another superior Trappist beer! This dubbel poured an amber brown color with minimal haziness and a thin white head, featuring a strong fresh aroma of caramel malt and fruity notes of sweet raisin and fig. The flavor likewise was predominantly an excellent rich bready maltiness, with various expressions of tropical yeast accents. Distinct notes of honey without any sugary sweetness. Although the beer itself didn't seem overly carbonated, there was a distinct fizziness to the palate which detracted from the flavor. Still had a pleasant and fresh presence to it, unlike the more rustic musty notes that seem common to abbey ales. Finished with a refined toasted malt bitterness. Quite an enjoyable culinary experience!

Served in a tulip glass from a bottle. Pours a deep ruby-brown colour with thick slowly diminishing tan head, leaving medium lacing behind. Aroma is vinous with notes of banana, honey, alcohol, bread, yeast and malts. Taste is also vinous with bready and malty notes, the alcoholic notes are very clear all the way through. Very well balanced beer with medium body and low carbonation. Unfortunately, the distinctive presence of alcohol from start to finish has somewhat ruined it for me.

Tasted from keg at Charlie Ps in Vienna. Tried bottle before, but from tap it was really something special
Full bodied, rich and very smooth. Brillant
Bottle (11.2oz) : Dark brown, big tan head. Aroma is sweet, candy like. Taste is Carmel, Belgian yeast. Pretty high carbonation. A little syrupy.
Aikaslailla alkoholinen. Lenkin jälkeen saunassa ei välttämättä ole muutenkaan oikea paikka.

0.33 l bottle from Alko Lohjantähti, Lohja. Clear brown colour with OK head. Aroma has chocolate. Taste has also chocolate with warm smooth taste of malts. This is really not sweet but not bitter either.

Dark amber wqith off white head - Dark malt aroma with dark fruity and yesty tones - Dark amlt and fruity body with some spicy fruity yeasty flavours - The malt and the spicy yeasty flavours goes into the finish - This was good

Ruby-dark color, big creamy head. Smell of breadcrust, malt. Body is rather low, finish is quite hoppy and bitter. More than in my memories for this bottle. Too much, but this leads to a refreshing character. Alcohol is well hidden. I´m missing the dried fruits, caramel, raisin part. Somewhat thin. BBF Sept. 2017.

Escura, opaca. Espuma bege abundante de longa duração. Aroma adocicado de ameixas. Sabor adocicado, ácido, com notas de ameixas, madeira, café, melado, alcaçuz, chocolate, banana e especiarias. Retrogosto amargo de café.

UPDATED: APR 13, 2016 Cloudy chestnut caramel colour, nice beige top. Average carbonation. Slightly thin body for Dubbel, but refreshing. Some plums, hops, honey, dark fruits, but none of the taste is dominant, the same is with Trippel Westmalle. That means this beer is distinctively well balanced. Westmalle Dubbel is a dark Trappist beer with a secondary fermentation in the bottle.

Aroma of wine, raisins, alcohol and chocolate. Pours a dark brown color with a rocky beige head. Taste also of wine, raisins and chocolate. Present is also a sour taste and a sharp bitterness, but very short aftertaste. Moderate body, smooth texture, low carbonation and strong alcohol.
Leaving the yeast glass (lovely on its own) served in its proper glass. Lovely dark strong beer. One of my all time favourites.

UPDATED: APR 6, 2016 Mocny aromat, ciemne s?ody, pumpernikiel, banan, d?emy z czerwonych owoców. Kolor - ciemnoczerwony wpadaj?cy w br?z. W ustach nuty toffee, banana, nowofalowej kwaskowej kawy, pieprzu, potem typowe dla "belgów" gruszki i jab?ka. Umiarkowane wysycenie, krótki wytrwany finisz. Bardzo dobre.

Degustate in bottiglia da 75 centilitri. Allaspetto impeccabile, un retrogusto leggermente amarognolo. Liquorosa, bouquet di odori poco vario: caffè e cioccolato. Eccellente birra belga tradizionale pastosa corposa decisa. Una birra per chi ama i sapori decisi non le vie di mezzo.

Aroma: caramel, dough, toast, raisins, banana, some gentle spices, fruity. 
brown, hazy, off - white foam, good retention.
light sweetness, lightly bitter, some gentle alcohol, raisins, banana, fruity, toast. 
medium body, slick feel, average carbonation, long finish that is slightly sweet and gently dry. 
Overall a nicely balanced dubble with a bit too much sweetness for its own good and too little of the claimed dryness. Enjoyed the fruitiness though.

UPDATED: DEC 26, 2016 Bottle at home. Beautiful dark brown colour, big foamy beige head that keeps a nice lacing. Nicely spicy, roasted malty, dried fruity, caramel notes in the nose and taste: nicely balanced. Lively carbonation, medium body.Re-rate, 26.12.16: big bottle, 2014 ed from Nationale Bierbank. More cloudy, little more chestnut than dark brown, head?s still nicely creamy and stable. Aging adds a great complexity to the malty and yeasty notes, more grainy, bread, dough, dry, even a bit funky: especially the sweetness mellowed out, but very tasteful. Medium body and carbonation. Great!

Pours dark brown with a tall white lacy head. Rich aroma of caramel, fermented fruits, liquor and typical Belgian yeast spices. Very thin watery body. Taste is rather bleak with a mix of watered down caramel, roasted notes and yeast spiciness. When the beer gets warmer more caramel appears with pronounced and rather unpleasant alcohol and some dank hops. A very disappointing beer that doesnt come even close to the hype surrounding it. There are much better dubbels to enjoy even among the more popular Belgian and Trappist breweries.
UPDATED: MAR 30, 2016 Cerveja belga, de coloração marrom, excelente aroma e sabor adocicado dos maltes.
Dark red with medium head. Aroma of caramel and dried fruits. Taste is sweet, spicy, with some roasted malts and alcohol.
Another delicious brew from brian...to bad i had to share...i would love to enjoy a whole bottle to myself.tons of flavor...really nice.

UPDATED: APR 5, 2016 Absolutely delicious when served not too cold and after allowing the lively carbonation to ease. Rich, dark dried fruit flavours and a little booze on the nose. Perfectly warming!
Red-brown color with medium tan head. Fruity aroma with brown sugar and malt. Medium body. Complex flavors, red fruits, frothy malt, chalk, esters, moderately sweet. Really good.

Pours deep dark opaque brown with an almost soda-like dark tan head - almost looked like a thick coca-cola. Dissipated over a couple minutes leaving minimal lacing. Aroma is sweetened coffee, dark chocolate, hints of caramel and roasted nuts and maybe even a little leather. Taste is dark yet sweet fruits supported by coffee and caramel chocolate undertones. Theres an immediate bitterness that lingers to a black coffee aftertaste. The palate is creamy and a bit viscous but is cut nicely by lively carbonation. Its a big beer, great for sipping. Only one is needed. I like this and appreciate it as a great beer, but personally dont love it.
330ml bottle from Bochka in Moscow. Pours dark brown with a frothy beige head. Aroma is banana, dark fruits. Taste is dark fruits, spice, mild bitterness.

Pours dark copper color. Sparkling, quickly disappearing head. Aroma of fresh wood, plums. Taste of malts, caramel, dried fruits (banana). Nice quite fizzy carbonation, which comes up especially in aftertaste. Pretty light body, becomes a bit watery in the end. Easily achievable, easily drinkable, balanced, more than decent dubbel.

Bread and fruit aroma, dark brown color, toffee and caramel flavor, medium to full body, heavily carbonated and alcoholic kick

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a hazelnut brown color with a beautiful, huge, fluffy head, which maintains a solid coating even after a couple of minutes. 

Smells of ripe red apples, a hint of honey, toffee and dusty wood. A subtle earth addition mingles into the profound apple sweetness, evoking apple pith qualities, perfectly complimented by the honey.

Has a higher carbonation with a still enjoyable smooth, soft mouthfeel to it. 

Tastes of earth and toffee coated red apples, together with a raisins quality and a hint of bakers chocolate. Produces a leafy dryness, evoking more earth and a mix of honey and caramel sweetness, creating an intriguing balance. Apple pith, plack peppers and cardamom spiced up hops build the finish of this surprisingly hoppy beer, creating a clean, enjoyable ending.

Extremely well put together, creating a great drinking experience full of fruits, honey and a rustic malt character. Its sweetness is far away from dominating the taste, as for its herbal dryness, blending perfectly into the rich, earthen malts.
Dark brown color with beige head.Pleasant aroma of yeast,plums and hops. Malty taste with sweet caramel,bananas and dark fruits. Slightly bitter, finishes long. Very nice

Pours clear dark copper brown with big creamy long lasting light brown head. Aroma is grain, toasted, molasses, banana, date. Light sweetness, medium bitter, average long rather dry bitter but fruity aftertaste. Body is medium, palate is mostly watery, carbonation is good.

Brun, reflets rubis.

Jai été surpris par la légèreté.

Le nez est très bon : caramel, chocolat, banane.

Bien fait, équilibré mais assez léger tant au nez quaux saveurs, le corps est assez fluide, peu dalcool, peu de torréfaction, petite amertume, et pas sucré ni liquoreux du tout.

Caramel, malts, quelques arômes de bananes il est vrai.

Trop léger à mon goût mais cest peut être le style "double belge dabbayes qui veut ça".

Bon quand même.
Dark murky reddish brown. Brown sugar, raisins, some hops and cola. Nicely balanced, not too sweet. Nice palate with moderate carbonation. Wonderful dubble.

Bottle at home. Pours brown with a frothy, quite big white head. Average lacing. Aroma of malt, yeast, biscuits, phenols, a bit of fruits as well. Alcohol well hidden, balance is leaning towards the sweeter side, carbonation isnt very high. Medium body. Nothing extraordinary but very good anyway
33cl bottle. Pours hazy dark brown, medium sized tanned head. Aroma has yeast, hops, plums, caramel malts. Medium to heavy sweetness, medium bitterness.

Stabil tyk skum, mørkebrun klar, tørrede frugt dufte, fyldig smag med god alkohol og fed malt fylde, virkelig en god dubbel

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bouteille. Nez fruité (raisins, léger de prunes et de cerises noires, notes de mûres et de pommes), malté de caramel rôti et léger de sucre brun, épicé (clou de girofle, notes de poivre) avec des effluves dalcool doux (rhum) et des notes de chocolat. Rondeur moyenne en bouche avec un pétillement moyen et une texture crémeuse (notes vineuses). Goût de levures assez fruitées et sucrées aux faibles notes sûres (raisins aux notes vineux, léger de cerises noires et notes de prunes et de pommes sucrées) et moyennement épicé (clou de girofle) lors de lentrée en bouche auquel se rajoute un goût malté de caramel sucré, léger de toffee (petites notes de rôti terreux) avec des notes de sucre brun et une finale moyennement amère dalcool doux liquoreuse (rhum, notes vineuses) avec des notes de houblon herbeux, de poivre et de chocolat noir. Arrière-goût long aux notes sèches, moyen-léger amer dalcool doux et de houblon (notes de rôti) avec une aigreur fruité (moût de raisins, de cerises et de prunes) avec de faibles notes herbeuses. [notes 2006l]

Donkerbruin bier met beige schuimkraag. Geur: Geroosterde mout, kandij, gedroogd fruit, sinaasappel. Smaak: zoetig  bitterig, brood, karamel, fruitig, pruimen en vooral sinaasappel. Medium koolzuur. Wat bitterheid in de afdronk. Een klasieker onder de dubbels.
Very nice belgian beer, quite heavy and round. With quite a long finish that leans towards the sweeter side.

On tap. Deep copper red-brown with a white dense head. Aroma is sweet and has some syrupy notes (though I would have liked someting else than the ubiquitous trappist beer glass, being too wide they dont collect the aroma well). Taste is rich and full of pleasant malty notes with ripe stone fruit - thinking about pears, apples and some peach. Long-lasting finish.
Belle mousse blanche, couleur brun rouge, arôme et goût caramel, épices, sucres. 33 Cl Oostduinkerk

Dark brown colored, hazy, small creamy tan head, not very lasting. Aroma is of brown sugar, roasted malt, chocolate, some spice, dried fruits. Taste is medium sweet brown sugar, toast, chocolate, some spices and dried fruits. Medium+ bodied, fizzy carbonation, creamy. Somewhat overcarbonated for my liking.
From elcervecero. In La Trappe chalice. Watching Sons of Anarchy 7x13. Good aspect and smell. Taste is not bad but it It has a subtle sourness that makes me not fully enjoy it.
Butelka 0,75l w domu. Lekko słodowe, mocno gazowane. Słodko-wytrawne, trochę kwaśne. Lekko czekoladowy posmak, goryczka średnia, raczej gorzkie.

Very nice all around, this pours a hazy, very dark mahogany with massive pillow of tan foam that grows for several minutes following the pour. Aromas are yeasty, slightly sweet ripened fruits, and some bread malt. Flavor is similar though less sweet than expected. Very balanced with an earthiness in the middle and a slightly dry finish. Great dubbel, but didnt blow me away in any particular regard.
Bottle 0,33cl. Very brown black color, and cloudy/hazy. Bread and coffee malt. Almost no head, it dissapeared after several mins. Can feel the bitterness in the very end which is long lasting.
Bottle. Off white head. Mahogany body. Cherries, oak, blackcurrant, alcohol. Bittersweet and sour. Dry finish, Fizzy mouthfeel.
330ml bottle. Dark reddish brown in colour with a creamy off white head. Caramel, fruit and a hint of vanilla. Subtle but very moreish

bottle: thin foamy head, no lacing. Wonderful aroma, a bit lighter body than expected. If there is a bad Trappist beer I haven´t found it yet...as I recall I prefer the Trippel a bit more but the Dubbel is a solid beer in its own right.
UPDATED: MAR 11, 2016 Backlog, early amateur rating! @ Havregatan 20130301. Bottle from Systembolaget. Fruity and caramely, sweet.

From 0.33L bottle. Pours murky, dark brown with a huge, light brown head. Heavy malty aroma, dark bread, dark chocolate, slightly coffee. Slightly yeasty aroma, dough. Also dark fruits like raisin recognizable. Slightly sweet initial taste, full flavor of roasted malts and a bit coffee. Moderate bitterness and very slightly acidic. Long finish, slightly bitter, also slightly sweet aftertaste. Medium to full bodied with a good carbonation. Creamy mouthfeel with a slightly dry finish.
Burberry aroma. Dark coffee color, head quickly goes away. Found it a bit more simple. Taste goes away quite quickly leaving same candy and Burberry aftertaste

Bue une première fois 1 an APRES date de péremption : douce , on ne sent pas lalcool. Très spéciale, sent le vin et le raisin sec, et à un goût que je ne sais pas décrire. Top! Cest celle-ci que je note.
Bue une seconde fois 1 an et demi AVANT date de péremption : brune beaucoup plus dans les standards. Toujours cette odeur de raisins sec mais plus le goût de vin en bouche. Moins douce. Paraît plus sombre que la 1ere fois. Bonne mais mieux vaut la garder 2 ans en cave (voire plus ?)
Some banana, yeast and sweet malts on aroma.Sparkling. Even a lottle light bodied. Aroma is stronger than taste. Good one.
Sødlig og let maltet. En del kraft fra alkoholen. En klassiker som skal nydes en stille aften.
Taste balance, little bitter, the body is full, slick texture, malt is good, many bubbles.
Mooi donker bier met een goeie schuimkraag. Een volle smaak, subtiele geur en een fijne, lichtdroge nasmaak. De beste dubbel die ik ken.

Dark ruby brown. Fruity earthy smell. Light fruit flavor very earthy taste.
Full and well carbonated. Great beer in the style. Strong flavors.
Flasche in Herman Beer Bar in Berlin. Aroma leicht malzig, Schoko. Geschmack: Etwas süß, etwas bitter. Geschmack von Bitterschokolade, rauchrig

Bottle: with two labels but no information about hop and malt in detail,
Not hoppy and I can not feel fruits, light bitter, a very good long dry finish

(I have a 0.75l bottle with batch 04 01717, best-before date 11.09.2016 and bottled on 11.09.2014)

Bottle from Appellation Wines. Pours deep reddish brown. Lovely fruity aromas, lots of fresh banana. The fruit is present in the taste and brought into balance with bitter toastiness from the malts. Lovely smooth texture and a long finish.

Pours dark brown with a red hue and a dissipating off-white head. The aroma contains brown bread, dough, sugar, roasted malts, raisins.Tastes medium sweet and medium bitter, with a rather pleasant dry and dough-like finish. Enjoyable palate. Lively in carbonation and full in body. Warming alcohol just like its blonde brother. Excellent to have with your meal (esp. red meat).

Bottle to tulip. Dark brown near opaque. Bubbly head that is effervescent. Highly carbonated. Nose is burnt sugar, prune, banana. Sweet dried fruit up front with malty mild spicy overtones; prickly carbonation / surprising hop bitterness on the back end.
Bottle 33cl. Deep dark brown, syruppy with a sturdy off white head. Sweet aroma of sugar and malts. The taste starts mildly sweet, but quickly develops a bitter undertone. Nice!

Kolor : Głęboko miedziany. Bardzo słabe przebłyski w czerwonym odcieniu. 
Piana: Żółta, drobna i wcale nie jest taka najgorsza (jak na Belga).
Utrzymuje się umirkowanie długo, dobrze krążkuje i okleja kielich puszystą kołderką. 
Zapach: Bardzo złożony. Baza podkładowa to ciemne owoce : śliwki, figi, ciemne winogrona.
Na kolejnym pięterku trochę słodkich dodatków: karmel, toffi, syrop cukrowy i alkohol.
W dalekim tle można doszukać się nawet czekoladowych nut.
Oczywiście nie sposób zapomnieć o przyprawowych fenolach (których jest mnóstwo) oraz drożdżowości. 
Smak: Połączenie ciemnych owoców (śliwki, rodzynki, daktyle) z przyprawami (szczególnie pieprz).
Smaki chmielowe niewyczuwalne.
Bogata słodowa baza, balans wyraźnie w kierunku słodu.
Goryczka niska do średniej.
Alkohol miękki, rozgrzewający i nie dominuje.
Piwo jest dość pełne, treściwe.
Wysycenie: Średnie do wysokiego. 
Podsumowanie: 

Jest to najlepszy obecnie ogólnodostępny Dubbel na świecie i swoisty wyznacznik stylu.

Westmalle Dubbel jest piwem którego powtórna fermentacja odbywa się w butelce (kondyncjonowanie w butelce).
Piwo jest warzone w belgijskim klasztorze Westmalle od 1856 roku.

Cechuje go złożoność smaku z charakterystycznymi śliwkami, rodzynkami daktylami.
Lekka pieprzowość oraz rozgrzewający alkohol przypomina nam z jakiej klasy trunkiem mamy do czynienia.
Piwo jest treściwe, smaczne i bardzo szlachetne.
Azúcar moreno, ciruelas maduras. Maltosa. Poco gasificada. Muy equilibrada. Con más cuerpo ganaría.

Bottle. Pours a very dark brown with reddish highlights and a tall, mixed-grained, solid, light-brown head. Nose is molasses, dried ginger, brown sugar, dates, brown bread, black tea, and figs. Its plums and raisins up front, then dark bread and spices kick in; very much a Christmas pudding of a beer, but with a certain monastic restraint. Think of it as a good, balanced Christmas pudding. The plum sticks around on the finish, becoming stronger yet staying restrained, proper, and focused. No booziness or blowsiness at all. For all those tripels that are all over the place -- this is the kind of delicacy and precision youre aiming for.
Brown with nice tan head. Lots of carbonation on pour. Aroma of sweet malt, dark fruit; has almost a wine-like scent. Taste: slightly sweet, not much bitterness, some yeast, alcohol, and malt.

33cl bottle, served in Trappist chalice. Poured a dark brown with one finger tan head. Aromas of caramel, raisins, banana, dates, vanilla. Taste pretty much a continuation of the aroma with bready, malty notes. Medium body, creamy and frothy in the mouth with a bittersweet and very dry finish. Overall a pretty good brew but the finish is just too bitter and dry to my taste.

Bouteille expirant le 10/04/16, donc vieillie 21 mois. Robe dun brun rougeâtre ne laissant filtrer quun mince filet de lumière. Col de mousse blanc plutôt dense et collant. Arômes de sucre candi, dattes, caramel salé, levures, baies foncées, pruneaux et épices festives. Nez intéressant, intense et dune complexité moyenne à élevée. En bouche, saveurs se baies foncée confites, sucre candi et caramel. Suivent des notes de dattes et houblons nobles. Longue finale où le malt saffirme et laisse sur le palais un goût à la fois âcre et sûr plus ou moins plaisant. Peut-être que le vieillissement commence à paraître. Je décèle également des saveurs de noisettes grillées. Texture légère pour le style et corps moyennement rond. Je vais devoir essayer une version plus fraîche mais ça reste une très bonne dubbel.
One of the more disappointing dubbels. The bitter and dark taste wasnt really my cup of tea.

Aroma: fruity and malty; Appearance: very dark amber with off white head that dissipates quickly; good lacing; Taste: very sweet and malty; fruity; nice complexity; Palate: heavy body with long, sweet finish; Overall: very nice; a little yeasty but not too bad; would buy again.

Pours a dark brown with a thick tan head and lots of lacing. Aroma of plum, raisin. Complex flavor of dark fruits; very tasty. Medium body with nice medium carbonation. Cant do much better than this for a dubbel.

0,33 bottle BB16/09/2015 so I assume at least 3 years old. As I have opened it gave a little gush which proved the re-fermentation had some residual effects still or at least the carbonation was not over. In fact the appearance is incredible: tick and never-ending ivory-brownish foamy head, retention. Reddish dark color. Nice! Nose: a parfume of dry fruit with predominance of dry plums, under spirit cherries, so rich and elegant. Mouth: the declination of the flavors due to the aging provides a balanced sweetness which does not disturb at all. Sadly it stays a bit too flat, really. Some reminiscence of the young version, less carbo but same mild bitterness. For me not good for aging but a great one anyway.

0.33l bottle. Dark brown color with big beige head. Aroma is full of fruits, raisins, apple, pear, nuts, banana, spices, bubblegum and chocolate. Taste is sweet with dominant fruit character. Medium to full body and chewy character. Overall its great beer and complex beer.
This beer was amazing first and foremost. Excellent head, flavor was unrivaled, color was perfect, and there was nothing I could find to criticize about this ale!
Uit de fles geschonken. Mooi donkerbruin bier. Aroma en smaak van mout, gedroogd fruit, caramel. Lekker fris door het aanwezige koolzuur. Zeer prettig drinkbare donkere trappist.

UPDATED: AUG 28, 2016 Como todas las trapenses, una cerveza de extremada calidad. Muy equilibrada y compleja. De muy buena entrada y apariencia. De todas sus hermanas creo que es la que mejor relación calidad-precio tiene. Indispensable.

Dark brown beer beer with a huge, long-lasting, cappuccino-coloured head. Aromas of herbal hops, ripe banana, green apple and toffee.Taste ist full of herbal schnapps, brown sugar, cherry and peppery yeast. Bitter-sweet overall. Long dry finish. Creamy/ sparkling texture, medium to heavy body, more than avarage carbonation.

Piwo o pieknej brubatnej barwie i palonej pianie ktora szybko znika. W zapachu dominuje alkohol i miod. Smak rekompensuje wszystko. Swieze nuty owocowe : banany i slodkawy miodowy posmak ktory nie zabija jednak walorow piwa. Jedno z lepszych na rynku.
Flaske. Farven er mørk ravgylden og skumkronen er lys gullig og fast. Aromaen er sødlig malt med gær og brød, og smagen er frugt, gær og banan.
Dark fruit, bready malt. Balanced fruity, grainy, brown sugar. Textbook dubbel. Lovely soft mouthfeel and looks marvellous as you swirl it in your glass.
A great Trappist ale. Dark and smooth. Strong honey notes. One of the best Trappists to be found.

Bottle from Whole Foods Market in Redwood City, CA. Aroma is sweet malts, cherries, bread, red bananas, some cola. Taste is malts, dark fruits with a herbal, bitter finish. Creamy mouthfeel. Cheers to my new son!

Di colore marrone scuro, tendente allebano, con lievi riflessi ramati, con schiuma di color avorio, fine e di lunga persistenza, croccante. Al naso presenta aromi molto fruttati (prugna e ciliegie sottospirito), note caramellate e insieme vinose e di legno. Al palato è ben carbonata, con un corpo ben strutturato. In bocca stesse note olfattive ma con caramello e melassa più decisi. Bevuta rotonda e piacevole.

Bottle from Drinkshop. In the aroma I got some skunkiness at first. Then it disappeared. Higher alcohols, almost solventy in taste. This is not nearly as clean as I remember it from the last time. If I have a chance, I will rerate someday.
Mwja tis niet helemaal mn stijl geloof ik. Vroeger best veel gedronken, was een poos favoriet, maar valt me nu toch echt wat tegen. Backlog from 2015/03/11.

Net bier, maar wel wat saai. Vrij veel carbo naar mijn smaak. Goede standaard Belgische abdij.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

330ml bottle @Bir&Fud Bottega (Rome). Pours brown/reddish with a big and persistent off-white head. Aroma of malt, brown sugar, light chocolate, some esters. Flavour is well balanced, medium sweet with a decent bitter end. Medium body, medium carbonation. Nice dubbel!

UPDATED: SEP 2, 2016 Poured dark and creamy into my tulip glass. Wonderful tan head that lasts for the duration, leaving a nice lacing with each sip. Mild earthy-fruity aromas. First sip goes down dry, surprisingly highly carbonated. By no means a particularly fruity or sweet beer, but with an understated sweetness that lingers on the lips. A mild alcohol warmth rises as the bottle progresses, but stays consistent for the duration. Excellent.
I am a sucker for Trappist beers and this a vrey good one.Great taste and fullaof aromas.

Bottle. Poured a deep mahogany color with a good head. Aroma of fruit, caramel and bit of spice. Taste of fresh fruit, some caramel and trace of banana. Mild bitterness and a dry finish. Medium body, smooth and delicious with a slight warming feel. Very enjoyable beer.
(bottle) clear, bright reddish amber with a tall, persistent, fine head; creamy palate; aroma of stewed fruit, brown sugar, dough; balanced flavour with a long, light bitter finish
Aromen von dunklem Karamel, dunkle Schokolade und ein recht herber Abgang, Die Fruchtaromen treten deutlich in den Hintergrund.
On a flight of beer at Meisterstück. Intense banana and other fruity sweetness, some clover, full-bodied, but still dry and crisp. Surprisingly dark color, beautiful foam.

Bottle, 33cl at home. Pours dark brown to reddish with a large tan head. Aromas include peach, apricot, just a tiny hint of caramel. Very nice lacing. The flavours intensify the caramel, perfectly balanced with fruits (including raisins and banana now) and with a very rounded malt in the finish. Some citrus comes in too but is mainly secondary. Extremely exquisite. With the yeast, a ginger-like zest comes in. Not too sweet at all, really well developed flavours. Long finish, medium to high carbonation, medium body, oily texture. Balances fruitiness with its natural dryness: good combination, well blended! Definitely a Dubbel worth trying. Hats off to this beer.

7%ABV. Dubbel.

Poured out of the bottle a black brown. 40ºSRM.

Nose has some nice date sweetness to it. There is almost a soda pop citrus sweetness to the nose that is no doubt the product of the carbonation. The strongest aroma profile is that of 7-up.. There is a candy sweet aroma that is like a hard candy.

Mouthfeel is aggressively carbonated and there is a sweet burnt sugar profile that is sweet, and slightly smoky . Almost like the crust on a creme brulee. Could be described as caramel, but it also has a herbal, slightly grassy flavor to it, which lends the flavor to comparison with a local drink of "grass jelly" or "chin chow". 

Finish is abbreviated and beery. 

This is a traditional product, again, you either like it or you dont and it wont matter one bit since itll just continue to be brewed with the attention that it has in the same manner since forever. A very good example of the style.

Goes on Favorites List!

Looks.. Brown, red tinge, creamy off white head in Trappist glass.
Smells.. Dried fruits.. Figs, dates, raisins, plums..some banana wafer, rich caramel malts.
Tastes..sweet dried fruits, caramel, banana, wafer, Christmas cake, sweet malts, such great value for money in this craft beer world.
Mörkbrun färg med kaffefärgat skum. Doft av dadlar och torkade russin. Fruktkaka i smaken. Lång och värmande eftersmak.
UPDATED: FEB 11, 2016 Kolor ciemno brązowy, mętny. Wysycenie spore. Piana intensywna, ale szybko opada. Zapach drożdżowo-owocowy. Smak korzenny, drożdżowy, trochę akloholowy.

11.2 oz. bottle. Brown with nice tan head. Lots of carbonation on pour. Aroma of sweet malt, dark fruit; has almost a wine-like scent. Taste: slightly sweet, not much bitterness, some yeast, alcohol, and malt. Nice overall balance.
UPDATED: JUN 5, 2016 Dark brown color, medium tan head. Malty aroma, some herb/vanilla notes. Medium bitter, light sweet, yeasty and spicy. Light bitter finish. Medium to full body, creamy texture.
birra dalle grandi personalità .Schiuma particolarmente copiosa e persistente.Aroma ampio e complesso,con note di malto,frutta matura,spezieuna traccia di cacao nel retrogusto
Dark brown/amber color with big brown head. Smell of raisins. Aroma of raisins and yeast. Taste is sweet with alcohol presence. I expected more complex aroma. That strong alcohol presence ruins it.

@ Kulminator 15-10-31: 2015 Vs 1992
Årgang 2015: Mycket lätt smak med tydliga trokaderotoner och lite gräddig vätska.
Årgång 1992: Helt flat med tydlig bränd karamell. Aning söt
Bottle at Kulminator, vintage 2015 and 1992. I think that the new one was a bit better than the old. Yeast, fruit and malt. A rather tasty one I have to say.
On tap @ Beervana. Chestnut color, tan firm head. Aroma of banana, oak, red wine. Quite sweet. Very good.

29.10.2015-bottle-0.33l.
Dunkelbrauner Körper mit beiger Krone, tolles Ladung, Aroma typisch hefig mit leichter Roestmalzsaeuerlichkeit, Antrunk roestmalzig, dezent hopfig, super ausbalanciert.

Strong and pleasant aroma of roasted malt and fruity esters that hits you first. Nice sweet toasted malt with a good phenolic and alcoholic back bone. Hop character is present but not dominate. Good strong and persistent head.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Dark, cloudy, with residue. Aroma soir. Tastes sourly bitter with some fruity nuances.

Aroma: some chocolate, raisins, plum (typical belgian esters). Quite busy and complex.

Appearance: hazy, very dark brown to black colour with medium beige head.

Taste: sweetness is medium. Medium to heavy on bitterness.

Medium bodied, neither thin nor oily. Carbonation is average.

The bitterness could last longer though.

Decent.
