Dark dark brown with thick head and nice lacing. Yeast and banana aroma. A bit hoppy. Fully thick bodied. High carbonation burns the mouth a little

bottle 0,33.
red-brown color. aroma: winy, alcohol hints, bready. taste: malty, very warming, alcohol feels. good.

Strong aroma of fruits, malt.
Taste of fruits, black currant, grape, malt.
Slightly tart. Bittersweet aftertaste

Cloudy brown with a nice off-white head. Despite not being among the strongest Belgians, the aroma is still predominantly of alcohol. Drinks drier than most and is a good example of its type. Good for a winters evening but a little heavy for other times of the year.
Très bonne bière, avec du corps et du caractère. À ne pas boire trop fraîche. Parfait avec de la viande en sauce.

Rating #1161 - 07.07.2014 Beer Seminar at Coop MacTaggart -. Pours a pretty dark ruby/amber - opaque - bubbly tan head that recedes to a ring. Complex aromas of banana, licorice, and clove. Palate is more sticky banana pudding, anise/fennel chalk note, chocolate, raisin, pudding - dried out perfectly with some herbal notes, alcohol heat. Pretty fantastic.
Deep brown with tan head. Sweet malty flavours, with ripe banana, bubblegum, yeast esters. Sweet & dry. Easy drinking. Tasty.
3l bottle in amsteram, poured a hazy brown beer with a offwhite head. Sweet beer, caramel and brown sugar, yeast and malty taste
Some esters that make this a decent brew, but really lacks the full experience of other, better trappist beers.

F: nice beige lasting.
C: dark non-transparent.
A: malty caramel, huge banana aroma, molasses, sweet fruity aroma, hint of spicy and yeast.
T: great sweet to nice hint of bitterness, lively carbonation, medium to full body, banana, caramel, dark fruit like dry sweet plums, hint of chocolate, dry finish, great for this stile worth to try.

BB 18.12.16. Bottled.
27 srm. Dark brown, tan hue. Big banana fruit. Banana cream pudding with freshly baked bread crumbs, not runts. Guessing lower attenuation, but not out of range, from light umami... or heavy amount of residual cooked kettle sugar. Red jolly rancher covered in tootsie rolls type sweetness. Heavy hand of specialty caramel malts added, no roast. Intense aroma.
1/15/2009 8:02:28 AM Bottle at home, drank with Pieter. Very good flavourful beer. Smooth, not too much kick. Very tasty.

Dark, bittersweet beer. Caramel in the nose. Small brown head. A little bit sticky in the mouth. This one must be drunk at the recommended temperature, because when its too cold or to warm it realy tastes different (and thats not in a good way).

Caramel, chocolate and fruity aroma; cloudy, dark brown colour, long-life medium sized creamy beige head;full body; average carbonation; powerful sweet malty and slight bitter taste; long sweet and bitter palate.

Adquirida en botella de 330 ml. en Whole Foods, LES, New York. Cremosa, algo espesa y con bastante espuma blanca. Tonalidad rojiza casi marrón. Deliciosa dubbel donde se mezclan frutas (predomina la banana) y especias q le dan un particular sabor agridulce.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
This beer looks like something you can draft from a sewer. But dont let that stop you! A really nice experience that a gladly will go for again. Great taste and a palate that really lingers.

Aroma of chocolate, caramel and slightly fruity. Brown and hazy liquid, white frothy head. Powerful taste of sweetness, and medium bitterness. Tiny sourness. Full body, creamy texture, average carbonation, quit long bitter-sweet finish. I really like this dubbel from Westmalle, great beer!
absolutely amazing beer! It is perfect in every way.... the only issue I have is whether to order a Dubbel or Tripel, both are perfect in their own way

Piwo nalewa się z intensywną pianą, ta jednak szybko redukuje się do obrączki. Barwa jest ciemno-miedziana, niemal brunatna z burgundowymi przebłyskami. 
Aromat jest słodki, bardzo złożony. Początkowo kojarzy się z szampanem i jabłkami, następnie pojawiają się czerwone owoce i czekolada. W tle zapach kojarzący się z pumperniklem. Alkohol jest wyczuwalny, ale nie przeszkadzający.
Smak zdominowany słodami. Piwo jest pełne i słodkie, z posmakami pumpernikla, czekolady i przypalonego karmelu. Gdzieś tam w tle subtelnie pojawiają się nuty ziołowe. Goryczka z tych alkoholowych, ciepło rozpływa się po przełyku. Alkohol wyraźny, ale nie nachalny, ułożony.
Bottle from the wine emporium Brisbane, very wine and port like flavours, also very thick and creamy, a good winter warmer or end of evening drop, delicious
Reddish brown with an off-white head. Aroma of caramel, molasses, dried fruits and yeas. Taste is medium sweet and bitter.

Nice red brown Trappist. Creamy head. Fruit, dry and light spicy taste.
Excellent beer for accompaning stews.
330ml at home. Very good Belgian dubbel, well-balanced with dark fruits and a little bitterness.

The beer pours dark, mahogny colored with a hughe, three finger high, brownbeige, head. 

Nose: Brown sugar, dark syrup, hazelnut, fudge, caramel, dark bread, raisin, plum, marzipan, dark fruit, cherries and caramel malt. Its a very beatiful nose! 
Taste: Nuts, a hint of roasted malt, caramel, brown sugar, coffee, alcohol, biscuit, hops and burned sugar. The taste isnt really up to the quality of the nose. 
Body: Medium to full body. High carbonation. A bitter aftertaste. 

A great double!
330cc bottle. Lots of yeast fruitynees. Really nicely balanced with the roasted malts. One of the best is this style.
Dejlig let spændende mørk trappistøl igen. Fin balance og på ingen måder tung. Dog ikke den bedste trappistøl....
Beer with dark color, medium bitterness, medium body, (bought a 33cl bottle in Tournai supermarket).
brown, clear, tan foam, caramel, roasty, toast, full body, oily feel, average carbonation, medium sweetness, medium bitterness,

Pours a dark brown color, topped with a medium sized beige colored creamy head. Malty aroma, yeasty with some fruity notes and a tad of alcohol. Taste is mild ysweet, malty with yeasty presence. A bit of fruity presence can be felt. Almost no bitterness but a slight alcohol burn feeling - not too strong. Drinkable, though Im not a big fan.
330ml bottle from Systembolaget. Brown with a creamy tan head. Aroma of dried dark fruit and sweet malt. Light sweet and dry mouthfeel. Rich taste got honey, spice, figs. Dry finish.

Muddy brown color with light brown head. Dark fruit aroma with some spices and yeasty esters. Taste starts also yeasty with some raisin notes but its not a sweet beer. Its quite balanced and drinkable. The alcohol is also barely noticeable. Really good example for the style.

Beautiful dubbel with loads of dried and fresh fruits, caramel. It's an easy beer with an attitude, 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Voor mij een van de beste trappisten . 30 jaar geleden leren kenen en nog altijd een favoriet. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
UPDATED: SEP 2, 2015 Dark Brown with a brownish white head. Aroma of dark fruits. Malty taste and little bitterness. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours a deep brown with a spongey, foamy head. Aroma is bananas, vanilla and some bourbon. Taste is Vanilla, whisky, red stone fruits, mainly plums.

750ml bottle. Pours deep reddish brown with off-white head. Lovely fruity, malty, slightly spicy dubbel, banana and prunes with yeast and candied sugar. A nice long slightly dry warming finish, great stuff!
Converting" from old excel scoresheet. So there are no comments on this beer.
Really great example of dubble dried dark fruits, spicy yeasty cinnamon and some banana. Light tan head and good palate.
330ml bottle @ BA Sundbyberg. Dark brown body with a low head. Dark sugars, dried dark fruits and yeast. Too much yeast imo.

Bottle. Pours clear opaque amber with thick medium beige/brown head. Aroma is packed with belgian yeast, candied sugar and caramel malts. Some dark dried fruits and toast. Slight banana. Taste is sweet, yeast, banana, dried fruits, malts and toast. Well hidden alcohol and really drinkable.

Bottiglia. Colore marrone scuro, schiuma beige cremosa e di media persistenza. Laroma è subito protagonista, con banana, frutta matura, malto, anche luppolo e note di cioccolato. Allassaggio, coerentemente con laroma, abbiamo un sapore dolce che esalta il fruttato, così come la nota di cioccolato e levidente presenza del tipico lievito belga (banana). Il retrogusto è leggermente amaro, con un finale secco e persistente. Birra splendida.
Dark brown with white head. Malty aroma. Taste is sweet and malty, dark fruits. Low bitterness. Not amazing but still a good Belgian ale.
Brown and tan head, yeast and breads, not to much candi or dark fruits as this style has some times. Finishes pretty thick with a banana finish.

Pours a dark brown colour with a fat head. Aroma is slightly caramel with hints of banana and a fruity background. Taste is a caramel body with a sweet backing and brown sugar notes. Aftertaste is dry, fruity with hints of chocolate at the very end. A very balanced, complex and not too strong dubbel, very drinkable.
Wine, figs, alcohol, brown sugar, Belgian yeasts, some light spiciness. High carbonation

First of all, you meet a nice dark brown ale with a foam that fully impress. The foam is both thick, persistent and hangs beautifully in the glass. The smells of fruit and hiding something spicy, and of course the hops. The taste is soft, hoppy, fruity, slightly spicy and fantastic tuned so you taste all shades in small fragments before all the taste gather in a large sparkling fireworks of wellbeing. The alcohol is not penetrating but works anyway warming. The finish is long lasting and extremely delicious.

Pours fizzy rich, deep brown with a huge soapy tan head that laces wet. Aroma is fruity with notes of banana and some caramel and darkfruit. Taste is banana, chocolate, fig. Some bitterness to close. Active and a bit dry. Some booziness. Shines with some warming. Really quite drinkable.
Très bonne brune au caractère marqué, puissante et rondeur de fruits mûrs, mêlées de notes caramel. Trouvable en France en grandes surfaces, bue également chez Léon de Bruxelles.
Bottle. Nice brown pour with a thin tan rocky head. Like a good dubbel, sweet malt aroma, plenty of fruit. Taste follows, caramel, bit of toffee, some plum other darker fruits.
Cerveja com ótimo aroma, amargor balanceado deixando uma certa suavidade no sabor. Escura e espuma densa e duradoura.
This is a strong and sweet beer at the same time. Delicious! And it turns even better when tasted in its own goblet.

Clear brown body. Big fluffy white head. Aroma of caramel, chocolate, dried fruit (fig, plum?). Flavour is much more assertive but similar to aroma. Some booze. Bitter medium finish. Good.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: OCT 14, 2015 L: a nice thick dark caramel with a decent bubbly tan head. 
The aromas and tastes really came out after about 10 mins of letting it warm up. 
S: a nice earthy malt with some fig and dark fruit, some caramel notes. 
T: Superbly balanced on the tongue, a pinch of citrus sitting on those flavours mentioned. Alcohol well-hidden. 
F: complex from front to back, nicely carbonated, smooth throughout, a little spicy on the end. 
O: Simply top notch. I want another!

Bottle. Dark reddish-brown color with thin, light yellow-tan head and substantial lacing. Strong grape and fig aroma with a hint of plum. Assertive flavor of grape, plum, and fig. Effervescent mouthfeel. Long, sweet finish with pleasant bitterness emerging. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Nice foam, not so strong beer. I prefer it over the Tripel from Westmalle. Soft banana flavour.

Thumbs up!

tiefdunkelbraun mit schönem beigem Schaum. Geruch nach geröstetem Malz. Schöne Aromen vom Röstmalz und der Hefe: verbranntes Karamell, Trockenfrüchte, etwas Kakao. Dominiert wird das Bier dann aber vonn einer sehr trockenen Bitternote, die sehr gut passt.

Gut!

Brown colour with beige/brown mediumsized head. Leaves nice lacing. Caramel and malt in aroma. Very fresh aroma. Fruity and malty taste with hints of hops. Aftertaste is made of citrus and hoppy bitterness. Very wellbalanced.

33 cl, flaske, 7,0 % ABV, BB: 12/01/17, købt i Den Belgiske Ølbutik i Vanløse, 21. juni 2015.
Mørkebrun, mousserende og ufiltreret kloster Dubbel med større moccafarvet skumkrone, som langsomt svinder til et par mm 
Aroma af tørret frugt bl.a. rosin og blomme. Dybere nede ligger der alkohol. 
Let syrlig smag i indledningen, som derefter går over i en blanding af sødme og let bitterhed. I slutningen overtager det bitre og smagen ender med overvægt på det bitre. Opsummering: Middel sødme og middel bitter. Let sur/syrlig. 
God mellem fyldig krop med en noget kraftig karbonering over medium niveau. Konsistensen er klæbrig. Afslutningen lang og bitter, næsten besk. 
Jeg har tidligere smagt dette halv-ikoniske bryg, men aldrig rate't det. Mit indtryk er dog stadig præget af en ucharmerende bitterhed, som jeg finder krads og ucharmerende. Enebær? Ikke min favorit-Dubbel.
Caramel and yeasty aroma with notes of honey. Clear mahogany colour. Bitter front caught me off guard; notes of banana, toffee, and black coffee. Medium in body and carbonation.
Turva,escura avermelhada,creme bege volumoso,aroma complexo,maltado,frutado,sabor potente aveludado. Ótima Trappista.

Amnar bastante oscura. Dos - tres dedos de espuma ligeramente beige. Aroma tirando a amargo y hierbas. Gran cuerpo en boca. Bastante carbónica. Suave y cremosa. Caramelo y chocolate junto con frutas pasas. Final controlado amargo y seco, pero no mucho. Redondeada con la graduación que disimula bien pero que sin querer se deja notar... Excelente en su conjunto.

Bottle @ Old Irish Pub. Lol. Pours hazy dark brown with a small offwhite head. 
Aromas of dark fruits, yeast, caramel, malt, booze. Taste is malty, dry, chocolate, dates, esters, yeast, figs. Never been a big fan of dubbels.

33cl bottle. Clear burgundy with a foamy beige head. Flavors are brown sugar, molasses, dried fruits, banana, raisins, bread and spices with medicinal notes. Medium body, soft carbonation, oily texture.

Bottle at The Holy Inadequate, Etruria. Pours a deep brown colour with a fizzy beige head. Aroma of cola, bubblegum, banana, cloves, brown sugar, some caramel and spice. Taste of caramel, cloves, some banana, slight bubblegum, prunes, raisin, brown sugar, some alcohol and late liquorice. Medium bodied and moderate carbonation. A long, sourish, warming, sugary finish. A warming, sweet, fruity dubbel with fruit and sugary flavours. Complex and nice to drink..
Theres a tartness thats not from hops. The descriptions says that notes of ripe banana predominate. I would say it tastes more like apple.

UPDATED: JUN 15, 2017 Aroma is of honey, red apples, crusted bread, and raisins/dates. Taste is honey, red apple, slight cinnamon/cardamom, raisins, toffee/caramel, and crusted bread. Nice bubbly carbonation. Slight phenolic esters in the finish and again with black pepper in the after taste.

Birra dal classico colore tonaca di frate; ha un bellissimo cappello di schiuma, cremoso. compatto e dalla buona perstenza. Laroma è allo stesso tempo fruttato e luppolato, molto stuzzicante, sicuramente piccante; è ricco e importante, con una note finale di malto corposo. Ha un palato ugualmente deciso, di frutta secca, malto, cioccolato e spezie; ha un corpo agile e ben strutturato, con un gusto secco e luppolato, che la giusta frizzantezza fa apprezzare al meglio. Termina con personalità, dimostrando di essere capace di un retrogusto delicato di luppolo, malto tostato e frutta (banana e uva passa).

A reddish brown trappist ale, malty and fruit, featuring a 3 week secondary fermentation. This ale has a full, pale yellow head. The bouquet is full of esters and fruitiness. Notes of ripe banana predominate. The taste is fruity and slightly bitter, with a long, dry finish.

Aroma: roasted dark malts, red dried fruits.
Appearance: hazy brown color, nice beige head.
Taste: low bitterness, roasted dark malts, fruity, dried red fruits, caramel, semi-sweet, alcohol well-covered.
Palate: medium body and medium carbonation.
Overall: Really good dubbel, drinkable and fulll of a complex taste.
Bottle. Dark brown color with tan head. Aroma has ripe fruits, caramel malt, yeast. Taste is fruity and malty with bitter aftertaste. Flavors of ripe fruits, caramel, plums and chocolate.

330 ml bottle. Pours a beautiful, hazy, reddish brown with a huge, creamy, long lasting, tan head that laces. Sweet aroma of dried fruit, ripe banana and caramel malt. Sweet flavour of dark fruit, caramel malt, a hint of chocolate with some sourness and a mildly dry, bitter finish. Medium body with a smooth, creamy texture and soft carbonation. A complex, yet easy drinking beer. Excellent.

S:
-plums,figs,raisins,banana,spices
T:
-Follow the nose with a sweet finish
F:
-alcohol well hidden
-light body
O:
-Good Dubbel

Aromat: karmelowo-tostowy oraz wiśniowo-bananowy. Piana: trwała. Wysycenie: średnio-wysokie. Barwa: ciemno-miedziana, klarowane. Smak: słodki, lekka goryczka, na finiszu delikatnie rozgrzewające przez alkohol. Piwo średnio-pełne. Bardzo dobry i aromatyczny dubbel.

Pours dark amber brown with compact tan head that reduces to skim.
Nose is sweet malt, yeast, walnuts, pecans, caramelizing sugar. Palate adds muscat grapes, candied fruit, bitters, cough syrup, alcohol buzz. Bitterness provides initially rough finish. It mellows with aeration but still brings some alcohol heat.
Good, but not as refined as some other.

Copenhagen 28/5 2015. 33 cl bottle from Gunnar Madsen Vinhandel. Pours clear dark brown with big beige head. Head subsides to thin lacing after a couple of minutes. Aroma is of dark malts, yeast, plum and alcohol. Medium carbonation. Taste is tinged with alcohol and bitterness. Some subdued sweetness for balance. A bit of burnt cardboard in the aftertaste. Fine dark Belgian fella with more rough edges than many of its industrial cousins.
Hazy brown liquid, medium head. Fruity aroma of malt. Heavy body, average carbonation. Taste is sweet and bitter.
Aroma of malts and caramel dark ruby color taste dark malts bit sour and caramel dry sour aftertaste

Bottle from Auchan. Pours dark brown, almost black, with nice head which howecer dissipates pretty quickly. It look basically just like Coca-Cola, but it smells much better: Chocolate, banana, coffee, roast aromas, dark fruits and even a hint of leather. The beer feels super-foamy and creamy in the mouth and has a very nice carbonation. The sweetness and bitterness are very well balanced and the nice, bitter aftertaste stays with you for a long time. Classy! Will drink again.

Barwa ciemno brązowa, wpadająca w bordo, opalizująca. Piana spora, sycząca, średnio i grubo pęcherzykowa, szybko opada do obrączki. W aromacie czerwone owoce typu czereśnia, wiśnia, śliwka, ciemne winogrono oraz suszone daktyle, rodzynki, troszkę nut melanoidynowych i karmelowo-czekoladowych. W smaku wszystko to ma swoje lustrzane odbicie, lekka słodycz figowo-miodowa (z jednej strony nie przesadzona jak w wielu Dubblach a z drugiej jednak wyraźnie zaznaczona), lekka kwaskowatość pumpernikla, goryczka pestkowo-ziołowo-chmielowa - wszystko świetnie wyważone, zbalansowane i ułożone. Alkohol niewyczuwalny, jedynie delikatne rozgrzewanie w aftertejsie obok przyjemnego posmaku domowego wina głogowego. 
W tej cenie bez wątpienia trudno znaleźć trunek o porównywalnej renomie i bogactwie aromatyczno-smakowym. Profil półsłodki i półpełny, na uwagę zasługuje idealny balans i duża pijalność dzięki dość wysokiemu drobnemu nagazowaniu oraz sporemu jak na Dubbla nachmieleniu. Wyborny trunek!
Dark brown with medium off white head. Dark fruits, chocolate, nuts, some orange, somw sweetness. Roasted malts and caramel. Nice carbonation. Malty finish.

Bottle@ deTolly, Tartu. Pours dark brown with medium beige head. Aroma is sweet, malty, caramel, yeasty, slight alcohol hints, dark berries, almonds-raisins, sweet scocolate candys.Taste is sweet, slight roast, caramel, candy,raisins, canned pear,, Full body for astyle. Sweet finish.

From 0,33l bottle, BBD: 04/12/16 Poura hazy red to brown liquid, huge frothy tan head, formed from big bubbles, Aroma: light candied fruits, light Belgian phenol notes, light spicy, red orange, warming alcohol, Taste: medium sweet, medium bitter, light to medium sour, malty, fruity, bitter, but nothing stand up from the row, Palate: medium body, oily to sticky texture, lively to fizzy carbonation, long malty fruity finish, Overall: good, drinkable, but did not catch my heart.

UPDATED: JUN 4, 2015 Perfect off-white head. It looks delecious. Aroma is sweet, with some roasted malts in the background. Taste, raisins, belgian yeast, caramel, maybe some esters, piney and earthy tones aswell, a bit roasty at the background again. Long aftertaste. I feel the alcohol warming inside. A perfect dubbel imo. Med carbo and med-full body.

Bottle 33cl. 

Pours a thick white head with medium carbonation. 

Smell: Raisin, plum, Belgian yeast, caramel, and hints of chocolate. 

Aroma: Dark fruits, caramel, raisin, plum, and toffee. Very long lasting finish.

This is a terrific abbey dubbel. I cant place my finger on it but I do like Chimay Red better. Could be that I grew up drinking Chimay and have a special place in my bier heart for that grog. I did like this well built brew. Nice head, flavor, mouth feel and aftertaste. Love it!

UPDATED: JUL 13, 2015 33 cl bottle. Medium brown, generous beige head, which lasts for a few minutes. Starts a little sour little then fruity, floral,butterscotch. Average sweetness but quite dry for a trappist. Roasted bitter finish. Medium body, average carbonation. Good one
A very nice belgian beer, which is easy to get. Like the tripell of westmalle more.

Aroma: caramel, dried fruits, spicy, barnyard in the background
Taste: medium sweet, light bitter, caramel, malty, fruity

Bottle. Dark brown/ruby, light tan head. Nice lacing. In aroma caramel, banana and bubblegum, brown sugar, dried fruits. In taste sweet, malty, brown sugar, caramel. The beer is full to medium bodied, creamy. The carbonation is low. In the finish low to medium bitterness, some alcohol. The beer is dry. Very good Belgian dubbel.
Pours a hazy brown color. Aroma and taste are caramel, malts, and brown sugar.
Ik ben zeker fan van dubbel bieren maar deze vindt ik eigenlijk niet heel geweldig. Hij is redelijk zoet kwa smaak met een wat droge afdronk. Mooie schuimkraag op het bier.
Bottle at Bishops Avenyn. Very nice aroma, and taste of plus and caramel. One of my favourite beers, heavenly good!

Raisin brown color with a big creamy head. Aroma of raisins, dark fruit, spices, toffee, rich caramel. Taste surprisingly light for such a heavy beer, put me in mind of an English brown on steroids. Sweet, some banana notes, toffee, dark brown sugar, noticeable alcohol and some tin, which unfortunately lingers on the tongue. I hate Belgian beers but surprisingly I didnt hate this. Nice dry finish makes you drink this down quickly, which could be dangerous...

UPDATED: JUL 10, 2016 Verticale tra 2015 e 2013, 33 cl. aperte il 10 luglio 2016.

2015
Rossa scura con riflessi ramati, schiuma beige scura di buona persistenza.
Aroma di lievito belga, banana matura, uva passa, fichi secchi, tostata con note di cacao e di chiodi di garofano, lievi note di ossidazione.
Al palato sempre lievito belga, banana matura, fichi secchi e chiodi di garofano, coda tostata ed anche un po erbacea.
Corpo medio-pieno, mediamente carbonata, texture leggermente oleosa.

2013
Schiuma meno copiosa e persistente, al naso più fine ed aromatica, fichi secchi più in evidenza, datteri, banana meno evidente, la parte tostata risulta molto più gentile, chiodi di garofano meno evidenti, più "mielosa".
Note retrolfattive dove la fanno da padrone sempre i fichi secchi misti a note tostate.
Al palato continua fedele rispetto allolfatto, finale leggermente più gentile della 2015.
Sembra che la 2013 abbia retto meglio della sorella più giovane.
Nice pours chestnut/monogamy with silky head full of tiny bubbles big boozy hit with summer fruits and slightly bitter one to sip and savour.

Caramel and yeasty aroma with notes of honey. Clear mahogany colour. Bitter front caught me off guard; notes of banana, toffee, and black coffee. Medium in body and carbonation. Nice, but a bit too bitter for my desire of a Dubbel.
One of the very few trappist beers I dont like. Too dark, too bitter. Not recommended.
11-28-2014 - A very nice beer but I like his brothers Tripel and Extra better.
roasty, coffee, alcohol, licorice, brown, red, cloudy, brown foam, medium sweetness, medium bitterness, thick feel, long finish,

Poured with a large tan head with tiny bubbles, beautiful mahogany colour when held to the light. Boozy yeasty bubblegum on the nose. Thin body with a massive boozy hit, bitterness comes through leaving a tacky mouthfeel and a desire for another sip. Sweet banana at the back of the pallet. Perfect for the style.
Dark reddish brown colour. Aroma od plums, bananas and some tropical fruits. Similar is flavour with nice balanced malty notes and slightly bitterness. Very drinkable beer.

330ml bottle. Clear dark amber body, small beige head, average to poor retention. Aroma of yeast and alcohol, dark berries, brown sugar, cloves, overripe banana. Taste of roasted malts, herbs and yeast, alcohol. Metallic aftertaste. Good.
Thanks to Maxbier. Pours Brown with off white head. Toasted malt aroma with some yeast. Sweet caramel malt start with some fruity notes and yeastiness. Very smooth brew.
Veel verkocht bier, geen uitschieter in zijn soort. Maar zeker niet slecht te drinken.

Pours opaque ruby brown with a short light tan head diminishing rapidly to a thin skim, no lacing. (4/5) Nose is complex: toffee and caramel, brown sugar, dark slightly boozy stone fruit, mild cloves, banana and bubblegum. (9/10) Taste is moderate sweet, mild bitter, very slight tart. (9/10) Full slightly creamy body, soft carbonation, lingering dry finish. (5/5)

Really good. The sweetness is never cloying, and as it fades, theres a very mild lingering bitter that you keep expecting to come forwards - but it doesnt. The bitter stays in the background and never upsets the smooth fruity flavour or the lingering dry finish. Theres a very slight restrained acidity that keeps the mouth feel clean and almost crisp, and brings out the stone fruit flavour. I love hoppy and bitter beers, and this is pretty much the complete antithesis of that: its all about the dark malt fruitiness - and I like it a lot. Theres a reason this is considered a reference dubbel. (18/20)

Cloudy brown with small tan head. Light malty yeast aroma. Flavors of malt, anise, slightly grassy, yeasty. Finish is slightly bitter and herbal yeast. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottled. Very dark red-brown. Clear. A huge foamy, light brown head. Warm aromas of clove, spice, and bubblegum. Slightly acidic, with warmth from the alcohol, burnt caramel flavour, and clove/spice again. Smooth and well balanced, with a clean finish. Very good.

UPDATED: APR 3, 2015 Dark brown with amber tones. Large lingering head.
Intense aroma: honey, caramel, prunes, dates... Very interesting lactic notes.
CO2 is well integrated, giving it a mousse texture. Medium sweet, lively, with a long ending with no bitterness. Delicious.

Bottle on caliz. This is just a fantastic dubbel. Brown dark with a fantastic beige head. Malty, fruity, earty aroma with a nice sweet taste. Full body, creamy and thick with a long finish. Allways a pleasure!
Pours brown with a nice brownish head. Lovelt aroma and flavour this is a really good flavoursome beer. Some fruitiness but not as sweet as many Belgian beers - really nice though

33cl bottle from Carrefours (only EUR1 !). Sour nose, notes of banana and burnt caramel. Brown/ dark red beer with fluffy cream head. It looks still but the mouthfeel is zingy. Aftertaste is burnt malt, banana followed by a late sourness. Alcohol is present throughout.

Bottle from Hop City Birmingham. Pours hazy brown with white head. Aroma of caramel and slight coco note. Tastes of caramel, slightly bitter, dark chocolate and booze on the backend. Excellent Trappist!

Approx 10 degrees C. Pours almost pitch black with a reddish tint and a light brown head. Rather faint aroma of malt, bread and a faint citrussy fruit. Fizzy dark taste - this is a young example with a BBF in August 2016. A slight metallic twist thankfully quickly disappears and the roasted malt and dark dried fruit begins to take over with a nice bitterness in the aftertaste. Now it is showing its mettle and the alcohol is kept very nicely in check. Well balanced beer. Look forward to cellaring a bottle of this as I sure it only gets better the next couple of years or five. Also tried on tap where any hint of the metallic twist was thankfully gone...so the rating stands!
Very nice aroma of dark fruit and malts. Color is a dark reddish/brown color. Taste is even more dark fruit and malts. Fantastic Belgian dubbel Trappist ale, awesome!

Shared bottle. Dark brown with thick tan head. Aroma of malts, yeast, bread, peachy, banana, caramel, brown sugar. Taste is medium bitter, light sweet, bit alcohol, yeast. Medium body, light bitter finish.

Pour is the colour of prune juice with a thin tan cap that fades to a weird crescent moon. Nose is banana bread, raisins, cloves, brown sugar, vinous alcohol (and faint nail polish). Taste-wise this stuff is much drier than I expected. The banana seems to disappear, and I get more grape than raisin, but theres remarkably little sweetness and just a hint of alcohol. Carbonation is lively/fizzy, finish is lingeringly dry/slightly bitter. Solid but not my fave.

Zapach z butelki to dużo, dużo słodów  głównie tych ciemnych. Piwo jest ciemnobrązowe, mętne. Piana niewysoka, drobna, karmelowa. Aromat ze szkła  belgijski. Wybaczcie, ale tego się nie da opisać w inny sposób  ono po prostu pachnie tak jak zwykły pachnieć belgijskie piwa. Oprócz tego trochę czekolady, trochę suszonych śliwek. Pierwszy łyk  od razu daje o sobie znać bardzo wysokie wysycenie. Piwo jest jak na styl zaskakująco lekkie. Karmelowe, dosyć palone. Jednocześnie dosyć słodkie, ale w nienatrętny sposób. Goryczka zdaje się pochodzić głównie od słodu i od alkoholu, a nie od chmielu. No i sam alkohol w smaku jest też mocno wyczuwalny, jeszcze długo po wzięciu łyka grzeje mnie w gardło. Piwo na pewno warte spróbowania, na pewno typowe dla stylu, jednak nie nazwał bym go wybitnym.

NOTA DE CATA:
- Aspecto: Típica oscura flamenca. 
- Aroma: De aroma afrutado y acaramelado. 
- Cuerpo/sabor: Un paladar pronunciado a malta tostada y algo dulce.

Aroma: Dried fruit and hints of floral hops.
Appearance: Dark cloudy Amber with light tan head.
Taste: Medium sweetness with medium sourness.
Palate: Medium body, sticky texture, average carbonation, long finish.
Overall: Very good, but a bit too fruity for me.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

20.6.2014. Reddish dark brown. Malty aroma with dark fruits, some caramel. Also taste has caramel and malts, notes of citrus, brown sugar. Warmth of alcohol, maybe a bit of smell as well, as a negative side.
One of the best trappist in my opinion. A very fruity smell due a perfect taste of fruit and bitter in balance with alchool.
Отличны& тёмный траппис& эль. Легко пьётся. Во вкусе карамел&

Bottle. Kinda thin body. Pours dark brown with a 2 finger beige frothy quick diminishing head down to a ring but leaves little lacing. Flavors of raisins, dark fruit and with the strong power of suggestion I think I taste, but Im not so sure, a note of banana. Thin body, lightly bitter and a lightly sweet finish of medium duration.

33cl.
Appearance: Dark brown/ruby color with a very nice offwhite head with small bubbly foam, with a excellent retention. Head is slightly more the 2 fingers. 
Aroma of caramelised malt, yeast,banana, dark fruit, a but of spices.
Taste: slightly below moderate sweetness, yeast, caramel, dark fruit and banana, raisins, some alcohol. 
Medium body with a average to soft carbonation.

Finally rating a Classic again.And I actually forgot how good this one is.
Dark brown pour with a nice frothy tan head. Dried fruit bananas, brown sugar and a touch of caramel on the nose. Medium body. Aroma flowed into the taste with a touch of cloves added.

Moje prvé trapistické pivo v živote. Tretinková fľaša, krásna, hustá pena, tmavá farba, kvetinovo-ovocná vôňa. Chuť výrazná, sladovo-kvasinková, so suchým záverom. Pivo je nasýtené.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Dark brown/ruby color; Medium slightly creamy body; Aroma of sweet malt, yeast, dark fruit, & spice; Flavor of slight sweet malt, yeast, caramel, dark fruit, raisons, and some hops; Nicely balanced & complex; I enjoyed this one - great dubbel.

Bottle 0.33 l, Carrefour, Wrocław, Poland.
Ciemnobrązowe, mętne piwo z beżową, puszystą i trwałą pianą oraz przyjemnym, lekko palonym, owocowym aromatem. W smaku zdecydowanie wytrawne, palone z karmelowo-owocowymi posmakami.
Really nice dubbel! A lot of roasted caramel and a little of wine at the end.

Une mousse beige onctueuse se dresse sur une bière brune aux reflets rubis discrets. Les esters fruités sont puissants au nez, les raisins secs et les bananes bien mûres étant à lavant-plan. Des notes sucrées et maltées sont également à noter. Malgré la rondeur du malt bien évidente, cette bière nest aucunement lourde en bouche. Les fruits confits (dattes, figues, etc.) sont facilement reconnaissables et confèrent un bon goût sucré qui finit par être coupé par une amertume légère en fin de gorgée. Ce nest pas mon genre de bière, mais il faut reconnaître que cest un grand classique.

UPDATED: MAY 30, 2017 
Aroma:

Medium aroma of malts, caramel, dark fruit, Belgian yeast and liquorice.

Appearance:

Turbid/opaque ruby/dark brown beer with a medium beige head.

Taste/Palate:

Heavy sweet and slightly bitter with malts, caramel, dark fruit, Belgian yeast and liquorice.

Overall:

This beer is intense, complex and balanced. Such a complex and deep flavour with such an amazing quality all over. Great appearance and palate as well, but the aroma could have been stronger.

Caramel, brown sugar, fruits and some yeast and spices in the aroma. Brown with a off-white head. Medium sweet and medium bitter. Medium body with a average to soft carbonation. Overall quite nice, but for me a tiny bit to thin and the alcohol slightly to present in the flavor.

Poured a very dark brown with a cloudy appearance. Did not smell as good as it tasted. Taste was strong, but well balanced. Good amount of carbonation. Overall ver impressed with this beer. Will be buying it again. 

MB

UPDATED: APR 10, 2016 330ml bottle from Masuyos Liquors in Asagaya. Poured into a stemmed tulip. Pours a deep mahogany brown with a huge soapy beige head. Dark fruit, fig, malt and past-ripe bananas on the nose. Bitterness from hops present on the palate and tart apple crispness is also present. Full body, with a rich thick mouthfeel. Nice lingering dry finish.

Muddy brown with thin head. Aroma is pungent dates, toffee, dough. Taste is similarly fruity, especially as it warms up in the mouth. Relatively dry as dubbels go. Bubbly. Bit of spiciness on the finish. Dont drink too cold.

Its been a while since my last Westmalle since its more of a yearly selection for the evil booze monster monopoly here in Ontario. It definitely one of my go-tos while in Belgium as its good and ubiquitous, thanks not those busy monks. This fella poured ALL head. A glass full actually, tortuously making me wait. The nose it full of sweet malts, sharp rich yeast, treacle, and awesome. The taste very heavy of dry hay malts, slight dried fruit, but its that rich, almost texturous yeast flavour of bread, rising dough, and a dry zestiness that nobody does like the Belgians. Awesome.
Dark brown color with beige head that goes down quickly. Fruity, spicy, malty, caramel, heavy. Lots of fruits. Smooth and high carbonation, but foamy mouthfeel. A good classic Dubbel. Very nice!

Dark brown color and a small, but long lasting, beige head. Aroma and taste of malt, caramel, dried fruit and some alcohol. Not as good as the trippel at all, but deffinately a very decent classic trappist.

UPDATED: APR 3, 2015 Trappist, the best kind of beer in the world. The Dubbel is better than the Trippel, because it is less bitter. However, the Westmalle Dubbel is quite a bitter treat. It is accompanied very wel by a chunk of extra dark chocolate. The beer comes with just enough sweetness, to neutralize the bitternes enough to not be annoying. The colour is beautiful reddish brown. The layer of foam is nice, not very thick and it disappears fast. But a thin layer of fine foam remains until the beer is finished. Ther is a nice nutty flavor, aswel as a hint of caramel, somewhere in a far distance. The finish is long and very pleasant. Especially the sweetness remains for quite some time.
UPDATED: FEB 18, 2017 Dejlig øl. God og fyldig smag. Jeg glæder mig til den næste Westmalle Dubbel.

UPDATED: DEC 26, 2015 Marrom escura, espuma de média formação e persistência. Olfato intenso, alcoólico, caramelizado , frutas vermelho escuras. Paladar perde um pouco da potência do aroma, achocolatado, licoroso, adocicado. Corpo médio, baixa carbonatação.  Aftertaste duradouro, maltado, dulçor caramelizado.

Robe brune. Nez puissant sur les épices, la banane, la levure, les fruits compotés. Bouche à lattaque moelleuse, belle bulle, fine acidité et finale équilibrée. Un belle trappiste, juste un cran en dessous de Rochefort.

Pours dark brown with a huge frothy tan head consisting of pretty big bubbles that leave a thin lacing. Rich fruity aroma of malt, sweet yeast, marzipan, ripe banana and something resembling coca cola. Full body, thick feel, soft carbonation. Taste is quite bitter and spicy with green apples, caramel and a hint of licorice. Long lasting dry finish.

Lekker bruine dubbele trappist, niet meer en niet minder.
Lekkere volle smaak en een mooie fles.

Uitgeschonken in 25cl. Westmalle bokaal. Kleur is mahonie kleurig roodbruin, met beige volle roodachtige schuimkraag. De geur is een mix van gedroogd fruit, en Belgische gist. De smaak is zeer goed en complex voor een dubbel. Perfecte zoet en droog balans. Smaken van banaan, rozijnen, brood, chocolade, lichte aarde tonen en als afsluiter een verfijnde delicate hop toets. Het mondgevoel is aangenaam, met een perfecte carbonatie, en fluwelige smaak. De afdronk is zacht en aardachtig met delicate hop. De Westmalle Dubbel Trappist is een klassiek Belgisch bier, het voorbeeld van een perfecte Dubbel. Net als de Tripel een uitstekende Trappist, uniek bier in kwaliteit en smaak.

Saturday night pre-dinner pour is beautiful brown with a plush cap of loose foam. Heavy fruits on the nose. The fruit stylings carry through on the tongue. Its essentially a fruit salad (muted banana, unripened pears, green apple, white grapes & dates)  with a caramel & slight hint of chocolate.North American wanna-be Belgium stylists could learn about restraint from a bottle of this. Awesome.

Aroma strikes me with dark candi syrup. toffee, figs, dark fruits in general. A hint of chocolate. This aroma is very delicate and complex. Not in-your-face as most beers nowadays. Flavor is also very delicate. Flavors of dark fruits and candi syrup greets you with hints of vanilla and cocoa. Delicious.

Kastanienbraun, grobporiger Schaum. Überraschend viel Kohlensäure . In der Nase deutliche Malzaromen , wie Schokolade, Kaffee gepaart mit fruchtigen Noten von Waldfrüchten und Dörrpflaumen,
Was sich dann im Mund deutlich bestätigt. Feine Resezenz. Im Nachtrunk kommt eine leichte, lang anhaltende Bittere.
Alles in allem ein sehr ausgewogenes, interessantes Bier.
Mir schmeckts wunderbar. Ich würde es zu einem kräftigen wildgericht Trinken.
Practically exemplary dubbel. Excellent balance. Sweetness passing in astringency. When heated, the taste is only strengthened and improved.
это пиво очень вкусно. я бы, конечно, рекомен& его всем. пожалуй& обратит& его. очень хорошо!

Nice and dark with a little kick that's hard to explain. Almost likenit has a little extra carbonation. Good beer. Nice head.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

From site: A reddish brown trappist ale, malty and fruit, featuring a 3 week secondary fermentation. This ale has a full, pale yellow head. The bouquet is full of esters and fruitiness. Notes of ripe banana predominate. The taste is fruity and slightly bitter, with a long, dry finish.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

330ml bottle. Pours a hazy garnet with a one finger tan head. Smells pretty great. Raisin, prune, red plum, red licorice, brown sugar, dried cherries, a very light note of pink bubblegum, light molasses, and light doughy notes. Taste wise, the red licorice notes are kind of in the forefront, with mineral notes, earthy dried dark fruits and decent bitterness that follows through the end and balances the sweetness nicely. Maple syrup, brown sugar, and a light piney note in the finish.

Smells great, dried fruit, plums, figs, some belgian spice and a hint of spicy hops. Very brown, streaming effervescence, thick brown head. Tastes great, a lot of flavor for 7%. Very malty upfront, more dried fruit, finishes with candi sugar, earthy hops and a spicy/sharp note. Medium bodied and highly carbonated. Quite good dubbel.

AROMAT: Na pierwszym planie suszone śliwki, morele, wiśnie w likierze oraz wyraźne nuty melanoidynowe, w tle zaś banany, rodzynki, ziołowość, charakterystyczne belgijskie drożdże i delikatnie alkohol.
WYGLĄD: Barwa ciemno brunatna, przy dnie kieliszka rubinowa, opalizujące. Piana drobno i średnio pęcherzykowa, szybko opada.
SMAK: W smaku owocowe, czyli wiśnie, śliwki, morele i rodzynki.Wyraźny alkohol delikatnie kontruje słodycz suszonych owoców, jak również przyjemnie rozgrzewa. Wysokie wysycenie. Goryczka srednia, alkoholowa, zalegająca. Klasyk!

Pours reddish brown, with a light tan head. Aromas are bubble gum, banana and booze. Taste is cloyingly sweet, and barely bitter. The aftertaste ends abruptly. The mouthfeel is slightly thick and the carbonation is low.

750 ml bottle pours a reddish brown color with a small white head. Aromas of banana, belgian yeast, cloves, sweet bready malt. Medium bodied, a great beer

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Nice over ripe banana, belgian bready-yeast dominant aroma. Some interesting aromatic tones. Hints of dried fruit and dark malt. Fairly heavy carbonation but carries the beer beautifully. Nice medium/full palate. Banana notes in flavor , a little chamomile, bread. Malt is subtle. My only gripe is its a little metallic in the flavor. Dry finish with some soft bitterness.

In Belgium for work but severely limited in free time, I vowed to try two beers a night. This was the second night. Had it with a friend over cheese and salami at a place near Mannekin pis, out of a 750. Great aroma, smooth and chocolatey and malty. Stood perfectly in the glass under a perfect head. Outstanding smooth taste which grew more complex and satisfying. Lingered on the palate and in the nose. One of the best beers and certainly amoung the finest of the Belgians. Interestingly, I had not been so crazy about this drinking it in the States, this was a 750 bottle not a 330 and it was no doubt very fresh. Worth trying again at home!

UPDATED: AUG 17, 2015 Pours deep red to brown with some sediment. Large beige head dissipates quickly leaving loosely dispersed bubbles. Nose of bread, banana and brown sugar, soft notes of caramel and dried fruit. Lively carbonation with flavours of raisin, clove, soy sauce and subtle leather. Sweet on the tongue, then peppery. Finishes clean though with a slight alcohol bite with sherry notes on the end.
Sure, its only bleeding gorgeous so it is. Lovely with a bite to eat-careful though itll blow your little head off xx

Red brown color with tall quickly disappearing tan head, coarse bubbles, aromas of ripe banana, plum, brown sugar. Second nose has notes of yeast and marzipan. Oily texture. Sweet and slightly bitter in mouth. Good balance: sweet but not overly sweet.
From the bottle. Reddish brown pour with a thick rocky head. Fig prune and brown sugar aroma. Smooth crisp malt with big bitter bite and residual sweetness. Very tasty.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2017 Butelka, warka do 24/09/16. ciemno brazowo-karminowo brunatne, przktycznie nieprzeswitujace (choc w tulipie od duvela ciezko o przeswitywanie), wysoka piana, glownie drobnopecherzykowa. znika dosc szybko, zostaje nieco na szkle. Aromaty dublowe - glownie ciemne owoce, rodzynki, sliwki, tez banan, czuc slodowosc, troszke alkoholu, cos jakby miod spadziowy, tez troszke tych klasztornych drozdzy (choc bardzo delikatnie), karmel, chleb... bardzo fajny aromat i dosc intensywny. Smaki nieco ubozsze, mocno zdominowane owocowo-karmelowa slodycza. goryczki niemal nie ma w samym smaku, za to mila, zauwazalna w posmakach, co nie pozwala sie "zaslodzic". alkohol bardzo delikatny, ladnie schowany. dosc wytrawne, gladkie w ustach. Stosunkowo niskie jak na dubla wysycenie. Bardzo przyjemny, relaksacyjny, szybko znika. Jedna mala uwaga generalna: trafilem w przeszlosci ze dwa razy na warke, ktora miala bez porownania slabszy i aromat i smak. Analogiczny, tyle ze po prostu mniej intensywny, slabsze nuty w ogole sie gubily. Niemniej na pewno piwo warte goracego polecenia. warka nie spisana, butelka - wszystko powyzsze sie zgadza, kolejne spostrzezenia - piana megatrwala w kontrascie z tym co wczesniej zapisalem "znika dosc szybko" - widac zalezy to od czegos tam... bardzo intensywne te aromaty i smaki, ocena o 0.1 w gore pro forma ;)zmiany po slepym tescie dubbli - szczegoly tiny.pl/gwtlqOcena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).
How: Bottle Appearance: dark red, small head Aroma: dried fruits, banana, caramel Palate: medium to full body, smooth carbonation

330ml bottle at the Beerstore, Thessaloniki. Dark brown color with beige head. Aroma is malty, roasted, caramel, fruity. Sweet and light bitter taster like aroma. Medium oily body with soft carbonation.

Pours a deep dark Amber with a thick head. Aroma is small and dark fruits. Taste is dark fruits malty and slightly sweet. So smooth and delicious tons of flavors yet very easy to drink. Excellent will drink again.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
330 ml into a chalice. Pours a deep brownish mahogany, beige/tan ring of foam; nose of banana, malt, dried fruits; a bit of caramel flavour, fruity, with a slight dry bitter finish. Pretty stellar.

Bottle with expiry 03/2016. Black colour, rocky head. Aroma of dark chocolate, dried fruit, with intensive bready aftertaste. I like there is not much raisins and prunes in the aroma. Alcohol well hidden. Also not too sweet. Lively carbonation. Very good.

Pours deep dark with a lasting, frothy off-white head. Appealing looks, beautiful dubbel. Rich, fruity aroma. Clear presence of dark fruits, plums, berries, nuts, some banana and a tad of caramel as well. Has something vinous as well. Exciting. Taste is mildly sweet with a dryish touch. Clear presence of the fruits, definitely banana, raisins, plums, cloves, spices (slightly peppery), small alcohol bite. Truly marvellous. Some warmishness in the end, accompanied with a roasty feeling and soft sweetish (close to dry), almost vanilla-like taste. Soft, yet so rich. Wonderful taste. Full bodied, bit of a thinnish, slightly creamy mouthfeel. Bit too much carbonation to my likings. So, the palate is a bit of a minor point. But indeed, this brew is truly astonishing. Well-balanced, beautifully crafted brew by the Westmalle monks.
Bottle from Smatch, Brussels. Easy to drink, dark, reddish-brown Trappist beer with a secondary fermentation in the bottle. Triple version is more heavy to drink
Excellent dubbel. Perfect appearance, rich fruity, caramel, malt aroma and taste. Obvious choice whenever and wherever.
A world class beer, nice aroma, perfect malt flavour. Little hop taste but as expected for style. Probably my favorite Belgium beer.
I like that a lot. Chestnut brown with a small off-white head. Medium body and well carbonated. Lovely aroma of malt, plums, banana and dried fruit. Flavour also has sherry notes and caramel.

Bottle at by, gift from Eva. Pours dark brown color, small beige head. Aroma of caramel, woodpeckers, coffee, yeast, roasted malt. Taste is medium sweet, coffee, caramel, woodpeckers, plums, dark fruits, bit overcarbonated.

22/12/2014 @ home 33cl bottle just past its date.
Drak brown colour with tanned sticky head. Aroma : Fruits, caramel, port. Taste : light malty en caramel, dry port ending.
Dark with a medium head. Fruity aroma, some cherry and slight hint of caramel sweetness. Excellent
One of the better dubbels. Very easy to drink. Bery dark mutky color makes it not as pretty as some, but taste is pretty complete and aroma very pleasant.

Classic example of a Trappist Dubbel. Caramel, raisins, chocolate, dark brown sugar notes without ever being cloying. Highly carbonated but it doesnt feel harsh. Fruity esters. Like a sessionable barleywine.
bottle shared with hakes and turbo....dark pour with hints of raisen and plumb, nice malty well balancd , very good for its style

Westmalle Dubbels aging and complexity really do bring out the goods. With its sediment, brown body, and slightly rocky head, this ale is attractive in the way that only Abbey Ales can pull off. Aroma gives you an idea of the awesomeness to come. Banana, plum, and champagne-like yeast brightness. Flavor has the aforementioned fruits with apple and grape, as well. Theres also a candy-like sweetness and subtle hop tones. Carbonation is just right - not too lively, not flat. Fruity, nuanced, and dry, Westmalle Dubbel is everything youd want/expect from a Belgian export.
Coloração castanho com espuma clara. Aroma frutado, doce, típico de dubbel. Sabor também característico adocicado mas ao mesmo tempo frutado e alcoolico. Gostei
Au Trappiste, Bern. Dunkles atrappiste mit ebensochem Schaum. Angenehn würziges, vollmundiges und komplexes Bier. Gut.

Bottle.

A- Ripe dark fruits, bananas, subtle spice, caramel, champagne.

A- Brown color, cloudy liquid, tan head.

T- Dark fruits, plum, banana, subtle spice, caramel.

P- Medium body, average texture, high carbonation, soft effervescent finish.

O- Didnt live up to the hype for me but a solid beer. Lots of dark fruit flavors and aromas and not overpowering. A little high on the carbonation, and almost felt like drinking soda at times although as it warmed this settled down.

UPDATED: NOV 3, 2015 Botella. @la taberna de hank. Luanco 18/12/2014
Botella. @Deutschland, Oviedo. 02/11/2015 BBD:19/03/17 
Color marrón, aromas y saabores dulces, buena.

11.2 oz. bottle from Party Time Liquors in Spearfish. Appearance: 2 fingers tan to light chocolate head, copper red color, light cloudy, ok lacing. Aroma: earthy molasses, dark fruitiness, grassy hops. Palate: average carbonation, dry finish, medium body. Taste: sweet malty molasses, into earthy dark fruit sweetness, with grassy hops balancing the sweet, finishing slightly bitter with lingering fruit notes. Overall, very good, super drinkable, amazing balance, very well done beer.
Aromas of plums, raisins, a hint of alcohol. Deep brown colour with big, big head. Full taste with delicate sour finish.

Good classic double. Nice deep dark with a fluffy off white head and soft lively carbonation. I like that it is not too sweet. Flavors are well balanced. Noting is dominant. It is yeast, malt sweetness and some burned malts, caramel and fruits and hops. Alcohol is hidden. Body is light and refreshing for such a dark beer. Acessible easy to drink.

Bottle - deep ruby red with a light brown fizzy head that slowly fades to a small ring. Aroma of roast malt, earth, spices, grass, followed by rich coffee, vanilla and some bubblegum. Taste of malts - roasty and peppery, with notes of clove and bubblegum. Rich and sweet. Medium body, high carbonation.
Rich and complex, yet at the same time rather mild. Lots of fruit, mostly of the sour variety, and fairly tart from the mid out. A bit weak and somewhat thin on the finish.

A strong Belgian Trappist beer with a good dark body and a good frothy head. Has a fruity aroma and a sweet taste.

33 cl bottle at home. Pours a deep brown colour with a medium head. Aroma is sweet and spicy, almost of clove. Complex taste, initially sweet but with a developing smooth bitterness. The finish is quite short, but bitter. There is almost a peppermint jam undercurrent, which is almost palate cleansing. A rich and satisfying beer which is also very drinkable.

UPDATED: OCT 23, 2015 The colour is a hazy, very dark brown with a huge beige head. Fruity and nutty aromas, and a full, complex taste, with flavours of date, banana and prunes alongside hints of leather and spice. A really great, well-made beer. Ale heaven.
Bomber shared around during the Thanksgiving meal - thanks Kristin for selecting. Cocoa, spices, grapes added in the flavor. Tasty and interesting. 14.3
Bottle west riding dewsbury. Red brown good fluffy white head. Aroma is banana dark fruits taste same nice sweetness good malts nice bitter finish. Mecium body. Good stuff.

Bottle with BBE 9/2016. Pours murky brown with a strong head. Nose has gum, herbs and raisins. Mouth is dusty yeast with herbs and a taste between plum and raisins. Taste is lightly sour with bitterness. Thick texture with a nice finish.
Bottle pour. Dark brown amber with a very large creamy tan head. Aroma is light, but it is earthy, dark fruit, and bread. Full body. Dark fruits and sweet malts.

Bottle poured. Cloudy amber brown with a generous frothy tan head and great lacing. Earthy aroma with hints of cherry and noticeable floral hops. Light body with a sweet creamy texture. Beer is sweet with a satisfactory aftertaste. All in all a solid beer.

UPDATED: DEC 28, 2014 Flasche (75 cl) vom Bierzwerg-Onlineversand, 1 Jahr gelagert. - Tiefes Rotbraun, leicht trüb. - Herrlich komplexe Nase mit fruchtig-würzigem dunklem Malz und leicht weiniger Fruchtigkeit. - Im Antrunk volles dunkles aber nicht schweres Malz mit Röstnoten, aufgelockert durch würzige Noten und blasse, herbe Fruchtigkeit (Mandarine). Gut rezent, schlank. Trockener, fruchtig-herber Abgang, zart säuerlich und mit einem Hauch von Marzipan. - Ausgezeichnetes Dubbel mit ungewöhnlicher aber angenehmer würziger Herbe. Stark aber nicht süß, schön herb und erfrischend. Bei Erwärmung wird es noch reicher und komplexer.

Courtesy of bartlebier, thanks a lot. Earthy mineral aroma, some white pepper, warming up to some fruitier notes, roasted malts showing up, very well hidden abv, great drinkability with more roasted malt flavours, under layers of ripe sour cherries leaning into marzipan with a hint of bitter almonds, ending with a subtle sourish note over a layer of earthy peppery yeast aromas. Beautiful.

Bottle ( 3). BB 9-12-2015. Very murky and dark reddish brown colour with expectedly massive beige head. Retains, laces. Nose is very sweet, caramelised sugar, nondescript fruits (kinda like tutti-frutti), plum skin, yeast and malts, a note of alcohol too. Later acquires a gluey note. Taste is caramel and toffee sweet, dark fruits, a kind of plum wine note there, bubblegum, malts, alcohol only hintingly present, mixed in with those plum wine notes. Quite some bitterness too, increasing in the finish. More bitter as it warms. Dry on the palate, body and carbonation just right. Good drinkability despite the 7%. Its among my favourite widely distributed beers.

0.33l bottle served in a Chimay chalice.
A: Pours a dark amber to brown bit cloudy color. A huge creamy beige head is formed when poured. Low retention and only few lacings left in the glass
S: Strong on Belgium yeasts. Sweet. Candy sugar and honey. Brown bread, caramel malts and citrus hops in the end. Very fruity with strong notes of grapes. Some notes of wood
T: As the nose, first impression is a toffee, candy sugar and honey sweetness. Grapes and oak. Brown bread, roasted malts and Belgian yeasts. Funny bubblegum sensation in the tong. End is mainly composed by a citrus, earthy and dry mild hoppy bitterness
M: Medium body and carbonation. Sweet upfront followed by a earthy citrus mild bitterness 
O: Very drinkable. Very well done. Mandatory for Belgian lovers

Generally, its one of the best dubbels Belgium has to offer, always worth a tryign.

Bottle BBE: 26/3/16. Lightly chilled. Pillowy tan head atop a very deep reddish brown body. Great head retention and lacing. Light aromas of almonds, raisins and bread. Medium to full-bodied, oily texture, and slightly low carbonation, despite the impressive head. Overall a typically interesting Belgian, but lacking in any real defining characteristics.

Transfer from BA review on 7-6-13-

 Poured from bottle into a chalice glass

 Appearance  The beer pours a hazy brown color with some red highlights shinning through. Upon pouring there is a one finger creamy colored head that fades over a moderate level of time to leave a lighter level of lace on the sides of the glass.

 Smell- The aroma is of roasted malt and some darker fruit smells. The darker fruits are of a plum, raisin and cherry aroma giving a moderately sweet dimension to the smell. When mixed with a yeasty and slightly bready aroma the mix of smells produces a rather nice dubbel aroma.

 Taste- The taste begins with a dry roasted malt flavor and a brown bread taste. There are some dark fruit flavors, but these are on the drier side only adding the fruit flavor without the sweetness. Some light yeastiness and a more bitter citrus flavor begin developing more toward the middle to the end of the taste. In the end with a little bit of a roasted/smoky flavor coming to the tongue, one is left with a dry roasted and dark fruit flavor to linger on the tongue with just a hint of bitterness.

 Mouthfeel  The body of the beer is on the medium side with a carbonation level that is on the slightly above average side consisting of lots of tiny carbonation bubbles. The combination of carbonation and thickness are nice for the drier flavors creating a very crisp feel overall.

 Overall  It has a nice flavor profile, but is a little drier then what I was expecting for a dubbel. If you are looking for a crisp Belgian style with some good fruit flavors and nice roasted malt taste, then this is a good go too, but if you want something slightly more on the sweeter side then this is not what you want. It is certainly good and something to try if you are in the mood for something drier.

UPDATED: FEB 5, 2016 Being Flemish, I grew up with this beer, as in my grandparents days it was practically the only trappist ale widely available in Flanders; the prototype of the dubbel genre and a classic among the Belgians. Tanned, mousse-like, delicately lacing foam, colour deep mahogany, misty; aroma of caramel, walnuts, banana, cloves, coffee grounds, liquorice, hazelnut paste, fondant; taste begins subduedly fruity with a subtle hint of citrus, quite sharp carbonisation, after which a deep caramel- and nut-like maltiness follows, perhaps a bit stiff and harsh when young, dryish, almost woody, yeasty with spicy accents, mineral-like touch, aftertaste leafy and somewhat peppery hops, lightly toasted, long and dry without any trace of cloying sugar, thirs-quenching. Becomes remarkably softer with ageing and I took this into account when scoring. Also one of the few trappists available on draft, then smoother and less harsh and in my opinion more rewarding than a young bottle. Such variations in taste depending on age and means of storage and serving only add to its potential.
Translucent red with a thick lasting tan head. Aroma of caramel. A bit tart. Taste of prunes, apricot and caramel. Medium body and thin texture.
