Spicy yeast, caramel malt, bread crust, plums, raisins, brown sugar fill the mouth. Finish is long and spicy, sweet and complex. Delicious brew.

Egészen mély, vörösesbarna színnel hömpölyög a pohárba, vastag, tömött, múlni nem akaró habkoronát képezve annak tetején. Eléggé zárkózottan indít, illata legalábbis eleinte meglehetősen visszafogott. Íze annál élénkebb, pörkölt malátás, élesztős alapjegyekkel, hosszan tartó, komlós utóízzel. Összességében egy tökéletesen kerek ízvilággal rendelkező, kellemesen markáns sörről van szó.

UPDATED: JAN 20, 2016 Volle grote schuimkraag die er mooi crème achtig uit ziet. Caramel aroma basterd suiker Krachtige pittige moutsmaak met een fruitig karakter. Fel van smaak en warm in de afdronk. Lange nasmaak zoals elke Westmalle.

Bona cervesa, equilibrada i gustosa.
Buena cerveza, equilibrada y sabrosa.

Bottle, 330 ml. Pours deep amber with a finger of creamy tan head. Lacing is significant. Aroma of caramel malts, honey, praline, dark fruits and banana. Taste is based around caramel malts, with notes of citrus, honey, apple, cinnamon, dark fruits and brown sugar. Body is medium to full and carbonation. Slight hint of bitterness on the aftertaste, which also consists of cereal, pepper and honey or caramel. Alcohol is not detectable on either the nose oft he tounge but is pleasantly warming. About the right sort of excellence Ive come to expect from this sort of beer.

Bottle. Brown pour with a thick, creamy beige head. Dried fruit and soft yeast in the aroma, lots of raisin. Flavour is dark fruits, plum, yeast. Not very heavy mouthfeel, but silky texture and a very nicely balanced flavour.

Pours a dark brown, not transparent at all in the glass, with thick beige head. The first scents are of wet dog, accompanied by some roasted malts, some toffee and the slightest whiff of coffee. Roasted malt hits first on the flavour. Rather thin palate but with nice flavour profile, lingering roasted notes. With some temperature, more dark malty and coffee scents emerge.

Pours a brown color with pillow like tan head. Smells like bread, malts, dark fruit, and leather. Tasted of dominant leather with yeast. The palate is medium ending dry and bitter. Not a bad beer but I need to try more of this style to understand how it should taste.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Robe d'un brun acajou
Arômes maltés de caramel et senteurs florales
Saveurs torréfiées et toastées de malt, caramel et réglisse

UPDATED: JUN 8, 2014 Medium light beige head, nice leathery opaque brown reddish colour. Caramel, yeastsm cake, fruits and nuts aromas, with a lil hint of alcohol. This dubbel has moderatly sweet presence compared to the most, which gives it a superb balance, never overwhelmes the actual beer taste. Yeasty and grainy, typical sweet belgian taste, biscuity , malty, bready, bit spiced. Great bittery finish quite long finish. Also more present carbonation for the category in my opinion, which gives this beer a refreshing note and high drinkability for a dubbel. You can definitely spot some similarities with the west tripel
Dark reddish brown color with beige foam. Sweet and intense flavor, like chestnut. Also dark fruits and sweet malts. The fruity flavor leads to an interesting bitter finish.

A 33 cl bottle from Legacy Liquor in Vancouver. A very dark bronze beer with generous tan head. Sweet and fruity on the nose. Taste of apples are first up on the palate. Some burnt sugar background and more apples, a bit of banana. Low bitterness. 3.8.

Bottle 33 cl.
Hazy brown, off-white head. Some fruit, some malt, and some yeast, on a surprisingly shy nose. Nice well balanced flavour, with a slight bitter finish. The balance and the overall impression is very good. Everything is just a bit weak.
caramel, resin, roasty, brown, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, full body, sticky, average carbonation, long finish

UPDATED: AUG 2, 2015 Donkerbruin bier met schuim. Smaak is bitter hoppig, niet zoet, caramel, chokolade, lichte rook. Blijft gemiddeld lang hangen.
Update 1-8-15. Van het vat gedronken tegenover de abdij. Smaak is voller dan uit fles.
Dark brown, with thick caramel-coloured beige head. Liquorice aroma. Taste medium sweet, light bitter. Thick mouthfeel.
Bottle from Bruges. Chestnut colour with a cream head. Flavours are malty with caramel and some fruitiness too. A nice enjoyable beer.

Aroma: caramel, honey, malts. Appearance: hazy dark brown, medium creamy beige head. Taste: medium bitter. Palate: bitters intensify, very bitter, medium long finish. Overall: not sure about this "famous" Abbey Dubbel - too bitter in palate. Bottle at Cafe Vlissinghe, Brugge.

Color nice hazy coppery brown head was a bit less than the rest of the Trappist it didnt stand on its own like great stuff nice aroma can smell the malt and a Carmel note Taste very smooth good mouth feel/carbonation a little sweeter smoother than some of the other Trappist

Bottle. Nice and dark, perfect foam. Aromas of meat stew, apple sauce, little citrus. Taste starts nice and mellow but quickly turns to a robust dark ale taste. Palate is a little uninspired, some caramel, chestnuts, even some cola, but nothing wins, making the taste end in an insignificant blend. Little low on carbonation.
Brun med fint medium høyt skum. Aroma av malt, gjær og banan. Smaken er malt og noe banan. Mye kullsyre samt ganske tørr i munnen. Medium konsistens. Noe bitterhet i ettersmaken.

This is a wonderful dubbel that pours dark chocolate brown. The body is dark and hazy. The head is off white thick and bubbly, that makes for good lacing. Aromatic roasted malts and classic Belgian yeast fills the nose. Also there were light unripe or green banana and caramel notes. It tastes as good as it smells, malty and sweet, with hops being very low key. Molasses and malts, banana and caramel blend together to round out this smooth and silky ale. The body is full with soft carbonation and finishes dry, slightly bitter.

Pity dobrze wyleżakowany. Niestety aromat, choć bardzo przyjemny był mało intensywny. Czerwone owoce, lekki karmel. Smak to już zupełnie inna historia. Świetnie się ułożyło, alkohol niewyczuwalny w ogóle, świetny balans pomiędzy karmelową słodyczą, cierpkością czerwonych owoców, wyraźną przyprawową goryczką na finiszu, lekką drożdżowością i nietypowym, lekko orzechowym, lekko drewnianym, wytrawnym posmakiem. Świetne piwo, szkoda, że aromat uleciał.
Very dark brown, with beige head. Intense junipery, licorice aroma. Dense flavors of ripe fruit and licorice dominate the taste. Decent, but Rochefort and Westvleteren are vastly superior.
U. Mooi donker, dun schuim. G. Zurig, niet zo lekker. S. Niet lekker. M. Veel koolzuur. T. Niet zo best.
Banana..no doubt + resin+ grass. Reminds me some kind of white sparkling wines. The bitterness evolution is complex and long lasting.

Bottle, 33cl. Pours a deep ruby/copper colour with a crispy light brown head; Aroma is of sweet malts, with hints of banana and other fruits. Robust malt character, with a strong spicy feel. Heavy alcohol finish and bitterness. Very nice.
Botlle 33cl. Dark amber with a huge foamy head. Mild aroma, but Im not able to describe it. Well-balanced taste. Slighlty bitter at the end, but overall a great beer.
Smakte denne i Edinburgh, en meget god avveksling fra Skotsk Ale. Godt med en belgisk trappist som man vet leverer varene.

A bit from memory... Nice aroma of spice and maltiness. Full bodied with lots of flavors that speak of spice, caramel, malty and definitely ripe banana. Best description for me is full bodied and warming.

UPDATED: APR 27, 2016 [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Arsenaal, Antwerpen IV/2014. Filling in some homey gaps on tap... Both creamy and dry, bready, stone fruit-yeasty with a generous helping of spicy hops to more than balance out the ripe banana and roasted caramel dominating the finish. Quite vivid carbonation, making the mf a bit harsher, with a mineral edge. Opens up like an autumn fruit basket as it warms. / Rerate via Het Vermaek, 2015: started to appreciate the creaminess and gently vegetal, rooty spice among the dark fruit cocktail. World class and always a treat.
33 cl Euston Tap. Mörkbrun FÄRG. Skummade rejält. Doftar karamell och kola. Smakar caramel, humle och bröd.

UPDATED: APR 23, 2015 RE-RATE: Draft Version @ Chez Sophie, Shrewsbury. Much sweeter due to continuous refermentation in the barrel, and not as highly carbonated, as bottle. Perhaps too sweet, prefer bottle.

330ml bottle from Les Crepes de Sophie, Shrewsbury. Cant believe I havent rated this or the tripel yet. Pretty much the only beer I drank when I lived in France was Westmalle. Cracked this open and drank in a big flowery park. Pours deep brown with a nice big head. That smooth, reasurring caramel flavour is there from the start, settling you in before hints of chocolate and dark fruits come through in a way only this Dubbel can. Satisfying and somewhat light for a dark Belgian beer. The original and best, no doubt about that.

Reviewed from notes.
The appearance was a dark brown color with some hazy ruby edges, not much lacing, but what there is clings sporadicly around the edges. The head lasts oh, probably about a good minute.
The smell had some glazed apples - coming through kinda sugary, cinnamon - perhaps. I like the nice spice that allocates itself fairly nicely to the aroma.
The taste was mainly sweet but still theres a nice spice to the flavoring. The aftertaste - uh...well, there isnt any aftertaste - ok, well, no worries. I got a quick dry finish.
On the palate, it sits about a light to medium, sessionability - hmmm....not quite. I can tell it wants to be, but for the most part, in my opinion, it seems to sit closer to the medium aspect. Carbonation seems to be a tad sharper than most Dubbels Ive had, but still worthy of being construed as a Dubbel.
Overall, in my opinion, this is a pretty good Dubbel well worthy of having again despite having a harsher carbonation than most.

Birra perfetta, di carattere. Si presenta benissimo con il suo colore scuro e la schiuma compatta e pannosa. Al naso aromi penetranti di frutta, spezie e caramello. In bocca molto equilibrata nonostante lelevato grado alcolico. Finale lunghissimo.
Birra imperdibile!
UPDATED: MAY 28, 2014 Dunkle Früchte, Lakritz, Holz, brauner Zucker, malzig. Leicht bitter, schöne Kohlenäure und anhaltender Nachgeschmack.
Pours dark brown with beige creamy stable foam. Aroma is sweet and malty. Taste little sweet. Nice dubbel, as the tripple is too
Nice aroma, gentle first taste, followed by a harder, sweeter aftertaste. A very good beer!

Bottle. Thanks Johan!
Brown/red with a fizzy beige head.
Lots of cherries in the aroma, some red wine/vinous note as well.
Sweet and herbal bitter taste, some tart note, slight chocolate and alcohol. 
Medium body, high but soft carbonation, dry.
Bottle. Pours dark brown, hazy, wonderful frothy head. Very weak aroma of ripe fruits, bread, brown sugar. Taste: brown sugar, bread, plums, ripe banana, spices, cherry.

Bottle poured into a tulip--First off I uncap the bottle and a little foam rises up and out of the bottle. Pours a dark brown with a thick head. Didnt really smell anything at first but all of a sudden the smell of grapes hit me almost like grape juice but you have to find it. Lots of bubbles with foam hanging on side of glass. Taste reminds me of a dry wine without out the acidity. I think I now know what people mean by dark fruits. I do not taste any grapes or citrus at all. To me this has no sweetness at all. A medium bodied beer with lots of carbonation. For me its too dry of a beer with a little bitterness added, not quit my flavor but good.

UPDATED: JAN 2, 2016 Bottle. Pours dark red brown with a tan head. Aroma: dark fruit, candy sugar, banana, clove. Taste: dark and red fruit, banana, brown sugar, bread, some spices. Pretty sweet, with a hoppy bitterness in the background. Medium body, long dry finish. Excellent value for money (over here) 8/4/8/4/16. Rerate 3-1-2016: nice, but not really that spectecular as i thought it before. 7/4/7/3/15

Butelka 0.75L. Brunatne z drobinami drożdżowymi. Piana skąpa, jasnokremowa, szybko znika.
Aromat: bardzo ładny mocno chlebowy, lekko słodki, chleb ciemny ze śliwką, brązowy cukier, rodzynki i wiśnie. Alkoholu nie czuć wcale.
Smak: podobnie do aromatu, chlebowo, owocowo bez wyczuwalnego alkoholu. Lekko słodkie i kwaskowate zarazem. Goryczki prawie nie ma.
Odczucia: ciało średnie, wysycenie średnie.
Świetnie pachnie, przyjemnie się piję, choć jak dla mnie lekko za słodkie. Polecam.
one of those belgians just everyone should get to taste - one of the richest tasting trappists, better drink cellar temp than fridge

Bottle bought at hyper market in Belgium. Dark. Off white head. Highly carbed. Mellow taste - compared to other Belgians I've tried. Nice

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

A lovely, dark, white-headed Trappist beer with a fresh start, ripe banana middle & hop laden finish. 

Rated by BrewTom

Banana-bready, sweet, a little chocolatey. Touch of booze but a nice dry finish given the sweetness midpalate. Reminds me of the banana chocolate chip protein muffin things from Trader Joes, in a good way.

Bottle at Winking Lizard Crosswoods on 4/12/14. Hazy brown pour with a huge tan head. Aroma of caramel, malt, dark fruit and slight banana esters. Malty and spicy flavor giving way to caramel and cherry before a dark fruit and slight alcohol finish.
Duft: sødme, malt, karamel, smag: meget sød, citruS, karamel, rosin, eftersmagen er meget karamel

Poured from a bottle, forming a tall head. Pleasantly sour at the start but it weakened a bit as I worked my way to the bottom. Considering the high 99 rating, I expected more from this beer. It was good; it was not great.

Bottle at Pie Whole. Dark brown pour with an off white head. Banana and clove aromas. Effervescent. A weird sort of bitter off taste dominates the caramel, brown sugar, banana, and clove. Average body and mouthfeel.
Bottle. Reddish brown color. Cloudy. Thin off-white head. Full body. Nice carbonation. Very sweet and smooth.

Color ámbar oscuro, media cabeza de espuma beige que perdura unos mms; aromas a caramelo, frutos secos y ésteres, en boca entrada suave apreciándose la malta tostada, notas a regaliz, amargor equilibrado con carbónico moderado; pos gusto largo y maltoso notándose el amargo de la malta pero sin ser excesivo; cerveza aceptable y fácil de beber.

0,33 l bottle with a nice design and simple but good looking label art. Dark brwon, nearly black in the glass, huge head. Fruits and nuts on the nose. Starts smooth fruity, warming light alcoholic. Low herb. Fizzy, low sourness. Easy to drink. Good one.

Cloudy brown color , medium beige head. Aroma of dark fruits and belgian yeast. Rich taste of raisins , cherries , malt and some chocolate . Light sweet , light tart , and light bitter - very good balanced. Classic of belgian dubbel .

A - Deep brown, orangey hue with a thick, chunky head that lingers.

S- Plum, raisin, fig, brown sugar.

T- Plum and raisin up front with a yeasty finish. Slight bitterness.

M- Thin-medium bodied and very effervescent.

D- This is a great brew. I think if it were a little thicker and had less carbonation it would have scored even higher for me. Im sure the carbonation fades with time. Will stick a couple bottles in the cellar and forget about them for 5 years ...
Dark brown body with a tan head with good retention. Fruity caramel aroma. Taste is just right. Not too sweet not too bitter. Aftertaste is just right too. Very well balanced beer.

Hvala mom prijatelju Furi na ovoj pivi .. covjek voli putovati i donosit meni pive ..haha ,..iako moj prijatelj kaze da je ovo pivo odlicno ja se ne slazem s njim i cak mi je vrlo lose ...nije uopce pitko ..ogavan okus ..

Pours reddish amber with a large creamy off white head. Aroma is dark cherry, earthy, plum, raisin and and toasty...fantastic. Taste is sweet with tart undertones into a crisp dry finish. It is smooth and medium bodied. Overall just an excellent beer.
330ml bottle from Waitrose. Pours a dark brown with a thin beige head. Aroma is sweet smelling. Taste is malt, caramel, fruity and spicey notes. Very nice.

Bottle. Pours very cloudy, dark brown/ruby, not much in the way of a head, just a few off-white bubbles. poured carefully but quite a bit of yeast still came out. Aroma- dark malt, brown sugar, plum and raisin hints, dark cherry. Taste- quite a bit of sugary sweetness, brown bread, dark fruits present, some banana, bitter, malty background, lots of carbonation, fairly full-bodied. A nice, solid dubbel.

Nice creamy/light brown head. Malty and fruity smell. A nice dry fruity flavor with a little bitterness. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
the aroma is citrus with spicy undertones... the taste is malty and fruity with rough hoppy bitterness and shades of port... dry fruity aftertaste... wonderful dubbel...

Pours dark auburn with a foamy beige head that dissolves into a ring. Earthy aromas with a few sweet malts and prominent notes of overripe banana. The taste is initially light bitter and eases into a bolder, longer bitter finish. Full body, the medium carbonation gives way to a silky finish. Very, very nice.

Bottle. Dark brown with a large creamy tan head. Dark dried fruits, over ripe banana, cardboard, nuts, brown sugar. Medium body, oily texture, medium/high carbonation, light dry finish. Dry finish with notes of dried fruits. Pleasant.

Very dark brown red and yellow, with a thick and foamy head. The aroma is quite yeasty. The taste is rather heavy, Belgian Trappist. But the palate is soft and quite easy to drink. Not my favorite but still a very good Dubbel Trappist.
Very nice Belgium Dubbel. Good caramel, fruit taste. Drinks smooth and easy.

0,33L bottle, BB 24.06.2015. Pours dark brown with off white head. The head stays for a moment. Aroma is sweet, fresh fruits, apples, yeast, and malt. Taste is sweet, dark fruits, caramel, candy, and malt. Finish has some bitterness and tart. Overall: lovely beer and Im sure it gets better over time. I would really love to try aged version one day.
Got a Dubbel and a Tribbel from my host in antwerpen and told to mix them. Called a "trip trap".

botella 33cl. color marron con toques rojizos, aroma dulzón, a caramelo y levadura. en boca tiene un sabor intenso y complejo, toques dulces, a frutos rojos (cerezas), frutos secos (almendras) con un final seco y amargo.
Un super produit, encore une fois ! Equilibre parfait, alcool présent mais pas trop. Finale gentiment sèche et belle longueur.

Bottle at home. I had looked at this for a long time and not pulled the trigger in lieu of other beers, so now is as good a time as any. Pours a cloudy brown with a large tan head that leaves spotty lacing. The aroma and flavor have caramel malts, brown sugar, candi sugar, dark fruit, some banana, with a mild bittering component. Medium-bodied, sweet and malty. I like Rochefort, Westvleterren and some of the other traditional breweries better.
Bottle. Pours dark brown with beige creamy stable foam. Aroma is sweet and malty. Taste little sweet. Nice dubbel.
Caramel aroma. Very nice dark looking color. Lively carbonation. Body medium to full.

Poured a cloudy brown with quite a bit of head. Candy sugar and cloves come across in the nose. Same flavors are present in the mouth as well where a nice medium bodied beer goes down quite easily. Other flavors include some fruit and a slight spicy tang.

Ins Glas ergießt sich ein trübes rötlichbraunes Bier mit schöner Schaumkrone. Geruch nach getrockneten Früchten, Hefe, Karamell.
Geschmack hefig, Karamell, Früchte, leicht gewürzig.
Ótima cerveja estilo dubbel. Boa formação de espuma e boa persistência. Complexidade nos sabores e aromas. Caramelo, especiarias, cereal e mel.

Dark red-brown color with a creamy lasting head. medium carbonation. Aroma of malts and banana fruitiness. Taste starts out sweet but turns bitter hlafway of the sip. Dry finish. Good dubble beer. Not to tough in the taste but not without character as well.

Very good smell reaches the nose when I open a plug of beer. Its fragrance is seen smell but not strong thing but in a mouth. I think taste, beers crisp suit to cooking very characteristic and moderate sweetness.
UPDATED: MAR 11, 2014 A fruity aroma with a hint of alcohol. A cloudy red appearance with cream head that quickly dissipates. A fruity taste with bitternes and alcohol.
0,3l Flasche. Braunes Bier mit wenig Schaum. Der Malzduft steigt gleich in die Nase. So schmeckt es auch; malzig. geröstet und gleichzeitig fruchtig.

UPDATED: APR 21, 2015 Cloudy dark brown color, average off-white head. Good retention. Full body, lively carbonation. Aroma is dark fruits, malt, blueberries, yeast, banana. Very fruity. Taste of dark fruits, raisins, malt, yeast, banana, red fruits. Medium sweet, slightly bitter finish, and very dry. Very well balanced. Excellent!-- rated with beerbasher/winphone
Lite sweetnes, bread and malt aroma. Dark brown with little head. Malty, roasty, chocolate, good sweet and bitterness at the end. Very good beer.

Aroma is sweet belgian sugar with plum, raison and pear notes. The taste is a subtle fruit presence that has a slight alcohol bite on finish.Appearance is a brown/amber body with fine fruity sediment. Pearl head retains somewhat poorly.

Color rubí oscuro con espuma color crema. Aromas de fruta confitada, cereza y cereales. en boca tiene una densidad media, predominantemente dulce y afrutado con toques de azúcar moreno. El final tiene un amargor equilibrado que perdura hasta el regusto. Muy rica.

Bottle. What a wonderful beer. Looks great, very dark reddish brown with a ferm head. Lovely fruity taste and balanced aftertaste. I usually go for the trippel but on second thought this one might be equally amazing.
Aroma dominated by alcohol and wort, long lasting head and complex flavours of nuts caramel and chocolate.
Bottle. Malty taste.aroma of fruits, yeast and alchohol. Overall: 15/20 - -

Drank with Rik at Malden 20-2-2014. Looks nice and dark. A bit foam. The beer is a bit thin for dark beers. Lacks viscosity. Nice taste. Good, and with hints of chocolate and coffee. However, those hints were a bit vague. Good beer, too bad its not more overwhelming.

18.2.14, 0,33, butelka. Zapach kojarzy sie z dobrym szampanem, troszeczke ciemnych, porterowych nut. Po przelaniu do szkla czuc nuty utlenienia (piwo pilem 3 misiace od daty kupna), alkoholu, kojarzy sie ze swiezym porterem, sa tez nuty kawowe.Po jakims czasie dominuje estrowo-alkoholowy aromat. Piana potrzebowala chwile na uformowanie sie, potem- brudno biala, srednio-obfita, estetyczna. Ciemny, kompletnie nieprzejrzysty, jednolity kolor. W smaku dosc wytrawne, niestety czuc glownie utlenione, porterowo-alkoholowe nuty. Gorzkie na finiszu. Zero owocow.

UPDATED: DEC 20, 2014 Very easy drinking. Slips down too easily. An excellent choice for the suffering wife who is not into beer but needs to support you through a rich beer menu in a Belgium bar. But watch out ladies it sneaks up behind you and soon makes its effects felt! Sweet
Très bonne bière très agréable! Bouteille sympa et facile à reconnaître! Saccorde dans beaucoup de bonne recette culinaire! Et sapprécie aussi en Half en Half avec la triple!
Bu en bouteille de 33cl, une belle couleur brune mais peu de mousse, en goût ce qui ma le plus étonné cest son côté acide en début de bouche assez long.

Fra fat i Brussel. Fyldig og fin. Rund i kantene og masse mykfrukt. Sikkert påvirket av tid og sted.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Flaske fra vinmonopolet. Rødbrun farge, uklar, lavt/medium karbonert, tynn skumtopp. Smaker malt, gjær, mørk frukt, litt ettersmak av bitter druestein. Ganske god

Dark pour with a small head, aroma is malt, banana and alcohol. Taste is of roast malt, some dark fruit and a bitter hops finish. The carbonation suppresses the taste a bit, but otherwise its very good
Suprême couleur sombre, mousse persistante, goût d une légèretée incroyable, c est excellent. Un jolie tout d épices grille, une fois fini, on a juste envie d une chose, d en reprendre une..
Very nice fruity aroma (berries), high carbonation. Taste reminds me oft red wine, dark chocolate. Very nice!
Aroma ist eine Fruchtbombe Richtung Waldfrucht. Der Geschmack ist für 7% ausgesprochen rund. Interessante Bittere zum Ende.

Classic dubbel all the way. I think of this style as quad light. A bit less dark fruit, and a bit less ABV. And this one is quite good. Bitterness on top is odd but works. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

The slight smell belies the very pungent heavy taste. Quite citrusy with a bitter high aftertaste. Feels quite fizzy from the bottle. Nice dark colour. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

large creamy frothy offwhite head. mostly diminishing. flat thick dark amberish-brown body. aroma: heavy malt, dark chocolate, orange, alcohol. if: light swet acidic. ff: light sweet acidic bitter; average duration. palate: light medium body, watery texture, lively carbonation, metallic light alcoholic finish. Menos doce que outros ícones do estilo, mas bem alcoólica. O dulçor remete a malte  mais pro final sugere também caramelo. Amargor amadeirado. O ganha de temperatura a confere um pouco mais de dulçor. O álcool se sobrepõe as nuances que eu esperava pra essa bem cotada cerveja.90 s
Tørret frugt, gær og alkohol i aroma. Super cremet og prikkende, sødme balanceret af brune bananer, krydret. Tydelig alkohol i eftersmag. Heftig sag...
UPDATED: JAN 31, 2014 Dufr av rosin, vanilje ig gjær. Fin mørk brun farge. Tykt kremet gulbrunt skum. Fin smak av rosin og krydder.

Pours brownish red with a thick tan head. Aroma is caramel and tangy fruit skins. Flavor is sweet and creamy, with a nutty and yeasty finish

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Tap at Pegasus CPH V.
Sweet nose, sugar, spicy.
Dark orange color, White head.
Medium body, sweet, sugar, spicy, pepper,
Overall a wonderful sipper. Great with steaks or white meat. Have to have it in a proper glass though.

750ml corked bottle, poured into a Westmalle Trappist goblet. Appearance is cloudy dark brown with a large tan head that reduced quickly. Aroma of pear, caramel and prunes. Flavours of caramel, prunes, spices, banana and hint alcohol. Taste is medium sweet and medium bitter. Palate is full bodied, creamy texture and lively carbonation. Outstanding, one of the best beers in the style.

Dark brown. Some sweet dried fruits in aroma. Taste is sweet in the beginning than lots of esters and a quite bitter finish. Dry and a little watery mouthfeel. Good beer but there are much better examples of Belgian dubbels.

Bottle. Pours dark brown with a frothy beige head. Aroma is caramel, yeast, raisin, red fruits, floral and some ripe fruits. Taste is moderate sweet and light bitter. Medium bodied with a long dry finish.

Bottle, 33cL. Home. A dark brown beer. Light can hardly go through. Medium persistant head, thin foam. Aroma of caramel, spices, prune, honey, alcohol. Spicy sweet and bitter. Good balance. Medium body and texture. Warming beer. Spicy dry bitter finish. Nice spicy and fruity dubbel !
UPDATED: AUG 6, 2014 Bottle. Fruity yeasty aroma. Dark brown ale with brownish head. Caramel sweet with a bitter. Good.

Ruby reddish brown clear beer with a huge beige head. Aroma has pear-kind of Belgian yeast, sweet toffeey malts, dark fruits, little banana and some herbal spiciness. Taste is toffeey, dark fruity and brown sugary sweet. Feels a bit watery at times. The finish is woody dry licoricy - quite bitter and long, reminiscent of some British IPAs. Palate is medium full with a mediumly heavy and stingy carbonation, but not as high as on some other trappists. Pouring the yeast in makes the beer hazy and the flavor a bit drier. Pretty decent but nothing special.
On tap at Biercab. Brown colour with beige head. Malt, caramel, dark fruits aroma. Sweet, caramel, malt, slghtly bitter, fruity taste. Medium body.
Denk één van de laatste trappisten die ik nog moest drinken. Donker van kleur, en ideaal bij een temperatuur van 10 graden. De smaak is lekker zacht, alleen geen overtuigende smaak.
Dark brown with firm to. Medium to full bodied with a bit of coffee beans, also some sweet and sour. Well balanced. Didnt quite have the long finish i expected though

Pours a clear dark amber with a red hue & a dense large long-lasting creamy off-white head. Aroma of plums, caramel, candi sugar, cherries & a rich complex malty sweetness, Taste is a medium full bodied malty sweetness with a semi dry finish. Good balance between yeasty phenols and fruity esthers. Caramel, dark dried fruits, spicy phenoils and brown sugar. Overall this beer is complex and moderately strong malty Belgian ale.

.33L bottle served in a Belgian snifter. BB dated 28 Jan. 2015 - but i didnt want to wait any longer. This was my favorite beer for a while, during and following a visit to Belgium. I havent had it for a while except one small tasting, so lets see how it holds up. 

Appearance: dark brown with a variable density light brown head. Good retention and lacing. Some sediment remained in the bottle even after extracting every last drop of liquid. 

Smell: Dark bread with a load of raisins, dates, ripe bananas and generic dried dark fruits. Hints of pears, dried plums and spices. Light alcohol esters.

Taste: Similar to aroma profile but stronger, with more plum, and less sweet. This 7% ale drinks like 3-4%. Rich, bitter-sweet, durable flavor. 

Feel: Smooth, medium-full body; medium carbonation that seems just right. 

Overall: Excellent! World class for style. Unfortunately not cheap in the U.S. Engaging, flavorful, interesting and easy to drink. Highly recommended.

Bottle to pint glass
Loads of aroma wafting up from this glass...cherry, toasted malt, banana, chocolate, and cereal. Its a deep reddish brown with a huge 3cm tan head, settling to a thin head and leaving tons of lacing. Bread and cereal, dark fruit, and some spice ending with bitterness. This is very easy drinking and well balanced for a 7% beer.

330 ml bottle. Pours a hazy and sediments filled reddish brown with a resilient, thick and creamy beige head. Aroma is chocolate mousse, butter, red berries. Flavor is chocolate, cake, spices, vanilla ice cream and hints of raspberries. Finish is chocolate and coffee, roast. A rather light-flavored finish. Medium body, strong carbonation.

Dark reddish brown with a big white to beige head, good lasting, strong lacing.Aroma is sweet, fruity, strong green apple, caramel. Great! Taste is caramel, bread, fruity, wine. Bitter apple long finish. Good carbonation on palate, body is a bit weak. Good beer, with faboulous aroma.

Tasted from bottle. Pours a dark brown with a thick creamy beige head with lots of lacing. Aroma is very sweet smelling. Caramel, fruity and spicey notes. Taste is sweet malt with a nice subtle bitter hop balance. Pretty complex taste. Caramel, bread, dark fruits, spices. Full bodied with creamy and clingy mouthfeel. Excellent dubbel!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

From a bottle. Watching the Buckeyes in the Orange bowl. Go Bucks!!! Pours reddish brown with fading tan head. Nice nose with fresh bread, fruit and spice. Plum, banana and clove with a sweet finish... Beautiful beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Deep brown color with rich head and carbonation. Airy chocolate notes. Smooth character. Deep taste, lasting palate.

Thick beige head with sweet spices malt aroma. Dark opaque body. Taste is balanced between light hops and bitterness, soft caramel and medium alcohol.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle
Aroma-caramel, fruits
Appearance-brown, cloudy, tan foam, 
Taste-light sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, 
Palate-thick feel, lively, long finish, 
Overall-perfect

UPDATED: JAN 1, 2014 It is a pleasure to watch the lively carbonation rise up from the bottom of the hazy dark brown body to form the frothy beige head. Nice. The hearty nose contains caramel, apple, plum, and banana notes. The flavor is very rich; up front, it is dominated by sweet caramelized maltose before it makes the transition to dark fruitiness with prune, fig, cooked apple, and banana notes. The hops take a minor supporting role to the roasty malts, but it shines through in the finish in form of subtle bitterness along the well-hidden alcohol heat and doughy yeast, both of which stay in the background on the mid palate. The mouthfeel is outstandingly pleasant; with a body as full as this, just the right amount of carbonation adds the crispness that complements the rest of the features this beer has to offer, and the way it bubbles up while swirling it around in the mouth is genuinely intriguing. As great as one would expect from the mother of dubbel.
Hazy dark brown in colour. Thick mousse off white head. Great head retention. Taste: Fig&nutty and finished with a well balanced bitterness.

Pours brown and cloudy. Nose of bananas, apricot, prunes and glue. Fruit, bananas again on the palate , malty, neither sweet or bitter in the finish.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Wonderful beer this. Pours a redy brown initially with a large foamy tan head which quickly settles down. The smell has a lot going on with bread, spice and fruit. Theres a sweetness too in the smell and at times I catch a whiff of pear drops (but not overpoweringly). Its less sweet than I suspected upon tasting and very complex and pleasingly bitter with a light sourness too. It has a lovely creamy foamy feel in the mouth and its one to sip and take your time over. This is certainly an excellent beer!

A gift for the old suds group. Didn't have a glass so had to drink from the bottle. Syrup and malt taste with heavy carbonation and medium carbonation on the palate. Well done Trappist ale. 

- Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
A spectacular accompaniment to a strong, creamy blue cheese - or whatever you have at hand (to be honest)! An unarguably deserved benchmark of the style.

Poured into Trappist glass. Aromas are mild, malty and fruity. Poured dark brown and hazy with lots of carbonation and a thin white-creamy head that dissipated quickly. Lots of lacing in the glass though. Wonderful taste which improves in the glass. Mild, malty but complex with a some sweet then bitterness in the mouth. Somewhat thick with a bitter finish. One of my favorites.

Veldig god. Utsøkt aroma, litt skum, litt bitter ettersmak. En favoritt til øl som skal nytes for litt spesielle anledninger .

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

11.2oz bottle, shared by b3shine. I dont remember the exact bottling date, but I remember noting that this example had some age on it. Hazy dark brown color. Thin khaki head. Good thicker lace, some ropes. Bigger body. Smooth, crisp lighter carbonation. More crisp, less soft than typical belgians. Dry finish. Nice nuttiness, lighter dark fruit. Balanced spice. Moderate bitterness, more bitter than expected. Minimal sweet. Very nice, complex dubbel.

UPDATED: MAR 18, 2014 Candied sugar and chocolate with some spices and fruits; pears and bananas. Some rubber. The phrase burnt banana peel comes to mind. Dry, with moderate but good balancing bitterness.

Great looking earthy brown with big tan head that leaves some bubbly islands. Great lacing. Peach, apple, light spices, bit of roasted malts and candy sugar. Later more roasted notes, and a hint of espresso. Medium sweet, with both yeasty and hoppy bitterness. Great creamy mouthfeel with creamy and slightly fizzy carbonation. Medium bodied. Ive really grown to love this stuff, complex and very drinkable.

Nice head, strong nose, on first sip roasty, malty aftertaste. I had left the bottle on my terasse at 1, 2 degrees Celcius, so I waited a bit, letting the beer "heat up" bit.
Now it revealed all its character, Taste fruity notes, almost chocolate/caramel sweetness and still that strong roasty finish
Another great abbey beer discovered ;-)
330ml bottle. There is a lot going on here. Sour cherry and roasty but not too dominant. Long hop notes.

11.2 oz bottle to snifter (shared with DrSilverworm and the Mrs.). Looks good; a cloudy amberish brown with light beige lacing. Smells good too; candy, dark fruit, and Belgian yeast. Tastes like it smells with a pleasant mouthfeel. Good beer.
Mooi donker bier, licht zurige geur. Smaak is zoet, plakkerig maar niet vol.
33 cl bottle. Aroma: fruity. Appearance: dark amber, white head. Taste: light sweetness but not overly sweet. Palate: medium body, bitter finish that leaves a dryness. Overall: very nice beer
UPDATED: DEC 22, 2013 黑櫻桃色深如 Blue、St. Bernardus Abt 12稍遜。

Bottle: light haze, copper to brown. Moderate to low head. Malt, dry fruit, fig, raisin, dessert wine. Caramel. Rich. Dry, moderate bitterness. Sour or acid with high co2. Medium depth and long. Slightly hollow. Loads of flavor complexity. Muscat grapes, raisin, fig, dates, dry citrus rind. 
Wonderful aromatics and flavors but the texture is a little dilute. Still a bloody good beer.
DWS; Pours dark brown with creamy tan head. Malty, yeasty, sour, chocolate, dark fruity aroma and taste. Carbonated mouth. Warming alchol finish.
Fles 33cl. Donkere kleur. Witte schuimkraag. Eerste smaakimpressie : fris, fruitig, abrikozen. Heerlijk biertje!

Clear dark brown, rich brown head
Carbonated, roasted malts,sweet licorice
Sweet, lightly bitter ending
A really good meditation beer
Full filling aftertaste

Very nice dark color with huge off-white head. Aroma is loads of fresh fruit and apricot, and some fresh coffee beans and roasted malts. Very unique and complex aroma. Mouth feel is round with medium carbonation. Aftertaste is dry alcohol, fruity apricot, sweet malt and some floral hops. Overall: Wow! Truly unique in aroma and aftertaste!

33cl bottle @ home. Reddish-brown color, strong brownish head, sparkling. Fruit and caramel smell, dark fruits, biscuit, strange sweet-sour champage aroma which covers my tongue followed by a delicious long lasting bitterness. Taste light sweetness, medium bitterness, lightly sour. Medium body, lively carbon. Interesting and very complex beer but because of the sour taste its not really my style.
Smells of aprikoses, glue and candy. Creamy head. Dry aftertaste. Very nice and easy drinking.
Redbrownish great creamy head that lasts. Apricot, pear with a hint of glue in the aroma. Malty fruit candy. Nice hoppy aftertaste that mixes with alcohol. Palate nice. Great beer

330ml bottle into a trappist glass; served cool.

Aroma: Fresh bread, raspberries, honey. Heavy and kind of boozy.

Appearance: Dark, hazy, amber body with a creamy, but dissipating head.

Taste: Honey for sure. Yeasty with a hint of blueberry and raspberry.

Palate: Medium body, prickly carbonation, with a moderate-long bitter fruit finish.

Overall: Nice, and not what I was expecting. I havent had a dubbel that was as fruity as this one. Pretty nice!

Draft @ Bunker pub. Dark mahogany with red reflection, small creamy head. Faint aroma of roasted malts and nuts. Rich taste of roasted malt, lots of walnut , turning into sweet liquor and fruity caramel. Dry final. Full body, thin carbonation.

Bottle 0.33l. Pours deep brown with a foamy off white head. Looks great. Aroma is raisin, dried fruit, figs, plum. Taste is medium sweet, lightly bitter and sour, plums, dried fruit, figs. Beer has a full body, mouthfeel is creamy with an average carbonation and a long slightly boozy finish. Great Dubbel.

Poured from 33cl bottle (best before 11/03/15). Dark chestnut brown with tan head. Very interesting dark woody sweetness, some fig and subtle chocolate and licorice. Caramel, malt, dark fruit, and chocolate taste. Medium body. Well-balanced, but no standout signatures flavours.

(Bottle). An unfiltered ruddy brown complexion with excellent sustained tan head and lacing. The flavor is rich with Belgian yeast, semi-sweet malts and dried fruits. Long finish and smooth palate. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle: nice brown-ish, almost purple-tinted, murky body with a foamy layer of khaki colored cream that rests on top. Aroma is very indicative of the style; slightly vinous grapes, prunes, notable spices, Belgian yeast, & a bit of Candi sugar. No medicinal aromas, which is nice to see. Taste follows along with a big grape, prune, & red apple flavoring; mostly sweet but even very slightly tart at times. Good malty backbone with some notes of caramel that mix well with the banana & fruity esters. Sweet finish, light residual-like Candi sugar & some toasty, bread-y yeast. Nice dubbel.

Aroma: Caramel, malt, dried red fruit Appearance: Red brown, red glow, off white head, yeast flocks, light lace, disappearing head Taste: Liquorice, then sour that ends in a bitter sweet, little booze

Appearance: Clear dark ruby/brown with 4 finger ivory/tan head.
Aroma: Banana, bubblegum, vinous/spiritous, grassy/hay, liquorice and dried fig.
Taste: Medium sweetness, low/medium sourness and low bitterness.
Palate: Thin airy smooth texture and light body, prickly carbonation, astringent lingering spiritous fruity finish with alcohol warmth.
Comments: Very good and glass lace.

fles 33 cl
Kleur: roodbruin, flnk schuim, plakt aan het glas
Geur: banaan, fruit, zoet, mout.
Smaak: licht zoet blijft lang hangen, volmondig. Bittere nasmaak

Pours a handsome dark brown with honey like hues of lighter brown at the edges and where the glass will allow some light to pass through. The head is fat, tan and creamy. Falls slowly and leaves slippery lace. Nose is is exhilarating and dark. it has belgian woody yeast that promises a bit of dryness and is somewhat restrained but for a bit of apple and a very faint banana. There is a sweet light chocolate and deep smooth caramel on the nose. Dark fruits like fig and date but lively with the crispness of that apple behind them. The caramel just goes on forever in the nose. 

The taste is poetry. The nose of this beer seems to vibrate at an excited pitch. The fruits all ripe and clamoring for their peak, the caramel at its richest, the chocolate enticing and light over the top, the yeast falling to the background as it will fall to the middle of the beer in the drink. Then pure composure greets the palate. Smooth, creamy rich but not heavy. The bread soft and sweet and laced with dark fruit, endless caramel and light sweet chocolate. The yeast brings a dryness to the middle of the beer and there is a slight bitter undertone. It reminds me of molasses. The alcohol stops out just slightly, a bit impudent it seems to impart a sweet bit of warmth as it finishes. The fruits and floral take the last ideation of this beer on the palate as it fades to aftertaste with a bit of caramel to linger instead of the alcohol. 

Holy moly! Brilliant, self evident, inexhaustible and vital. This beer exemplifies the style and is worthy of your utmost attention.
Bottle in Belgium... Aroma is incredible! So nice!! Looks nice in glass. Taste is a little disappointing... Nice but a little colaish aftertaste rips apart the flavour.
En av nio klassiska Trappistöl. Blev först något besviken på smaken eftersom jag senast drack den på fat. Så otroligt mkt mer smakrik färsk! I övrigt en habil belgare, men det finns ju bättre sorter.
bottle. deep brown with one finger head. rich malt with substantial dark fruit and yeast. good complex flavor.

Pours dark brown murky cloudy with slight off-white head, lacing. Aroma is malt, orange, licorice, chocolate. Palate is medium full-bodied, carbonation mouthful and lively. Taste is malty, roasty, with nice bitter dry edge. Finish is bitter and dry with some sour notes. Solid Dubbel, but not that complex.

Bottle from Provenance Wines. Deep mahogany body with a large beige head. Excellent lacing. Aroma of sea salt, brown sugar, cooking apple and a faint metallic tang. Wonderfully complex sweet-and-sour flavour of overripe banana, candied almonds, sharp pear, fig and tangy yeast. Dry finish. Full body with a frothy mouthfeel. Lively carbonation. A fantastic beer - packed full of classic Belgian flavours, and outrageously drinkable for 7.0% ABV.
Red-brown color, light brown head. Dried fruit nose, belgian yeast, marzipan. Sweet, nutty taste, plum and prunes. Medium body.
De les dubbels més completes, torrada, densa i amb malta. Garantia trapista, garantia Westmalle

Pours cloudy dark/red. An almost dark ruby color. Has a light beige fluffy head. The aroma is sweet and fresh with nodes of fruits, caramel, flowers and citrus. Tastes sweet and malty with hints of caramel, chocolate, raisins and nuts. A great. mouthfeel. Thick but also tingling on the tongue.

UPDATED: FEB 1, 2014 On tap. Surprisingly refreshing with a great mouthfeel. Had it in a bottle many times but this was something different. Quite malty but with a great balance between sweet and bitter, both dark fruit and hops, with a hint of roasted malts in the finish. Love it in the bottle too, got a lot of marzipan, hops and a great balance between sweetness and hoppiness.

1Pt 9.4oz bottle. Pours cloudy reddish dark brown with large light tan head that rapidly dissipates to a thin ring with little to no lacing. Malty and dark chocolates in the nose. Some espresso notes but hidden beneath the caramel and dark fruit. Chocolate malts first to appear for taste. Bitter sweet linger of some nice hops, surprising for this style. Medium carbonation and a crisp mouthfeel. Pretty good but not truly great. Surprising alcohol presence for the 7% ABV.

Colour: dark copper red and brown. Two finger head
Nose: candy sugar, red apple, dried fruits. Yeast, nuts & leaves.
Flavours: raisins, more dried fruit and sugars. Slightly woody.
Finish: warm, hint of alcoholic strength. Mellow and sweet overall.
Verdict: a very, very fine dubbel. And one that is one of the most commercially available, as well.
33cl bottle. Light white head that fade fast, dark brown thick color. Taste of raisin, caramel, chocolate and nuts .Bittersweet aftertaste. Very nice.

Very nice aroma-malt and raisins. Pours a dark brown/black color with light head. Very nice taste to match the aroma. Really nice!

0.33l bottle. Its color is something between ruby and dark gold. Pretty hazy, decent head. Aroma of chocolate, caramel, alcohol and fruits. Flavor of cherries, nuts, wood, molasses. Delicate bitter and a bit alcoholic finish. High carbonation and low body. Great.

Bottle. Dark with a hint of red, bubbly beige head. Divine aroma: chocolate, blackberry, rose hips. Delicate and profound. I spend a long time savouring the scent before tasting. A sweet alcohol hit in the taste, brings out the flavour of liquorice. Well-rounded ever so slightly bitter finish. Warming. Delicious mouthfeel.
Light aroma of caramel and plum not much in the way of flavor until it warms up to temp. Opens up with nice carmely warm flavors and sugar. Good winter beer

Dark brown with creamy foam. Aroma is caramel, dried fruits, dark berries, raisins. Sweet, malty taste with a little bitterness in the finish.

Somewhat hazy reddish brown with minimal off white head that dissipates pretty quickly. Aroma is big and typical of the style. Big fruity aromas of cherries, raisins, figs, yeast, malts, a little alcohol . Flavors follow in suite sweet, malty, booze, slight bitterness. Nice on the palate. Perhaps the best dubbel out there.

The aroma caught me the second I popped the cap. Rich, malty, inviting. Surprisingly carbonation leading into a creamy texture. Butterscotch, bread, and a little bit of yeasty funk. Spicy hops linger in a slightly bitter finish.

Outstanding. Go get it!

Bottle , wonderful dark fruit aromas , mild sweetness , raisiny finish , overall delicious !

Bottle 33 CL. Pours murky brown with small brown lacing head. Notes of great Belgium yeasts, so smooth, sweet malts, syrup. Just great stuff. Not that complex but the tastes it does have is just awesome.
One of the very best in the world, period--superbly balanced malt, fruit-forward hops, alcohol, everything--a work of art in caramelized form.
Dark reddish brown, frothy tan head, well bodied with lots of carbonation. Spicy, warm, fruity, cherries, dried fruits. Nice!

Aroma is malty and somewhat banoffee. Appears almost completely opaque yet not so dark, squirrel red. Deep brown taste with a thickly textured mouthfeel. Bittersweet flavour at the back of the mouth. An enjoyable experience.

Strong aromas here: caramel, dried fruits, gentle spice, alcohol - its a bit like brandy. Flavours are similar - very sweet, but still balanced. Robust mouthfeel. Lovely beer.

Bought a bottle at the supermarket. The beer has a dark ruby color and a nice and large cream colored head, CO2 level is excellent. In the aroma a lot of fruitiness and ripe bananas. The taste is rich, complex, herby and fruity. They are all well balanced, thanks to nice carbonation. The finish has a dry fruitiness and a light bitter. Overall, the best Dubbel Ive tasted so far. Nearly as good as Westmalle Tripel, its just what you prefer.
Strong for a dubbel, great malty aroma, average taste but a very sweet aftertaste.

Bottle from Voldby. Clear dark amber colour with a creamy beige head. Sweet malty aroma. Sweet taste with notes of malt, dark fruits. Bittersweet to sweet finish.

Rated from beer log during 2009 Belgium trip... Gentle sweet and yeasty aroma, flavor is dark fruits, slightly bitter yeasty finish... Very drinkable, enjoyable beer
