On [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Tatoverede Enke, Copenhagen - Brown/reddish pour with persistent medium beige head and lacing. Caramel malt, toffee, nutty, brown sugar, sweet syrup, yeasty, herbs, dark dried and berry fruits. Beautiful stuff this.

Bottle, 75 cl. Clear chestnut brown with small yeasty sediments and a rich, off-white head. Aroma of malts and yeast with notes of brown candy-sugar and dry fruits. Taste is sweet fruity and mostly malty. Finishes sweet. Not exactly up my alley.

Im no beer connoisseur, but I know a good-tasting beer when Im drinking one ... and Westmalle Dubbel tops the list, in my humble opinion. I consider my "beer palate" as relatively amateur, having grown up mostly in the U.S. drinking domestic before the micro-brews exploded onto the scene. Big Sierra Nevada fan, so moving to Europe was like ascending to heaven. German beer is great (especially Bavarian!), but Im now on a Trappist kick ... and Westmalle Dubbel is simply good ... delicious, smooth, and well-crafted (Im not entirely sure what that means, but it seems to fit!). Slante!

Slightly cloudy dark amber body with a scarce beige head. Nose has prunes, yeast and alcohol. Taste starts off surprisingly dry and keeps that way, leaving a lingering bitter finish. Carbonation is fairly heavy with lots of bubbles forming in the mouth. Not my favourite of this style.
Smak och doft av torkad frukt, karamell, röda bär och jäst. Lagom söt, rund och len. Gott. Tjänar på att lagras.

Poured from 330 ml bottle at Quarry House Tavern in Silver Spring, MD. 

Opaque, dark cranberry brown with a 3-finger tan head and good lacing. 

Aroma of dark fruit (raisins, plums, cherries et al), sweet dark malt, bread and brown sugar. 

Taste of sweet dark malt, dark fruit (raisins, plums, cherries et al), candi sugar and yeast. 

Medium/light body and medium/low carbonization with a delightfully smooth mouthfeel.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
33cl bottle. Pours dark amber with creamy beige head. Aroma is sweet, alchool, also some notes of dark fruits. Flavor is light sweet, also some hints of sourness, alchool. A bit acidic

(Bottle): Pours a hazy dark ruby with an off white head. Aroma of dark fruit, picked it up as soon as I opened the bottle. Along with some malt and chocolate. Flavour is heavy dark fruit and malt with dark chocolate and vinous qualities to the beer. Very drinkable, would never suspect its 7%.

UPDATED: DEC 28, 2015 The wonderfully complex aroma consists of dark fruits, raisin, roasted malts. Somewhat wine-like yet malty. Carbonation is rather high. I compared it to the Leffe Brune on an evening of beer tasting (theyre both readily available here), and frankly theres just no comparing, the Westmalle totally trumps it.
Bread, candy and malt aroma. Sweet taste of raisins, peppermint cane, candy, and cherries. Mild on the palate, not overly sweet. Almost no bitterness in the aftertaste.

Bottle at bar, Platanias, Crete. The colour is hazy dark brown with a beige, medium head. Lots of dried fruit in the aroma along with cocoa, wood and leather. The flavour follows up with more wood and in addition brown sugar and chocolate. Has a slick mouth feel, and a light bitterness. A fantasticly balanced and rich dubbel.

Pours a brownish red with a fluffy tan head that leaves a litte lacing. Aromas arw very sweet with raisin, grape and malt. Flavors of raisin, roated malt, and some other conplex flavors that are hard to tack down. Very nice.
Reddish brown pour. Khaki head. Little aroma. Taste is of dark fruits, maybe plum and malts.very complex. Carbonated.
strong bready aroma, slightly fruity. Alcohol taste is strong, as are the raisin notes; the palate is weak though. Coming off a barnardus it was a disappointing beer.

It is a nice beer that you should try once. Buy it is not one of my favorite beers.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

The first of six from my little gift pack, poured into a proper and rather gorgeous Westmalle chalice. Poured all the way in, because if I can see through my beer, I get depressed. Nice burnt amber colour, little in the way of head, though possibly because it all got away when I cracked open the bottle and it all came rushing out at once. Nose of ripe fruit, faint vanilla, a bit of sweet biscuit. Taste is a bit strong on the alcohol, bitter more than sweet, pine resin. Second taste to find a bit of the sweetness in there, though it seems well hidden. Perhaps Ill let the other two spend some time aging before revisiting the Dubbel. Not bad, but it seems a bit young.

UPDATED: DEC 21, 2013 Bottle @ mormor og morfar. Clear dark brown, big off white head that settles nicely, nice lacing. Aroma, malty, dark fruits, sweet brown sugar, wine-like notes, prunes, slight alcohol as it warms up. Taste, malty, dark fruits, toffee, bread, vegetables, brown sugar. Ends with a long dry wine-like aftertaste, with a taste of malts and dark fruits.
Mørk brun med beige skum. Mørk frukt, sviskelukt. litt sviske i smaken også men men mest skjokkoladetoner og litt karamell.

Westmalle Dubbel has a thick, fizzy, beige head, and a dark, red-brown appearance, with lots of bubbles and nice lacing left behind. The appearance is not too hazy, until one swishes the bottom contents and pours in the sediment. The aroma is rich, fruity, candy-like, malty, and winy. The taste is sweet, fruity, herby, and somewhat bitter. Dark fruits abound with this. Mouthfeel is medium and not really thick, and Westmalle Dubbel finishes mostly dry, fruity, and even refreshing. The drinkability is pretty easy with this one. Overall, this is an outstanding beer. RJT

Bottle. Pours a deep reddish brown with a thick creamy head. Aroma is sweet with cherry and brown sugar notes. Flavor is very pleasant - sweet with cherries, peaches, port and caramelized sugar. An outstanding dubbel!

UPDATED: JUL 21, 2015 This was somewhat of let down. While I enjoy many Beligan dubbels, this one didnt do it for me. It was too plain and watery. Faint chocolate. Some hoppiness in the finish at first, but then mostly nothing remains as you make your way down the bottle. Suprisingly disappointing.
Sweet almost bland aroma, some bready and banana vibes. lightly sour and spritzy in the mouth, quite a thin feel for the ABV. Overall slightly underwhelming to be honest

Hé nog niet gerate...... Toch wel vaker gedronken, maar lang geleden. Troebel bruin bier met een bende losse deeltjes op de bodem. De kraag is snel weg. Ruikt zoetig naar rozijnen en zo. Smaakt vrij waterig, caramel. Wat bitterzoete nasmaak . Ik ben niet onder de indruk.
Aroma is very similar to all Trappist beers but has a bite on the back end that I believe is due to the 3 week secondary fermentation.

Malt, earth, caramel and yeast in aroma, dark brown color, crisp, creamy head. Quite dry in palate, fizzy and smooth carbonation, again dry in taste, although hints of malt do exist. Dry finish. Whats best about this beer? Its how solid dubbel it is, very much in style, like a benchmark one could say. Definitely very high on my list.

33cl bottle from Waitrose. Poured in to a chalice its a deep. opaque, mahogany colour with a initially thick cream head that settles to a thin covering which lasts well; the aroma has sweet treacle, a hint of cloves, some yeast, and a touch of brandy; the taste is equally complex and satisfying, with sweet, nutty, earthy malts, raisins, and a gentle sourness; then theres a long warming finish with a touch of spice. A perfect slow sipper.

Deep reddish brown beer, leaving a handsome and lasting foam on its surface. 
Aromas of well dried fruits, plums and raisins, a hint of banana. Spices on a background. Fruitiness of this beer is, however, clearly dominating feature of the scent, and as such a pleasant one.
The taste is pleasantly soft, lightly sweet taste combination of caramel, round, fruity, plum and a little chocolate. Delicate amount of Finnish easter pudding. Hopping is light and tastes mostly as weak herbal bite at the end. 
Palate is medium-full-bodied, moderately rich. Alcohol is hidden quite nicely. 
This Dubbel is a really nice, enjoyable and clearly the best Westmalle on my list.
Somewhat sour taste that becomes bitter palate with a raisins background and a solid coffe and roasted finish. Dark head, stays on top very long. Dark cherry colour.

Pours a fairly translucent brown-amber with a huge, rocky khaki head. Nose of banana, chocolate, brown sugar, spice, and dough. Quite sweet, fairly bitter, with a slight tartness. Lighter-medium body, active carb, with a crisp bitter and tart finish. Nice lighter trappist ale, not quite what I expected, but very nicely put together.

This might not be fair, but I cant detect much aroma (maybe because Im sitting next to someone eating a hot fudge brownie and thats all I can smell, but who knows). Otherwise, nice chocolatey color. Was honestly expecting a little more on the taste, but its not bad. Just a bit
Bland for me.
Pours dark copper with a beige head. Aroma is dark caramel, dried fruit, plum and raisin. Flavour is dark caramel, light alcohol and dried fruit.

Bottle best before 5/22/14 poured a dark brown color with a very sturdy tan head. Aroma has rich brown malt, nuts, earth, and light oxidation. Mouth feel is medium and the carbonation medium low. Flavor has rich brown malt, yeast, light spice, earth, and dusty hops. I see looking up the dating system this is three years old. Amazing the store it came from opened six months ago.
Bottle->tulip. Dark brown with tan head. Dark fruit, raisins, caramel, toffee. Complex but balanced. Great lively mouthfeel. Excellent.

Bottle at home. Pours a dark reddy brown with a off-white head. Lovely sticky, bubblegum, treacle toffee, root beer, fruity aroma. Its tasty enough, with banana, treacle, a slight medicinal pepto bismol/root beer thing, slightly metallic. Plenty going on. Nice.

Bottle at home from waitrose. Had this a fair few times before first time rate. Murky brown caramel colour persistent cream colour head that fades to a whisp. Aroma is raisin dried fruit yeast ester with a touch of wood. More of the same in the flavour. One of the more bland Trappist beers. High carbonation that prickles the tongue.
Svart med stort ljusbrunt skum! Mycket malt men även lite humle! Helt okej!

Bottle.. Room temp... Layers of caramelized banana, dark ripe fruit, black cherries, Belgian candi sugar, caramel and yeast. Medium bodied, with a slight watery mouthfeel on palate.. though overall, it keeps the beer in balanced weight. A good food beer. Mild finish of the above mentioned flavors. Might be more enjoyable a tiny bit under room temp.

--- tasted while on a long journey to understand the world around me...

Pours a very dark brown color with beige / tan head. Aroma of sweet caramel,dark forrest fruits, banana. Taste of dark fruits, toffee, small hint of caramel, raisins and yeast. (lot of yeast in the bottle) well balanced beer. but not my favourite trappist
Bottle. Dark copper pour with a finger of head. Raisin, roasted almond, coffee. Well balanced and good carbonation. Really impressed

De trappist van Westmalle ligt, net zoals zijn grote broer de Tripel, in de bovenste la, alleen al omdat dit streekbier onze regio op de internationale bierkaart zet.
Het aroma is fris zoet en fruitig. De frisse citrus geur nodigt uit tot proeven. Het uiterlijk is donker bruin met en volle mokka kleurige schuimkraag.
De smaak is eenvoudig doch perfect in balans. Het is een verfrissend bier waarvan de smaak balanceert tussen iets fruitig met en bittere toets die doet denken aan pompelmoes. De zoete smaak doet denken aan het zoete van in marsepein, doch blijft discreet op de achtergrond.
Het mondgevoel is verfrissend, sprankelend bruisend en weinig klef waardoor de trappist van Westmalle gemakkelijk en smakelijk wegdrinkt. Aangezien dit bier ook een eerder beperkt alcohol volume heeft is dit een mooi en verfrissend alternatief voor de toch wel zware tripel.
En superieur bier dat zich in een brede waaier aan omstandigheden laat voorschotelen.
Want to know what a typical and great Belgian dubbel tastes like? Try this one. It has a taste of roasted malt, chocolate and a little dried fruit. Really good to use in food as well.

Flaska från Systembolaget. Färgen är rödbrun med kraftigt och varaktigt skum. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Tried this out of the bottle. A little malty but not overly flavorful. Pretty smooth. A good beer but not on my list of favorites.

Bottle @ home. Alla versata rivela un profumo di esteri e lieviti molto importante. Subito si avverte un profumo di tostato, e una sottile nota dolce di zucchero di canna grezzo. il colore è scuro opalescente, con riflessi rossastri e a tratti aranciati. La schiuma è vaporosa ampia e persistente, ma non molto stabile. Il gusto è di malto tostato, un po di uvetta ravvivata nel rum e con un gusto di luppolo rotondo e pieno, non pungente. Finale breve, pulito quasi secco.

Beautiful deep brown colour and great head. Heady aroma of almond, toffee, apricot. Taste is deep, pungent and complex; Belgian yeast, dark sugar, almond, apricot, some chocolate. Dense but expertly blended, belying its strength. This is what beer is all about, pretty much perfect.
Bottle. Pours a dark amber with off white colored head. Aroma of malts and dark fruits. Taste of dark fruits and alcohol with nice carbonation.
Aroma of dark fruit esters, hint of alcohol, malt, good carbonation, dark fruit, caramel, warming finish, nice dense head

from bottle. pours a dark red colour with a frothy beige head. wonderful and complex aroma of dark fruits - mainly grapes, cranberries and cherries -, fruit jelly (like in jaffa cakes), caramel, malts and hints of vanilla. there is also a slight amount of alcohol in the backdrop. medium body, average carbonation and rather thin texture. the taste, however, does not match the high expectations, driven by the complexity of the aroma. rather one-dimensional and suggary flavours of caramelized dark fruits and malts. Nonetheless, this is a damn good beer!

Dark pour. Thick, beige, frothy head. Rich fruit and nuts on the nose. Lively carbonation. More rich, dark fruits and candy sugar on the tongue. 
Complex and delicious.

Dark brown hazy color, medium beige head. Aroma of caramel, malt, yeast, chocolate and some fruity notes. Taste is dry sweet with mildly bitter finish and creamy aftertaste. Medium body and fizzy carbonation. Tasty and enjoyable beer.

Bottle from Systembolaget. 
Ar: lots of yeastiness, spiciness, Brown sugar, caramel, alcohol, earthy hops, herbs. 
Ap: copper/reddish colour, big beige head, lacing. 
F: medium bite, rich sweet maltiness, noticable Belgian funk, earthy hoppiness, very well composed, warming finish. 
P: medium/full body, small lively bubbles. 
T: very good.

Chocolate, oaty,stout/porter like flavour.  

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Dark brown with an average, mostly lasting, brownish head. Aroma is brown bread, dark fruits, caramel, spicy, toffee, cereals, light chocolate. Sweet malty and fruity. Well balanced, not too sweet. Nice dry moderate bitter finish.

Dark black body with tan large head. Aroma is complex at first glance, have dried fruits such as raisains, light caramel and toffee, background with some chocolate. Taste is sweet, loaded with caramel and chocolate. Well balanced. Alcohol after-teste, mediium long lasting biterness. Body is dry, light. High carbonation.
UPDATED: MAY 25, 2015 Mooie chocolade bruin bier met vol schuim. Ruikt zoetig chocolade en toast. Smaakt minder zoet als de geur. Volle smaak van caramal met ook fruitig tonen.
75 cl. flaske med champagne-prop. 7 %. Mørk øl med højt lysebrunt skum. Smager fantastist.

33o ml bottle @ home July 03,2013.
Beer from "Vinmonopolet Storo", Oslo
Dark brown in color with a thin white head.
Aroma is malt,hop,yeast and alcohol.
Malty,yeasty and a bit boozy beer.A sweet and bitter finish
Ok Trappist beer, but i prefer Rochefort 8 and 10.
Bottle at St Veronus. Pours hazy dark brown with a thin head. Sweet aroma of chocolate and caramel. Taste is very malty, leading to a dry/sour finish.

Aroma: Alcohol, pepper, banana.
Appearance: Murky brown, thin light-brown head with good lacing.
Taste: Sweet, pepper spice, bread, light banana, well balanced. medium dry finish, medium bitterness
Palate: Medium high carbonation, thin body, slick. Alcohol warming.
Overall: The strong alcohol smell was a nasty surprise. The other aromas were hidden and the taste was not as complex as one would think.

I think this beer was mistreated. Which sucks, because I it took me 4 months to get hold of this beer! Much sadness is within me now.

330ml bottle, poured.
A nice fruity sweetness with an alchoholic aftertaste. color is brown with a white head.

Moderately dark brown with some amber hues coming through where there is some light trying to make its way through the ale. About a 1 finger tall tan rocky head with fair retention. Some lace, but not too much. Lots of sediment floating in the brew, some yeast looking floaters but also some dark particles also. Sweet malty aroma. Lots of dark fruits; raisens, figs, maybe a little plum. Some hints of toasted malts and caramel. Like the smell getting a lot of dark fruit in the taste also. Very rich and sweet. Little boozy. Silky mouthfeel on a medium body. Another great trappist ale.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
33cl bottle. Pours dark brown with medium head. malty aroma. bitter and fruity. love this.

Pours a dark amber color with a thick off white head. Smells like dark grapes and dark fruits. The carbonation is a little bothersome, but the flavor is amazing. Malty with dark fruit flavors, similar to wine.

This is a dark brown beer with some amber colours around the edges. The aroma is yeasty with some malt and dark fruit in the mix. Im thinking plums and figs. The flavour is slightly sweet with some candy-flavour and some hoppiness in the mix. A nice beer for an evening out.

Very standard Dubbel and very traditional, which makes sense I guess considering its origins. The aroma was strong bread malts, maybe a little grainy. Nice brown color with a mild head. I found the carbonation a little high and distracting. The weight was good. This got better as it warmed some. The taste was strong bready malts with some caramel. I didnt detect a hops presence and the finish was boozy. Maybe Ive become used to the alternative versions of this style which are found in American breweries, but this one left me wanting.

UPDATED: AUG 17, 2013 0,33l fles diverse keren gedronken. Een van mijn favoriete Belgische dubbels. Prachtig donkerbruine kleur, moet niet te koud gedronken worden. Inde geur gebrande mout, in de smaak vol bitterzoet, je proeft dat het gebrouwen is met pure ingrediënten, waar andere brouwer toch vaak meer suiker toevoegen.

Bottle; Poured a deep amber with a medium off white head. Aroma: Molasses/ dark fruit / fig. Flavor: Molasses/ dark fruit. Not able to taste the malt. Not my favorite style, but in terms of complexity it definitely delivers.

Bottle poured into a snifter. This is a very finely bodied dubbel that is best sipped carefully. Its clear, dark ruby color is below a frothy and pillowy white head. Lacking the chalkiness of some mediocre dubbels, there is a pleasant fineness. Malt character with notes of black licorice, cherry, red wine, grape soda, veggie, pineapple.

Pours a dark chestnut brown with a large white head. Aromas of malted bread, perhaps fruit loaf. Roasted flavours too, with more dark sugar notes. Good balance of sweet and bitter tastes. Medium body, good creamy texture, lively carbonation, good length of finish. Does not disappoint.

Bottle at Lauras wedding. Hadnt had this for years, remembered always thinking Westmalle was a bit overrated for some reason. Not sure why,this is good. Deep reddish brown, high carbonation. Strongly malty, almost bitter roasty flavours, some grain and bitter treacle if thats possible. Definitely some booze in there. Slightly yeasty. Overall perhaps not as rounded as Chimays or sweet like Rochefort, more assertive in taste pattern, but still enjoyable.

UPDATED: JUL 15, 2013 Drinking in gobletColour: very dark, little darker then classic dubbwl colour.Appearnce: long existing foam, till the end of glass. With small dose of lacing.Aroma: mostly chocolate with some citrus hopsFlavour: plums, coffee, peppery Overall: excellent beer with untraditional,for dubbels, dark malts.

Brown body with thick tan head. Aroma of sugar and fruits. Taste is sweet, fruity and boozy. A good beer but not the best trappist.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle at BXL East. Pours ever so slightly hazy brown with a reddish tint and a massive soapy tan head. Lacing is quite thick on the glass. Aroma of dark fruit, cherries, raisins, malt, yeast and some booziness. Taste is yeast-forward with notes of fruit, vanilla, raisins, and spice with a hint of hops in the finish. Great balance of all elements in this beer. Finish is suprising bright on the palate. Really, really nice.

Serving: 330 ml. bottle from State Line Liquors.  It pours a murky brown with a very large tan head.  The nose is bright with notes of dates, yeast, a slight banana.  The flavor seems a little more subdued, perhaps due to a very high level of carbonation.  A little sweet up front with light yeast, toffee, and date notes and a very clean finish.  Light in body as well, again due in part to all the carbonation.  Solid.

Pours a brown body with a thick tan head that lingers. Initial drink tasted creamy, but due to the head. It is better as it warms. Great mouth feel. Has a little carbonation, and subtly boozy. Read some reviews to see what tastes others were getting. Was taking drinks afterwards to see if I could pick up the notes. Decided it doesnt matter what others state. I would rather just drink it slowly and enjoy the taste. Not my favorite Trappist beer, but a darn good one at a reasonable price.

330ml bottle at Porterhouse Cork. Pours a dark ruby brown with a pillowy head. Aroma is lots of red berries, toffee, wood and a slightly metallic tinge. The taste is a big burst of boozy sweetness characteristic of the style and a light dash of bitter and sour flavours also. Quite heavy and quite fruity taste. Smooth and full-bodied, theres nice tart (and slightly metallic) sweet finish to it. Not the best Trappist on the market, but its an excellent beer in its own right.
Amazing dubbel!  Awesome power with great balance.  Nothing else to talk about just sip and enjoy!

Pours rosy plum. Aroma is dark sugary dessert fruits, dates and caramel. Flavour is sweet, but a slight letdown after the awesome aroma

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Best buy 5/18/2012.

11.2oz served into a Chimay chalice.

A - Garnet brown body with a 1.5 inch khaki head that never dies. Good spots of lacing.

S - Cooked plantains, brown sugar, raisin bread, molasses, coconut alcohol.

T - Caramelized brown sugar, plums, has a mushroom earthiness, sugary dates, some spiced bread, alcohol lingers, light strawberry bubblegum flavors, faint coconut on the edges. Brown bread crust comes back around the finish.

M - Moderate carbonation, thin medium bodied.

This is a complex brew that has many layers of flavors but lacks a "good home feel" that I like out of Dubbels. Still very good.

Serving type: bottle

05-04-2012

Bottle at Pressklubben. 2006 and 2013 version. Rating will be of the 2006 version, the 2013 version isnt even comparable to the aged version. Brown colour with a beige head. Sweet aroma of malt, caramel. Flavour is caramel, malt, fruits.

UPDATED: JUL 6, 2015 On-tap into Westmalle chalice. Good looking dark red-brown with a creamy head,  nice lacing on the glass. Spicy and fruity aromas. Rich flavors with a presence of fruits (dark), caramel,  roasted malts and spice. Sweet, soft, creamy, slightly bitter aftertaste. Great Dubbel.
Poured from a room temperature bottle into a glass.  Nice caramel color with a big tan head.  Malt and caramel smell. Light Belgium taste. Alright beer.
Small white head.. pours red/brown colour.. some fruits malts good blance.  drank at the buitenlust..

UPDATED: FEB 3, 2015 Dark, hazy, caramel colour. Thin, cream coloured head. Hints of Apple cider on the nose. Slightly bubbley. Spicier taste. Subtle hints of apple. A fine choice but liked the Rochefort 6 better.8.5.8.4.17
Update: pours a dark, murky caramel with a thin, off white head. Aroma has big notes of caramel, dark fruits, spice, fruity esters, and apple. Taste is balanced. Bread, caramel, clove spice, and dark fruit. Medium-full body with a high carbonation. Clean in the mouth with an effervescent carbonation. A touch metallic at the end. Overall very tasty.

Color dark with bubbly foam. The smell is of dark fruits, like cherry, with caramel and coffee. Tastes of coffee, caramel and fruit. After some time the alcohol makes its appearance in both the smell and the taste. Aftertaste of coffee, malt and hops. Great dubbel.
Esta cerveza es una de las belgas clásicas. Muy rica y mejor no muy fría. Sabor a fruta madura, higo, acaramelada. ¡A disfrutarla!
Bottle 0.33l at home. Originally rated 08082012. Colour is reddish brown with small white head. Aromas and flavours: Belgian yeast, spices, sweetness and malts.

UPDATED: JUL 29, 2013 Pours deep, cloudy reddish brown, with lots of yeast flakes, with beige medium to high top, leaving light lacing, nice yeast layer too. Aroma - yeasty, fruity dominant, candy-caramely, a bit alcoholic, a bit like milky-cocoa or chocolate on nose too, but aroma  overall is not very intense. 
Flavor sweet malty-yeasty, medium bite on tongue like yeasty-spicy, high carbonated, light bitter from burnt or roasted malt is too out of balance, astringent a bit, but in a weird way like carbonated and spicy at the same time - and this mouthfeel stays in a mild creamy, sweet-roast bitter finish. Finish is not long,  creamy texture, aftertaste - almost none. Above medium bodied, weird floury feeling on tongue in finish. I could say this one is not well rounded, but not bad to try.

Bottle. Deep black and pure. Tastes and smells boozy with notes of fruit, raisin . Very good, but it tastes like I've had it plenty if times 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

330ml bottle from a German supermarket. Huge tan head with tiny bubbles which immediately becomes creamy and delicious. Reddish brown foggy body. Aroma of burned wood, dark fruits, spices and coffee. Nice fruity hop flavour. I like this one better than the tripel, because I find it more balanced. However, the taste of booze gets to me again. Apart from that, its excellent. Feels a tiny bit too thin in the mouth.

aroma:, caramelo, chocolate, tostado, caramelo
apareance: deep brown. nice espuma
flavor: think is the best dubbel flavour
Poured from a bottle into a trappist glass. Dark burgundy red color with a thin white head. Smells dark fruit and yeast. Taste is bitter front with a yeast and raisin/plum body. Long smooth finish.

11.2 ounce bottle.  Pours a hazy amber with a three inch tan head t.  Taste is of roasted malt, caramel, chocolate, cherry, fruit and some yeast.  Similar aroma.  Has a good full body with a slightly dry finish.  Easy to drink and quite enjoyable.
Fantastic beer dry finish, toast and a little bitter, made with dark malt notes of passion fruit.
Brune foncée, fine mousse brun clair persistante. Maltée mais belle présence de houblon, texture huileuse, discrètement fruitée, caramelisée et rôtie,bonne pétillance et bel équilibre.

Bottle - aggressive pour. Very long lasting head of off while color and super tight bubbles.  Dark and deep red color.  initial aroma heavy on bread and malt with sour cherry finishing sweetly on the nose.  Very reminiscent of the dubbel style.  Mouthfeel is soft on the pallet; nice but expected a heavier body.  Taste did disappoint at first with an almost cherry syrup on the first sip.  Tons of carbonation, particularly upon second pour with a less aggressive pour.  Afterword nice bread and malt notes with some dark fruit, mostly cherry.  Overall, expected more from a dubbel, particularly from a Trappist.  Woudja - Yes!

Nice banana, citrus and roasted malt aroma, taste is a lot roasted than aroma, but it is balanced with some strong hops in the beginning, but short lasting, quite nice since i am not a big fan of dark beers..

330ml bottle from The Cave, Glasgow (£2.99):
Rich and complex smell that begins with some dark fruits such as plum, raisin and cherries. There is a strong and sweet caramel malt aroma that follows this along with some sugar, prunes, dates and figs with tiny amount of alcohol.

Murky brown with a hazy appearance and a thin, one centimetre tall, light brown head that that turns to a patchy lacing

Strong and sweet dark fruit taste to begin with all the same fruits from the nose making an appearance, particularly the figs, raisins and dates plus some cherries and sugar. There is some toffee malts and a warming, light alcohol taste next with a hint of yeast and some caramel malts.

Sweet & well carbonated, medium body and a rich, complex taste that has a very good balance. There is some nice spice towards the end and the alcohol, hidden for the most part, is only noticeable in places and compliments the drink well with a nice, warming finish to it.

Very complex yet well balanced beer that was quite rich from the get go and dominated by dark fruits and sweet malts throughout. A really nice one that takes a while to open up but once it does there is no looking back.

Head: beige, mediu, cremy and frothy, avg. retention. Coulour: red-brown almost black. 

Aroma: dried fruit, spicy, some herbs? Taste: roasted: bitter, just a bit of caramel.
33cl bottle. A great dubbel. Very sweet taste of caramel/chocolate. Dry long aftertaste.

Nice dark colour, good head with average retention. Some flaky yeast bits sink to the bottom of the goblet. Complex aroma of fruits (plums and cherries), sweetness, malty caramel, chocolat and finally some yeasty banana. Fruitiness dominates, but this is actually very pleasant as it smells like ripe fruits. No chemical aroma whatsoever. The fruits and malts come back in the taste as well, but fruit no longer dominates. There is a smooth bitterness that sets the tone and harmonizes well with the sweet fruits and caramels. The beer feels creamy like a Chouffe. Because the bitterness restricts the sweetness, you can taste bread as well. Malty goodness. Very refreshing with modest alcohol. This is such a nice beer, complex and characterful.

Nyinnkjøpt flaske fra Belgisk Bryg: bare synet av det beige, tette skum over den lekre og mørke rubinfarge hensetter meg i evangeliseringsmodus. Dubbel er mit favorittøl, og det skal nydes i kontemplativ ro efter dagens dont. Livet er sgu ret dejligt.

Although the Dubbel is my least favourite of the three classic trappist styles, the Westmalle Dubbel is certainly my favourite of the style. I tend to my Dubbels a little too thin on the palate for my liking, but this one feels nice, full bodied. Lots of the flavours you come to expect from the Belgian trappists--caramel, plums, a bit of chocolate, candi sugar--but there is also a hint of the sour/smokiness that also pervades their tripel. Nice beer.
Light cola brown color.  Light brown sugar and mild caramel on the nose.  Mouthfeel is very smooth and lightly creamy.  Very mellow flavors of sweet ripe fruit and brown sugar.

Bottle 0,33L. Ruby/brown colour with big, creamy, long lasting, beige head.  Strong fruity aroma of cherries and caramel. Creamy mouthfeel with accetic flavor reminds me on a red wine, than it turns into moderate bitter aftertaste. Excellent beer!
Pours a very dark brown color with beige head. Aroma of sweet caramel, banana and hints of dark fruit. Taste of dark fruits, toffee, raisins and some yeast. Very well balanced. One of my favorites.

Aroma of deep toasty malt, caramel and a slight banana. Very sweet sense in the nose.  Nice sweet taste of rich dark breads with dried fruits. Raisin an slight prune flavor.  Nice carbonation to offset the slightly cloying but good sweetness.  Well balanced

The aroma is fresh banana creme, fresh bread with light baking spices and some pleasant phenolic notes.  The flavor is more spicy and rich sweet bread with lots of fruit and nuts. Texture is velvety though with an alcohol bite.  So nice. Brings happiness.

33cl bottle.
Appearance: dark caramel brown beer, stable beige head.
Nose: caramel, burned malts, not much else beside sugars.

330ml on tap at Café Gollum Amsterdam. Aroma is very light yeast and some light dark fruit hints. Appearance is dark brown with a nice foam. Taste is very nice, sweet and some sourness. Overall a very good Trappists Beer.
Intense malty dark red beer, one of my very favourite beers. Excellent with a rack of ribs :-)
Great aroma with a long sweet/bitter finish. beer looks great with a good apperaence.
Dark red brown beer with a very balanced taste. Beautiful dense foam and the perfect bitterness
Extremely close to perfection. Roasted, slightly smoky flavors with rich malt flavor. Appreciate that its not as sweet as other dark belgian but more tangy and fresh despite its weight.

Borwnish, reddish color with big beige head that quickly disappears. Aroma of caramel, dark fruits, alcohol, raisins,cheries may be. Taste is light sweet, bitter and quite fruity. Light to medium body, creamy texture, average carbonation. Quite nice.

very dark brown body with white, long lasting head. the taste is dry, not sweet at all. aroma is spicy.

Pours brown with of white head, aroma is sweet, caramel and spizy. Flavor is slightly sweet and spizy, with alcohol notes.

Beautiful darkbrown color, a bit sweet, but with good depth. A true classic.

UPDATED: JUL 28, 2016 Pours a brown color with an off-white head. Flavour is caramel, fruits and hops with a bitty of nuts n spices. One of my favourite Dubbels.

Overall, this double is very agreable, easy to drink.
Aroma of caramel malt, raisins and banana.

This beer is medium sweet and bitter, well balanced with notes of banana and something that makes me think of almond-flavoured liqueur.

text: 33cl bottle. A nice double beer with hints of chocolate and fruit. Very well balanced, which makes it very easy to drink.

Bottle. Pours hazy dark copper brown with airy but stable light tan head. Clear aroma of malt and caramel with distinct fruity notes. Sweetish, malty and caramellish fanfare, gradually dying out in an agreeable bitter coda. A very nice, melodious brew.
Marrone ambrato. Schiuma abbondante, ma non molto persistente. Aroma di malto, spezie, pane. Gusto equilibrato, con sentori fruttati, di caramello e spezie.

Very hazy brown beer with medium head that goes away fast. 
Chocolate on aroma. Taste is great, chocolate but without too much sweetness. Soft, sting of alcohol, sour.

Aug 2012 - loads of head.  Smell and initial taste are a bit chemically.  Medium bodied, very little perceivable taste really.  Very easy drinking.  Slight sweetness/bitterness in aftertaste.  Subtle toffee in late aftertaste. Very little to complain about, enjoyable, but not exciting.

Nice amber to brown colour with copious beige head that dies down quickly. No lacing.  Flavours of caramel, and a nice nutty undertone.  Quite malty.  High carbonation with largish bubbles.  Dry finish.  Overall a smooth beer but in my opinion doesnt deserve the high scores (or the super high price) A solid 85 for sure, though.

UPDATED: MAY 2, 2013 Exceptional tasting beer.  Tastes of Caramel, molasses, chocolate, plum, plenty of bannana probably from the yeast etc.  All over the place.  Well balanced, easy drinking and barely any bitterness on the finish.

UPDATED: JUN 19, 2013 Pours dark, ruby red with nice one finger head. Aroma is dark fruits, spicy, sweet. Tast is well balanced, hints of spices, bread, sweetness. Nice sweet malty finish. Medium body.

March 13, 2013 - bottle from Randalls.  After probably walking by this bottle hundreds of times at various stores, I finally took one off the shelf and purchased it.  Brown pour with a lot of head that stuck around for a bit.  Aroma was fruity, malty, bready and some spice.  Taste was very sweet and fruity, also got some butterscotch and a light spice that reminded me of a peppermint.  Finish had a bit too much dryness and alcohol though.
UPDATED: MAY 16, 2014 Aroma: nuts, chocolateAppearance: brown, black, tan foam, frothy, Taste: lightly bitter, finish duration averagePalate: medium body, sticky, lively carbonation, bitter finish

11.2 Fl. Oz. Bottle. Poured a reddish brown with a huge off white head and some lacing (head did went away quite quickly). Aroma of fruits, caramel and some hint of hops (not a whole lot). Taste is complex but quite consistent with aroma, it is sweet and fruity a bit of hops; It is extremely well balanced; beautiful beer, as well executed as you will expect from that much tradition.

Entrata dolce, con un aroma di banana che quasi lascia spiazzati. Bel marrone con carbonatazione e schiuma medi. Sensazioni complesse di spezie che niìon sono di facile interpretazione ,comunque buone. Corpo medio/basso. Un finale che, al contrario dellesordio fa pervenire un bellamaro che lascia una sensazione piacevole. Di sicuro un ottimo prodotto ma forse non la migliore dubbel che io abbia assaggiato. -- Entrance sweet, with an aroma of banana leaves that almost crippled. Beautiful brown with medium carbonation and foam. Complex hints of spices niìon that are easy to interpret, however good. Body medium / low. An ending that, on the contrary onset ago received a bellamaro that leaves a pleasant feeling. Certainly a great product but perhaps not the best dubbel Ive tasted.

Dubbels seem to be less respected in the beer community then the Quads and Triples. I dont get that, I think the Trappist Dubbel is the most sublime of all beers and for my taste this one is the quintessential Dubbel. The Monks at Westmalle brewery are credited with brewing the first of what is now called a Dubble ale; Based on the Dubbels that I have tried, I dont think that the style has been perfected. Right after opening the bottle you are hit with a yeasty and bready bouquet, after it warms up a little you get the dark fruit and candied sugar notes with a slight hoppyness; every thing balances perfectly. If I had to choose just one beer to enjoy for the rest of my life it would probably be between this or The Rochefort 8. Good on ya, Monk brothers.

33cl bottle from qvid.be, A lovely beer, thankfully available in virtually any corner cafe in Belgium. It pours darkly hinting at the depths of a quad.. But settles with a ruby colour, complex depth of aroma and a nice taste, neither sweet nor sour. A keeper.

Schiuma beige alta e cremosa, aderente e moderatamente persistente, colore marrone scuro e torbido, aroma di frutta secca, malto tostato, al palato oleosa, discreta carbonazione,  corpo medio, dolcezza dei malti ben bilanciata dai luppoli,note di  caramello e finale secco, niente male.
Bottle. Pours reddish brown with a huge cream head. Moderate lacing. Aromais stone fruits, raisins, malt. Taste is much the same. Thin but lightly sweet. Great, very drinkable example of the style.
Fruity aromas, lacks character and bitterness which would be expected in this style of beer. Weak aftertaste.

UPDATED: OCT 9, 2013 Brown with an offwhite head. Aroma is dark fruits, some alcohol. Quite high carbonation. Taste is great, sweet with a minor bitterness, again dark fruits and burnt sugar. Great beer.

Aroma: A lot of flavours here but not very strong. 
Appearance: Hazy brown with a frothy, big head.The head seems quite long lasting.

Taste: Mild sweetness with a hint of bitterness

Palate: Slightly too much carbonation, otherwise awesome.

Overall: Very nice complicated beer.
From a bottle. Pours frothy brown. Flavor is rich and complex without being too sweet or malty. Good flavor depth with mouthfeel on the lighter side. Very good.

Bottle (notes from tasting session). Candi sugar and warm malt aroma, some pear and tropical fruit, very fruity nose Flavors of pears, malt, brown sugar, and raisins.Final is fruity, with a good lingering bitterness. One of the best dubbels.

Ramato carico, schiuma beige, fine e persistente, carbonazione evidente, allolfatto caramello, miele di castagno, torrefatto. Al palato ritroviamo le stesse note con un pò meno di intensità. Retrogusto olfattivo di caramello.

dark brown colour, massive creamy brownish head; very complex aroma of fruits, yeast, white wine and wine cellar; taste of roasted malt and sugar, fruits,  with significant bitter aftertaste and alcoholic warmth.
great trappist ale; for me a bit better than westmalle trippel

Pours cloudy reddish brown with a creamy, lasting, tan head. Aroma is of leather, cedar, toast, roasted malt, cinnamon and dried fruit - quite complex. The taste is fairly sweet, with dark fruit and roasted malt, with some nutty notes. Very creamy feeling beer, light carbonation, full body and a long, smooth, warming finish.

Bottle. It poured a wonderful dark brown with athick head of lingering foam. The aroma was rich, malty with a hint of fruit- it made me think of figs or raisins. The flavor reminded me of wine a bit, and the mouthfeel is thick and filling. You definitely get the warming from the 7% ABV but this simply is a great beer for sipping, very well balanced and a pleasure to drink. I will agree with the other commentators, it isnt so complex but it is well done and satisfying for me.

Bottle from Chester Beer distributor. Pours a dark murky almost purple color. Two finger head, retention is not that good but excellent lacing. Peppery aroma. Somewhat sweet tasting with sharp notes, not sure how to describe again a taste of pepper. Smooth finish. Syrupy mouthfeel.

Dark, not a lot going on in aromas, somewhat sweet, caramel flavours, dry, a little bitterness.

Not sure what my problem is, I liked this beer but not THAT much, and I have trouble picturing this being brewed by a local brewpub and being hailed as "one of the best in the world". Its just a matter of personal taste though. Aroma and appearance of Coca Cola with about the same viscosity and sweetness, and most importantly carbonation, with a bit of chocolate... everyones talking about a long bitter finish, to me it was pretty dry, but there were prunes, dates, spices and alcohol lurking in the aroma and especially finish, so it did have that Trappist complexity, just the high carbonation and thin body make it seem kind of cheap. Maybe if Id never had a soft drink in my life Id be giving this 4.5.

Corked & Caged 750 ml Bottle. Dark copper and crimson colored in appearance with a layer of light reddish brown foam. Kaatuu lasiin sameana ja colanvärisenä. Vaahto on pilvinen, tiivis ja melko runsas. Haju on raikkaan luumuinen ja kuivattua hedelmää sekä tuoretta hedelmää löytyy myös, etenkin päärynää. UPDATED: JAN 27, 2013 Dark brown with ruby amber tints, rapidly diminishing off white head; aroma of yeast and citrus; flavour is of dried, dark fruits - perhaps raisins, damsons and cherries; also yeast and a burnt sugar sweetness; well carbonated; some bitterness and alcohol in the lingering sweet finish; nice, but by no means my favourite Trappist beer.

UPDATED: FEB 6, 2013 Dark copper brown colour; Large head and lasting beige foam; Oily, very good lacing and lively carbonation throughout; Very fragrant aroma of malt, honey and floral, followed by banana, caramel and a hint of alcohol; Medium to full body; Sweet taste with strong presence of malt, bread, citrus and caramel; Palate is slightly thin with a strong but hop bitter spike, alcoholic taste is evident but subtle. Slightly dry after taste.

Comments: Quality stuff for sure. It stands tall alongside Leffe Brune and Chimay Red.  Compared to the Brune, this one is a little thinner in body, more aromatic smell sensation with a more pronounce bitterness finish. These three are equally enjoyable on any given day, but if I want something with outstanding aroma with a bitter finish, Westmalle Dubbel is the one.

From the 11.2 fl. oz. bottle.  It pours brown with red hues and a moderate head the lingers.  Fine aromas of Belgian sugars, sweet malts, molasses, and dark fruits.  The body is about medium and slightly carbonated.  The taste is incredibly sweet at first with a potent bitterness taking up the rear. It does not linger long but you cant help but to remember it.  Very nice.

Strong malt and fruit smell, really smell orange zest. But the taste is not orange alone. Malty character with fruity, dry finish. Bubbly foam head that vanishes quickly. Deep brown body is capped off by a small tan head that dissipates after a while. Minimal carbonation. The nose is excellent with plenty of dark fruit, nuts and some alcohol - just like a fruitcake. Taste is a complex bkend of dark plums, stewed fruit, burnt sugar, nutty malts and vanilla. Medium body, lingering aftertaste and a sweetish finish. Very nice Trappist dubbel.

Roodbruin bier, lichtbruine schuimkraag die verdwijnt. Aroma van gist, beetje malt. Verder niet veel bijzonders. Smaak is voornamelijk bitter, alcohol beetje droog, heel licht zoet. Palet niet heel prettig: melig, teveel co2.

Bottle from Systembolaget. Hazy reddish brown with a large frothy tan head. Aroma is sweet with brown sugar, figs, malt, spices. Taste is crispy sweet with same profile as the nose, a minor hint of bitterness is felt before a lingering taste of dark sugar is left on the palate.

I really like this beer, it is not as sweet as you would expect for a dubbel, but it has a nice balanced, dark chocolaty finish. It shares some characteristics of a stout in its taste, although It has a nice fizz to it. I think the availability and price of this beer (in Belgium, France & NL) boost its credentials. I would say this is a good mid-week beer.

Not the best abbey dubbel, but so widely available, Im sure its accessibility makes it less desirable to most people.  Nice balance, good amount of dark fruit, fig, and brown sugar.   Beautiful beer.
