UPDATED: JAN 17, 2013 Another Westmalle brew to be respected but not necessarily enjoyed, like the Tripel. This one does work a whole lot better than the bigger brother though, in my opinion. This time around, the yeast character is balanced with the malt body of a dubbel. The aroma is all belgian yeast. This works a treat in the look of the beer - deep brown colours with a off white foam atop. The taste is classic belgian sugar and malt with a full bodied palate arising from the big yeastiness. Overall though, I respected this beer, but maybe didnt love drinking it. I would go the Prior 8 before this one personally.
Bottle, 1 year aged - Reddish brown pour with great head.  Aroma is yeasty, not much else going on.  Taste of toasted cereal and yeast, good carbonation and mouthfeel.  Not the greatest Belgian.
Bottle, a full and rich flavour with a great head that stuck around for quite a while. Easy to enjoy (4)

A reddish-brown ale with a crisp white head that is expected from a Trappist. The dubbel character comes across with full bodied malty-sweet aromas. A crispness on the back of the tongue and a clean palate feel leave you wanting another sip.

330ml bottle. Sweet, caramel aromas. Pours very dark, with tan head, vanishing, some lacework. Medium bodied, average carbonation. Taste is caramel, sweet, spicy and some subtle roasty notes. Good aftertaste, sweet and warm. Nice and enjoyable.
Odlično temno pivo z močnim okuson in aromo ter nekoliko večjo vsebnost alkohola
Bottle.  Super sweet and complex as one expects from a Trappist beer of this caliber.  Not my favorite Trappist but still an awesome brew.

Bottle Westmalle. Aroma of malt and honey, maybe some ginger bread. Tastes rather balanced and simple, very good. The malt and honey are still present. It gets better and better. High carbonation in the beginning. Remains my favorite Westmalle!

Poured from a bottle, brown cola color with thick off-white/light tan head. Aroma of malt and honey, some spice. Taste starts off good, but it gets much better as it warms up. I can also taste more fruit-like flavors as it warms. Had lots of carbonation at the beginning, but settled down. Overall this is a good beer; one of my favorite Dubbels. Ill have to compare this to Bells Hell hath No Fury someday.

Bottle from Belgianbeershop.com. Head: beige, thick, stable, nice lacing. Color: dark red brown, very beautiful. Aroma: filled with roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, caramel. The taste is very well balanced with a fantastic full mouthfeel. Notes of caramel and banana. Very long finish. This is a fantastic trappist, almost as good as the tripel.

This beer is spectacular. In bottle in a cafe in Tongeren. Had it pleanty of times, but this was first in many years. Still astounds me.
Aroma is a beautiful silky toffee, honey nose with touches of molasses, goes brilliant together. Appearance is a beautiful deep brown, slightly transparent with a beautiful tan head and heaps of lace - more than any beer I know, the sign of a great third-stage ferment. Taste is brilliant, excellent array and layering of flavours, I get toffee, caramel, touch of grape, apple-like, some other esters, touch of banana, but super subtle, almost not there. Palate is a great bitter and warm toffee sensation in the mouth - consistency also perfectly complements the flavours here - better than any other beer I know again. Overall, unforgettable.

Pretty good beer. But over carbonated. Sweet but enjoyable.   Nice flavor of figs and grape almost wine    Over carbonation is thorn in side but good for appearance. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Brown/maroon in color with a small head, the aroma is fruit, ginger, malt and a little alcohol.  The flavor is slightly sweet and crisp.  Fruit tones, spice and mild hops.

75 cl, bottled. Pours clear reddish brown with a tanned head. Aroma: Fruits, malt, citrus, grains. Browned sugar. Taste: Sweet, pleasant bitterness. Yeast. Banana, fruity flavours. Palate: Medium body, noticeable carbonation. Well balanced and enjoyable. Nice.
Nice nice Beer that makes food unnecessary. Smooth black taste that makes  one glad, but lacks the wow-feeling.

Im considering changing my name to Fuzzy. Mainly because I dont think Ill be able to carry off Bigmuff. Steve Winwoods brother is/was called Muff. Is that a real name? Im obsessed by names at the moment. I have a warm hat.
UPDATED: JUL 20, 2013 Pours brown with white head. Aroma of sweet caramel, some dried fruits. Standard Belgian. Very balanced, and enjoyable.
Pours a red-amber, thin beige head. Smells of hay and fruit. Mildly carbonated, tastes of yeast, malt, and fruit.

33cl bottle from Beers Of Europe
Reddish brown pour with whitish medium head.Malt,caramel and chocolate aromas with a little fruit.Tastes of malt and caramel and some yeast with a hint of fruit making a nicely balanced and good bodied dubbel.Would like to try on draught and in corked 75cl bottle for extra research!!
Hazy cola bottle brown with fluffy tan head. Sweet damson and candy sugar nose. Lively carbonation, sweet, some higher alcohols, warming ethanol,  long fruity malt finish
Poured a reddish brown with a medium white head, aroma of sweet caramel malt. Medium body, flavour is yeasty with dark dry fruit and a lingering dry aftertaste.
Bottle shared with Plovmand. Almost black with a nice wheat nose. Some chocolate in the aroma. A quality beer.

330ml bottle into a Chalice glass

Appareance:  dark hazy  brown colour, nearly opaque.  beige head (almost two fingers).

Aroma: malty smell with  fruit ( figs ) and  wood. 

Taste:  touch of  dark fruits sweetnes at the start , then you can taste wood and grass ending with bitterness and dry sensations. Long lasting in mouth.

Mouthfeel:  medium carbonaation and body. 

Overall:  perfect equilibrium. Good trappist beer, long in mouth. Maybe the aroma is not so fine as the later taste, but in mouth is an amazing ale. Classic.

Under carbonated, no aroma. Malty taste appropriate to style but having its own flair. Little disappointing, won't try again unless on tap at the brewery.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Shared 750ml bottle. Thanks Olli. Pours a dark brown with a large, beige head. Aroma is light marzipan and apricot, some caramel. Taste is caramel, apricot, marzipan, light yeast. Finishes with some herbal hops. Palate is full with a lot of carbonation. Perhaps a bit too much.
Bottle shared with McTapps. Pours in dark to black with a nice hoppy and wheat nose. Some fruits in the aroma as some chocolate also. A quality beer for sure but there are still better out there.

Bottle bought in bottle shop nearby and was shared with lucky MichaelBruch. Deep brown colour with creamy and stable head. Taste of sweet nuts, fine malt and gentle yeast combined with floral notes. Very excellent texture with nice carbonation.

#453
Vom Faß serviert in der typ. Berliner Weiße Schale; dunkel-braun mit reichlich Schaum, soweit so gut. Die Aromen sind verhalten hefig-hopfig. Im Antrunk dann eher würzig-brotig und nicht fruchtig, wie zuvor erwartet. Auch nicht süß, sondern eher herb, im Abgang gar holzig bitter. Irgendwie hatte ich mir da mehr von versprochen. Nicht wirklich schlecht, aber auch nichts Besonderes, leider!
	
Test vom 26.8.2007, Gebinde: Fass 	Noten: 12,11,10,9,-,10 - 10,21

I love Westmalle beers, and this one its maybe its best one. As all the Westmalle, is complex, high-bodied, elegant and perfectly structured. Plum colour, very dark and opaque, with off-white head and superb retention. Marked and lasting lace. Powerful mouthfeel to caramel, over a very elegant hop. Delicate, elegant and full of nuances. Excellent.

UPDATED: AUG 21, 2013 Rouge très foncé avec un grand col brun qui laisse une belle laçage. Larôme est de fruits noirs, de cerise et de prune, un peu de cacao et du lhoublon qui lui fait un peu terreux. La saveur est de fruits noirs, mais il nest pas doux, du cacao, et il ya un presnece dhoublon définitive qui lui donne une finale sec.

Shared from the brown bottle into a tulip glass. It poured a hazy, deep reddish brown color with everlasting beige foam, lots of lace. Perfect appearance. Dubbel style-defining aromas and flavors: malt sweetness, toffee, raisins, plums, dried cherries and apricots, noble hops, minerally with tannins reminiscent of grape-skins and nuts. Faint hard-cider alcohol, warming and harmonious. Almost syrupy sweet but not quite. Complex, long-lasting aftertaste. Very, very nice.

330ml bottle into a tulip.

Pours a clear very dark brown, nearly opaque. Topped by a huge billowy off-white head that keeps growing thanks to the abundant carbonation. Some of the best head retention I have every seen.

Aroma has lots of dark fruit such as figs and cherries layered on top of wood. Hints of pipe tobacco along with wet grass and hay. A little bit of light cocoa underneath.

The flavor really has tons going on. Like in the aroma, dark fruit predominantly up front consisting largely of cherries and figs. A decent woody note is present along with a little bit of must although it nicely compliments the other flavors. Grass comes in next along with a moderate, cleansing bitterness. The beer finishes dry on the palate with bitterness lingering long after all other flavors depart.

Overall, a truly complex and amazing beer. There is really so much going on here and the flavors change as the beer warms. One of the classics.

UPDATED: JUN 13, 2013 Bottle, 330 ml, into a tulip glass. ABV 7%. Revisiting this since I was a total noob when I first rated it. 
Deep ruby colour, almost brown, with a huge beige head. Good retention, it leaves some light lacing around the glass.
Refreshing and fruity aroma, a bit of yeast too.
Taste is also very fruity. Bubblegum, florar notes too, mostly on the aftertaste. 
Medium thin body, soft carbonation. Quite dry on the palate.
Overall a very good beer

Wonderful strong dubbel, smells really fruity raisins chocolate tastes like a winter ale heavy spiciness. A real showstopper.
Only complaint is high carbonation (like many belgian ales)
Still easy to find world class ale.

Színe sötétbarna. Kitöltés után a pohár tetején koronaszerű, vastag, kemény, krémszerű hab jelentkezik. A kezdetben visszahúzódó illat levegővel érintkezve hirtelen fejlődik ki, pörkölt kávé, kakaó, csokoládé kíséretében. Az erre a sörre oly jellemző pörkölt malátás édesség az egész korty folyamán jelen van, de egyáltalán nem tolakodóan. Lenyelés után pedig a háttérben fel-feltűnik a sör legendás "csokoládéíze" és előbújik a komló addig rejtőzködő finom keserűsége.

Bottle (750 ml). Light brown with a small persistent beige head and some lacing. Aroma is of fruits and malt with caramel notes. Taste is yeasty with lots of fruits, malt and caramel. Lingering light fruity and bitter finish. Very good dubbel!
Bottle, light brown color with creamy foam. Mouthfeel is medium body, toffee, biscuit, bubblegum, dark fruit with a hint of chocolate. Carbonation light. Excellent dubbel.

Brown-red color with persistent and creamy foam. Malt and caramel aroma also fruity. Taste is sweet with fruity flavour and chocolate and spicy. At palate is medium bodied with average crabonation, at finish is light bitter.
Pour cloudy brown with a tan head. Aroma is hard to explain, sweet wet cardboard but in a good way with some vanilla. Taste is sweet but not as sweet as some dubbles.

Average sized head, light brown and rocky. Body is red brown and mostly flat, though sparkling is visible. Aroma contains nuts, caramel or toffee, some mild coffee and cask wood. Hops are lemon and some herbs and theres some alcohol. Tatse starts off with light sweet, acidic and bitter and then goes to moderate acidic and bitter. Duration is average. Palate is medium to full and creamy, with lively carbonation. Theres alight aalcoholic finish. One of my all time favorites!

Ottima dubbel non cè che dire. Aroma fruttato con una nota di luppolo per chiudere in un sentore di dolcezza. Al palato corposa e rotonda ma elegante. Il sapore ricorda i frutti di bosco, un pò di cioccolato, e uva passa con una nota suadente di alcohol. Finale leggermente speziato. Ottima dubbel... una delle migliori mai assaggiate.

On tap @ Den Tatoverede Enke, Copenhagen. Pours a very dark reddish brown, with a thick creamy head. Aroma is yeast with sweet notes of kandi, nuts, as well as dark fruits, roasted malts and chocolate. Body is full, with an almost absent carbonation. Flavour is sweet with dark fruits, raisins, cloves, kandi and some notes of alcohol.
pours a deep hazy amber with a thin tan head.lots of toffe and caramel malts in the aroma follow through in to a nice biscuity flavour. gone too soon.

Not the first time had, but first time rated. Pours a purple amber hue with haze. Thin off white head with good retention. Nose of burnt sugar, not much else. Taste is sweet with plum and dark cherry. Burnt sugar on the edges. Mild grassiness is in there too. Light to medium body is not thin.

Rating 1100 is probably the perfect dubbel.  Nice nutty, chocolate, toasty malts, and light candy sugar.  Taste is sweet and malty up front with a perfect dry finish that just leaves great malty nuttyness behind on your palate.  great beer.
Bottle from Systembolaget (28 kr). Quite okay, but not my favourite style of beer.
This is great, nutty and dry but with a sweetish malty flavors. Very nutty and clean, man I fucking love dubbels

Pours deep copper with excellent head and lacing.  Very aromatic - red and purple fruits (berries, etc.), yeast, candi sugar, and so forth.  Starts surprisingly thin on the tongue, but then there is a big burst of fruity ester flavor; finishes boozy.  The aftertaste is its best attribute - you can taste the fruits/malts and retain the creamy mouthfeel for several minutes.  Very different and interesting dubbel - can see why it is so highly regarded.
Aroma: estery, friuty, plums, figs, alcohol. Taste: fruity, malty, caramely, hoppy, firm bitterness, some ethanol. Nice beer.
Sampled at SMÖF 2012. Pours brown with a small light brown head. Smells sweet, nutty roasted. Tastes sweet nutty, syrup and roasted malt.

UPDATED: JAN 22, 2013 Cloudy brown with ruby tones, large foamy beige head. Lasting quite well. Leaving laces.
Aroma bit complex and very pleasant. roasted malts, fruits, caramel, raisins. Taste pretty much covers
aroma.
Long finish with some bitterness. 
Very drinkable aswell enjoyable

Tan heavy creamy head over a deep brown that flashes red like mahogany. Sweet malty aroma with hints of dark fruits. Aroma is so strong you can almost taste. Flavor is dominated by darkly roasted smokey malts that overwhelm the fruit esters. More bitterness than expected, and less sweet than the nose suggests, but taste is surprisingly dominated by umami. The moderately thick body is pretty much perfect for the style, with a good balance of mild carbonation and a neutral texture. Finishes long and a bit bitter.
UPDATED: MAY 22, 2013 botle SB. Pours very dark read with fantastic head. Aroma of unidentifed fruit and nice fruity tatse but without any bitterness at all.

You dont need Brother Cadfael to tell you this is a good en. A dark pour with the aromas of Dandelion & Burdock and an empty bag of Blackcurrant & Liquorice boiled sweets, with the latter being predominant on the buds. A tight fizz, like a sparkling wine and a lingering creamy, fruity finish...... AKA a happy ending in certain professions! Very have-another-one-able.
Good example of a trappist beer, Red color with a full persistent head, Caramel,  fruity aroma, medium sweetness, medium body, average carbonation. Recommended!

roasty, earthy, woody, red, brown, hazy, white foam, light sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, medium body, thin feel, lively, astringent.  Overall it is a good beer.  It reminds of some of the darker beers from Germany.  Not the Belgium characteristics that one would expect from that region.

UPDATED: FEB 8, 2013 Deep ruby red basically brown without a light with a thick lasting creamy lacy beige head. Spicy caramel toasted malt and lots of berries - raisins and prunes. The body is creamy and smooth.with soft carbonation. Lots of complexity here. Raisins, prune with some dates. Clear alcohol present but in an older bottle its hardly noticable. Two bottles -  before May 22nd 2014 and january 25 2012 so its 5 months old and three years old. 5months -  It started out a bit hard to drink but after a while it became amazing. I had some cheese which brought out the flavours. Malt and fruit lingers in the mouth. Im excited to try it again, properly aged and stored. 3 years. So smooth and easy to drink, lots of deep dark malt.
Bottle. Hazy reddish dark brown color. Long lasting beige head with some bacteria-like circles. Aroma of butter, yeast, caramel and syrup. Sour and sweet taste of caramel.

This is an absolutely exceptional beer.  There arent many things wrong with it at all.  This Abbey Dubbel smells and tastes like Welchs juice company brewed it.  It comes out of the bottle very fizzy, with a ruby body and a substantial tan head.  The smell is pure grape and prune juice.  The taste is dominated by the grape and prune flavor, with some molasses in the background and something kind of smokey in there too.  Every sip of this is a flavor explosion.  I am definitely going to seek out more of this.

Nice dubbel. Fig and raisin. A little pear and spice. Feothy head. Lught alcohol flavor. Can't wait to try the tripel.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. Pours a dark amber color with a fairly thick frothy off-white head. Almost a sour taste to this, unlike most beers Ive had in this style. Not a huge fan of this.
Buonissima birra doppio malto. Sapore leggermente fruttato e aromatizzato, retrogusto di malto abbastanza forte. Rimane molto il sapore in bocca

bottle at bateaud e nuit, qc. hazy light brown, red hue, with a nice light beige head, some retention and lacing. toasted caramel, roastiness, fruity, nutty, some chocolate. few spices. big grassy, resinous hops for a medium long finish. light to medium body - somewhat slightly lacking. still, very nice!
Bottle at bar. Dark brown color, beige color. Strong malty taste with barnyard aroma, nuts, bread and earthy notes. Bitter sweet finish with some oak. Great dubbel.

33cl bottle(s) at home. My personal favourite Dubbel. Beautifully red in color with a large tan head. Taste is caramel, fruit and roasted malts. Crisp taste that stays on the tounge a while. Never fails to deliver. Absolutely recommended.

A great Trappist beer. Nice aroma, great finish. Beautiful red color.                               

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

caramel, grass, earthy, brown, hazy, rocky head, tan foam, light sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, light body, thin feel, creamy, slick, soft carbonation, astringent, short lived bitterness
Pours a nice dark-chocolate brown with fast rising tan foam.  Head turns rocky in appearance and quickly falls leaking behind a nice lacing.  Aromas of burnt caramel/grassy/earthy components.  Mouthfeel begins thin, but turns wonderfully creamy with a slickness remaining on the tongue.  Every sip caused the tip of my tongue to feel the astringency first, then it spreads to back of throat on the swallow - an interesting sensation that accompanies each lightly sweet sip that finishes with a light, short-lived bitterness.  Occaisionally, a hint of sour (cherry-like) flavour accompanied - quite a complex beer.

Frankly extremely disappointing, especially considering my high expectations from Trappist Ales.  The pour is nice, leaving a strong head and an almost opaque color, and the aroma is excellent, with a strong flavor of raisons, so everything started out good.  But as the beer settles in your mouth it begins to lose flavor almost immediately, turning almost watery by the time you swallow it.  If were using the scale as a comparison, this isnt any better than beers Ive seen in the 50s or 60s.

UPDATED: NOV 30, 2012 Beautiful deep copper pour with a frothy white head. Lots of malt on the nose. Nice malts on the palate with a crisp and refreshing finish that is still long and flavorful. That 7%abv is well hidden too. Wonderful dubbel.

Strong and long aroma has ripe fruit: green apple, banana. Hazy red/brown. Nice long and big head. Long taste has herbs, bit caramel, fruits. Lively and nuanced flavors. Crisp, medium body, bit sour. Good beer where every part is inviting. Pure pleasure.
330 ml bottle. Pours a very dark brown with light head. Aromas of roasted malts, dark sour fruit, spice, and burnt sugar. Flavors of malts, yeast, spice/chicory and bitter dark fruit.
From a bottle purchased mat the albert hein in delft. Pours a very dark amber with a massive tan head. Aroma of raisins and re currants. High carbonation. Surprising hop back bone. Nice beer.

Dark reddish-brown body, moderate sized pale khaki head, decent lacing.  Bold and malty, dark, sweet fruits, estery-banana, some caramel, and classic Belgian yeast.  Medium bodied, assertive carbonation, lingering semi-sweet finish.
Bottle in Brussels. Dry malty ale, sweet backbone. Banana, yeast. Bready sweet with a little sticky alcohol. Nice

Pours brown with red backlights and a huge, chunky, tan head.
Scent is cherry and a whiff of alcohol.
Taste is slightly sour raisin....alcohol is quite noticeable.
Very dry, fizzy, yeasty.
Very weak and watery......
I expected a great deal more from this one.
What can you say about the Belgian trappist dubbels thast hasnt already been said/ Well deserved of its reputation and rating. This is a beauty to be savored....
Bottled,Pours dark brown with a frothy beige head.The aroma is nutty,sweet,fruity and spicy.Flavors of pear,raisins,candy sugar,yeast,stone-fruit,wood,alcohol,spices,sweet dark malts and oak..

Bottle at Huppel the Pub, Den Haag. Big tan frothy head and dark, almost black pour. Nothing special in the aroma, but bags of flavour behind it. There is a nice refreshing bitterness to this beer and the Belgian yeast makes it very special. I have been drinking this beer for a long time now and it's as good as ever. Bottle and cask consistency is usually perfect.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Mahogny, a bit reddish. With some haze. Malty, raisins plums. Dark fruit. Feels bit sharp though, not as full, creamy as i would like. An ok, even excellent duble!-- bb/h

Pours a dark reddish brown color with a huge foamy head that lingers a long time.  Aroma is sour fruit, cocoa, cherry, and light citrus.  Taste is very malty and pretty thick.  A nice fruity taste but not sweet at all.  Just a slight tartness and very dry in the finish.  Subtle cocoa taste and moderate alcohol burn in the finish too.  This beer is a bit disappointing.  I was expecting something more complex and tasty.  All the flavors are so subtle that nothing stands out and makes this beer a bit underwhelming.

Enjoyed via a bottle from the cellar. Pours a dark mahogany brown with a medium white head and lacing on the glass. Smells effervescent and of sour citrus. Taste is tart and carbonated with bittersweet cocoa powder, some cherry and a hint of orange. The finish is dry with a fruity background. Very strange - like a scratch and sniff sticker effect like these tastes are muted so much, you get it but it isnt strong in any way. Nothing overpowers another.
Pours a very dark brown, beige head. The aroma is very fruit. Taste is a balance of fruity esters with caramel and a very dry finish. I could drink a lot of these.

Bottle, pours a really nice deep garnet-brown with a good beige head that retains well with some lacing.  Nose is malty and Belgian yeast. Mouth is raisins, a bit of spice from the yeast, malt and caramel. Ever so slightly sweet with a slow bitter finish. My only complaint is that the body is a bit weak -- but Ive been drinking some pretty heavy stuff lately, so that may factor in.

0,33l bottle. A dark red dubbel with a pink/brown head. The aroma has notes of fruits, caramel, dark chocolate and malts. The taste is bitter with hoppy and fruity notes. The finish is slightly dry and bitter.

Pour deep reddish brown with a slight haze. Earthy, bready, caramel malt, spices, walnuts, some alcohol on the nose. Light fizzy carbonation with a medium heavy, slightly chewy mouthfeel. Taste is mild sweetness - nuts and fruits, highlights of cherry and stewed fruit. Nice dark malty fruity finish. Very nice.

Bottle enjoyed with my moules @ DHVL. Pours a deep brown with a big off-white head. Attractive. The nose is soft spices, nutmeg, baked bread. Some roasted malts, caramel and cherry. The taste is big cocoa powder, some cherry and oak wood. Full body, slightly tinny. Overall, a tasty beer. A nice way to break up all the sours!
Dark chestnut colour, medium head witch dissapears quick, sweet a bit of alcohol caramel smell, high carbonation, a bit to much mabey, sweet caramel taste with a nice sharp bitter finish

On tap in Paris! Take that world!! More subtle aroma and "Belgian character" than in the bottle in the states. More caramel malt and quite crisp. Fairly intense bitterness compared to what I've come to know back home.

Bottle from vinmonopolet Storo enjoyed at home
Dark dark brown, huge brown head. Smells of yeast esters, some tart elements, hints of funk, caramel and malts. Moderate sweet, quite roasty, some dark and dried fruits. Quite delicious. Ligth to moderate bitter finish, some fruity and earthy notes. Medium body, watery texture, lively carbonation

pours cloudy root beer brown with a nice foamy head and lees, lots of slow-moving CO2 streams. Sweet malts on the nose. Drinks with sweet (7/10) malts up front, half creamy half fizzy mouthfeel, caramel, hoppy background, dark plum/pruny fruit, finishes with light bitter with very detectable alcohol. Medium complexity, med-high depth, good transitions, good carry, good drinkability. Solid overall.

Gran rapporto qualità/prezzo!!!!
Marrone scuro con schiuma beige abbastanza persistente, naso intenso e complesso (frutta secca, caffè, liquirizia, malto tostato....)
Abboccata, corpo medio, poco amara.......buona buona....

Bottle at home - 26/07/12.
Pours a cloudy reddish brown colour with a thick creamy cap.
Rich dark fruit nose with caramel malts backing up.
Sweetbready malt taste with dark fruit, candied sugars, mollasses, raisens and a little herb/spice in the very background.
Medium bodied, well carbonated with very slightly bitter aftertaste and a kick of booze.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Pours a cola color with aroma of sweet ripened fruit.  Taste is mildly sweet with a light alcohol content.  A refreshing beer that has a little aftertaste.  Overall a good dubbel appropriate in style.

Plum raisin funk smell. Medium brown, nice lacing. Very light subtle sweet taste that really picks up with the after taste. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Decided to go on a Belgium beer adventure. Only got through 2 till I realised it was summer and really I wanted stuff that I was happier having cold. Guess itll have to wait.

Ar: Incredible nose - very intense and complex of sweet and sour fruits and malt
Ap: Dark reddish brown with a fizzy khaki head leaving a nice, even lacing 
T: Follows the nose, though not as powerful - sour cherry, pomegranate 
P: Solid mouthfeel with fizzy soda-esque carbonation 
O: Great trappist dubbel ale.

Shame on me for not rating this sooner.  33cL bottle, great earthy aroma.  Medium head, medium carbonation, not very much sediment or lacing.  Perfect  mouthfeel, I swear it gets better from the first taste to the end of the glass.  Really really good.  It meets all expectations, and surpasses most.
Dark brown, malty and soft bitter beer. Tastes pure and natural with delicious sediment. One of my favourite Trappists!
Good aroma, appearance, taste and palate. Decent, memorable. Rated from the bottle.

Got it as a consolation when the Tripel was out of stock. 330 ml bottle. Pours Ruby and brown color with golden head. Earthy, fruity aroma. Hints of fruit and raisins, maybe some nuts. Great taste, goes down smooth and lingers on the palate with a chewy, slightly sweet finish. High quality Belgian beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Rather lively, dried fruits and a bit of nuts on the nose. Aroma is a bit brown bread like, dried fruits, hints of cereal and earthyness.
Ruby-red-brown colour. Nice lightly tanned head. Medium sweet some bitterness well balanced. Full body, oily and slick in a well arranged way. Lively which stays on the palate. Long pleasant chewy finish.
Pretty good beer!
Dark brown/reddish with a full and stable/creamy tanned head. A bit sweet with a fresh smell. Toffee and bisciut and balanced level of maltyness. Little bitterness at the end. Full body and warming.

Appearance was cloudy caramel red brown with creamy lasting off white billowy 3 finger head, lacing throughout. Aromas are sweet carmelly, chocolately malts. Hops of herbal and spicey cloves, and nutmeg. Yeasts are sublte deep fruits and no alcohol present. Taste was sweet malt with deep fruits of fig, date, lemon, clove, touches of estery spicey floral yeasts, hints of alcohol. Palate was silky creamy CO2 with meduim-full body. Smooth balanced citrusy long glorious finish. Best Dubbel Ive had...
As good as it gets.  Belgian candi sugar shines through in this trappist ale.  Aroma includes raisin notes.  Cream of the crop!

Bottle. Reddish brown with off-white head that lasts.
Good dark-fruity aroma paired with caramel.
Full taste with sweetness from the malt, and a hint of sourness. Leaves a wellbalanced, lasting bitterness on the finish.
Pours amber colour with generous head. Quite sweet with plenty of malty flavours including caramel. Very good beer
Bottle at Eulogy. Pours a very dark caramel brown with a fluffy off-white head that leaves a foamy ring. Sweet burnt malt. Plum syrup. Full body. One of the best Belgium dubbels.
A little too sweet, has an interesting licorice smell. Good malt notes. A nice beer.

Bottle 33 cl. Pours a foamy off white head. Caramel, yeast and plum on the nose. Taste of yeast, cream and butter. Nice.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

330ml bottle. Opaque reddish brown pour with a nice tan head. Floaties in the bottom of the glass. Light and red fruit sweetness in the aroma with some must and a touch of spice. Lighter smelling than it looks. Brown sugar and dark fruit malt with some earthy, dusty finish. Mild spice. Body was surprisingly light, dry and effervescent. Overall, it was pretty good stuff.

So full, so deep, it feels like it has flavor down to every molecule. Nice and malty with some mellow hoppiness that keep the flavors nice and dark. Not so fruity, more roasty, but with some dark fruits adding sweetness.

La difficulté avec les bières trappistes est dêtre objectif dans une évaluation
de dégustation, tant il est vrai que dune part elles forcent le respect et dautre
part elles sont parfois difficiles au premier abord.
Cest le deuxième cas ici avec la Westmalle double, qui ne facilité pas le travail
au départ. Couleur sombre brun rouge tendant au brun marron.
Pétillant limité et discret et mousse beige aux bulles aérées.
Arômes complexes de prune, pêche mûre, avoine, pomme de terre avec une
pointe de coriandre.
Le volume est moyen à doux, et structuré.
Le 1er goût est troublant, un peu aigre, sur la prune avec une pointe de girofle
et de genièvre.
Le 2ème goût va sur le pruneau mais jeune, avec une pointe de câpres et de
persil...
La 3ème bouche touche enfin à lorge malté, mais accompagné de café moulu
et de chocolat noir.
La levure est très carrée avec un peu dépices...
Cette bière se révèle en fait dans la longueur, après la 3ème bouche, où le suivi
est bien progressif, et la finale dune belle stabilité.
Lalcool est plus important que le titre annoncé (7 abv) dans son rôle final.
Donc de lart effectivement trappiste, mais avec un effort de dégustation important.

11.2 oz bottle pours a hazy brown with a off white head.  Aroma of malt, brown sugar and fruit.  Taste is the malts, a bit of yeast and a subtle sweetness.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. Pours a brown color with white head. Malty sweetness, belgian candi sugar, brown sugar aromas. Dark sugar, malty, belgian yeast flavors. Mmm, damn good dubbel

Bottle aged 8 months .... Clear dark cherry/brown color, thin creamy beige head, light lacing ... aroma of roasted malts, light chocolate malt, caramel and dark fruity yeast .... taste is lightly roasted, with some chocolate malt, caramel malts, candi sugar and dark fruity yeast .... has a very light bitter hop bite in the finish .... mouthfeel is smooth and a little creamy ... delicious

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ (0,33l. Head some brownish. Color clear dark brown. Flavor malt, hops, barley. Tastes sweet, some bitter. Palate full, lasting, lots of carbonate. Very good

Bottle. Pours cloudy dark brown, off-white head. Cherry, yogurt, prune and new wine. Tastes sweet and heavy, slightly bitter towards the end. Full body, well-carbonated, long, bitter finish. Better than I remembered.

Dark ruby color with brownish lasting foam head lacing to glass. Enjoyed this one with a friend who is emigrating to Qatar. Special occassion. Aroma is sweet, malty and a bit alcoholic. Tase is sweet, fruity, toffee and a bit sour. Slightly bitter aftertaste. (Antwerpen 201202)

Very dark brown with a small head that dissipates quite quickly. Nice smell of fruits combined with alcohol. Lightly carbonated but enjoyable. Dark fruits taste, but it reminded me a bit of baked bananas as well sometimes.
aroma van rijp, bijna gistend fruit, banaan dat overgaat in een koffie-achtige moutheid. de fruitige zoetheid gaat over in een droge afdronk in een anijsachtige kruidigheid.

Poured into a goblet. Dark reddish brown in appearance with medium head that seemed to dissipate quickly leaving behind some lacing. Aromas of brown sugar, cherry, and figs fill the nose. Flavors include sweet malts, dark fruits, cherry. Mouthfeel is medium, not too heavy, with a decent amount of carbonation. Flavors and mouthfeel are well balanced if a bit muted than some other dubbels. 

--- Cheers

UPDATED: MAR 1, 2016 0.33 bottle. Very dark brown color and a large, tanned head of good retention which leaves an acceptable lacing. Aroma is mostly composed of malty scents, some fruits, dough, and some grapes. Taste is sweet and malty with an unusual herbal touch, weird and hard to specify. A medium body, a slick texture and an above-average carbonation - definitely too much for its kind. Finish is unexceptional, sweet, fruity, seems a bit watery and slightly salty but still tolerable. An alright beer but more could be expected judging from the average beer score and the brewerys renown.
Le dubbel generalmente mi piacciono, ma questa proprio non lho apprezzata un gran che... Lho trovata in primis troppo secca poco aromatica e non molto saporita...
Aroma of malt, yeast, resin, and raisin.  Medium bodied with a bready taste, and a fair bit of acidity.

UPDATED: DEC 2, 2015 Nebuloso color rosso brunito con un sottile velo di schiuma bianco sporco. Aroma dolce e fruttato con più specifici sentori di caramello e pane abbrustolito; gusto dolce con note di zucchero caramellato, mou, castagna e un lungo finale mandorlato. Corpo mediamente abbondante ma asciutta al palato, abv non percepito, retrogusto persistente. Notevole!

Une très bonne bière brune, très typée. Un goût qui monte progressivement, elle devient de plus en plus bonne. 
Un petit arrière goût indéfinissable mais agréable.

UPDATED: JUN 12, 2012 Hum. Dark and cloudy brown with a small remembrance of amber. Two-three fingers of creamy head. Quite few lacing on the glass.

It smells good and it smells definitely dark fruit. Plums and prunes mainly. I dont want to say bullshit, but it took me back to those dark red fruity gums of the elementary school period.

The taste is subtler than its aroma but certainly enough to get us to the complex dark fruit flavor room. Ive tasted some fruity wine that reminds me this beer.

Good Trappist. I wasnt expecting that but I like it. Ill certainly get it again.

(Editing: Im having it again and confirm its very enjoyable). The red/dark fruits flavor is so extasiante).

The color is dark. It smells fresh, sweet, malty and a bit alcoholic. The taste is sweet-malty, aromatic, alcoholic, fruity-green apple and a bit sour. Ok but I think it could be better if it is older. 11/12/10/11/13/11

Spicy and malty aromas. Strong malt flavors. Rich caramel, dark fruits and molasses. Moderate yeast, and touches of black pepper, mixed herbs and cider. Creamy feel and relatively easy to drink for the style.
Bottle from some pub in glossop. Fairly tasty, Im not sure if Im going off Belgian beers really sp Im not good to judge.

Slightly murky brown with a healthy amount of sediment at the bottom of the glass. Yeasty, but spicy on the nose.  With a slight banana aroma, the yeast/fruit combo reminds me a little of a German Hefeweizen, but with a little extra spice and darker, more roasted special grains.  Those same characteristics carry through to the flavor, which also demonstrates an almost anise-like spice.  Its a little too numbing and dark for my taste... with hints of a soured grain that naturally strikes me as odd, this doesnt really cut it for me.
Drank from bottle. Just a well balanced beer. Some of Belgiums finest work. Smooth & easy to drink.

Pours dark brown with a tan head. I like the fresh, fruity aroma. Mouthfeel is easy and soft, theres a decent amount of carbonation but it doesnt feel as "sharp" as usual. Taste is also fruity, it has apple and malts. Its a decent trappist in my opinion.

The pour is a hazy amber with a thick beige head and a fine stream of bubbles.  The scent is floral and fruit, perhaps a hint of dark fruit.  The taste is  earthy with a battle between sweet and tart the end with a sharp rush of carbonation.  The after note is a lingering bitterness.  An interesting style and quite drinkable.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Aroma at first reminded me of green apple, floral and sweet but has an unfortunate yeasty edge. Color is light, as is the flavor. Bitter. Carbonation creates an almost harsh feel.

Has an almost floral but more like fresh green apple. Very thick head when poured. Brown in color. Slightly bitter. Abrupt finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
UPDATED: JAN 9, 2013 Nice trappist! Well balanced between sweet and bitter. Notes of chocolat and caramel. Even some fruitiness. But also a bit watery.

A- this beer is a deep translucent reddish-brown with a beautiful beige head and mild lacing. N- The fragrance is dried dark fruit and candy. T- The taste is sweet malts up front, cereal in the middle and a crisp slightly bitter finish. MF- It is medium bodied with a nice balance of effervence and a slickly feel. Overall- A wonderful beer. I would buy it again.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Deep brown colour that gives of dried fruit aromas and extremely light nutiness. Flavour follows aroma and finishes cleanly. Slick mouth feel.

Bottle in goblet. Dark brown with creamy off-white/light beige head. Almost soapy on the nose, with sugars and dark fruits rounding it out. Woody and spicy, in addition, in the taste. Nicely bodied, carbonation perhaps thins it out on the palate a bit too much.

The appearance is a deep mahogany with a thin but fluffy carpet of head that remains through through the entire glass leaving nice lacing.  The aroma is raisins, plum, spices, and a bit of alcohol.  The mouthfeel is rich and smooth.  The taste is an interplay of dry raisin, woodiness, spices, and some astringency holding the flavors together into a tight profile.  This is one of my favorites.
330ml bottle. Hazy dark brown color. Sweet malts, dried fruits in aroma. Sweet, dry, very well balanced body. Dark chocolate, roastyness in flavor.
Draught in a Monks cafe. Dark brown with a thin film of head. Firm malty flavour and aroma, chocolate, vanilla. Best beer I had there on tap
@ harvest pub. Great beer, dark color with a huge creamy white top. A good bitterness when you stop drinking it.

From BA (November 2008): Another beer Ive saved too long, this 33cl bottle has been in my stock (stash) for over three years and Ive put off drinking it for one reason or another. It was one month past its Best Before Date of 23rd Oct 2008 on this review.

Luckily this beer is so well made, the BBD isnt an issue.

Poured slowly, oh so slowly into my Westmalle Chalice, it looked super. I allowed the sediment to join the beer, as I like to taste and feel the whole product and enjoy the extra strenght and flavours the sediment gives.

I am no stranger to this wonderful beer, but I have never reviewed it while in Belgium, prefering to just enjoy the moment whenever I have drank it before.

Deep mahogany red in colour, with a slight haze because of my prefered pour. The tan creamy head, at first full slips slowly into a thinner carpet of foam which laces the glass as the beer is sipped.

Plums and raisens, rich malts and some toasted caramel give this beer a unique aroma, one I could detect anywhere.

The taste is just as you would expect from the aroma. It is rich, but isnt as creamy maybe and it is fairly high in the carbonisation stakes for a Dubbel, but I think that adds to its character and uniqueness.

A beer I always have when in Belgium, often on tap, it is a delight and one of my all time favorite beers.
Nice dark red.  Very effervescent mouth feel.  Malty and delicious.  One of my favorite dubbels for certain.

At de Zotte, Amsterdam. Dark but way less heavy than I expected, the alcohol doesn't come through at all, drinks like water. Awesome.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Boa e bem sussa. Amarga porém equilibrada, com um agradável retrogosto, na medida do possível. caramel alcohol.

Bottled, 0.33l. Hazy reddish-brown color with huge brownish head and low carbonation. Aroma of barley malt and spicy hops. Very rich flavor with strong notes of sweetness, herbs and fruits. Mild bitterness in the aftertaste. Full body, oily texture and flat carbonation in palate. Excellent beer...

Pours a very dark brown color (black imo but the bottle says dark, red brown). Aroma smells like hints of dark cacao/chocolate. The taste itself is very nice, has hints of caramel and something sour-ish. The aftertaste had a little bitterness

AROMA: fruit, bread, cereal,
APPEARANCE: red, brown, hazy, frothy, 
TASTE: light sweetness, medium bitterness, 
PALATE: full body, slick feel, average carbonation, bitter, long finish, 
OVERALL: very good beer, not the best among the Trappist family, lacks character.
The head was a thing of beauty and tasted even better.  The finish was very clean, highly recommended!

Pours opaque reddish brown with small off-white head. Aroma is malt, caramel, fresh rye bread and sour apples. Taste is medium bitter, faint sweet and faint acidic. Body is oily with strong carbonation. Finish is dry and long with notes of caramel, licorice, copper and apples. Very pleasant and balanced beer.

330ml bottle poured into Leffe chalice. Dark brown, very thick, one and a half finger medium tanned head, reasonable head retention. Smelled fennel but not too much else. Tasted roasted Maris Otter style malts and fennel. Bitter aftertaste with a hint of citrus hop at the very end. Mouthfull was coarse, not what I expected. Overall I was slightly disapointed, not as complex as I would have liked.

Pours a rich brown with lively carbonation and a thick tan head. Aroma is of dark cherries and dark bread. Taste is malty and a bit sour up front followed by a dry earthy cocoa flavor. The bitterness of the hops finally comes through well after the taste finished. Complex. Dry. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

strong sweet alcohol aroma with dark fruit.  Opaque mahogany brown with persistent tan head.  Sweet malty flavor.  Alcohol present but no heat. Long carmelly/toffee finish.  Very creamy mouthfeel.  Delish.

Pours orange brown, with plenty of foamy head and a lot of carbonation. Malty, fruity (dark mostly), a touch of sweet and chocolate. This is a bit on the thin side and moderately complex, but balanced. Nothing overpowering. A very good beer.
500 ml bottle. Bitter and yet mild. Very foamy. Its very good Belgian beer.

Aroma of belgian malts and cherries & other dried fruits. Has to be poured carefully, colour a deep red with a large head which reduces. Sweet flavours of cherries, berries with a hint of bitterness coming through toward the end. High quality trappist ale.

UPDATED: FEB 28, 2014 330ml bottle from Bierzwerg. Colour is dark amber with huge head. Aroma is yeast, malt, caramelt. Flavour is yeast, malt, caramel, sweet, chocolate. Older bottle was also tasty BBE 9/13.

Dark red-brown cloudy body with some sediments, but I avoided some of the larger lumps from the bottom of the bottle. An average-sized, light-brown, creamy head that isnt that long-lived, but still it leaves a good amount of lacing on the glass. Wonderful sweet and fruity malt driven aroma with yeasty notes. Dark caramel, brown sugar, dark dried fruits, a certain vinous feel and faint spices and chocolate. Yesterday I had the La Trappe dubbel, and that one had perhaps an even more complex and inviting aroma? Moderate sweet taste with a light bitter finish. Flavours are dark dried fruits and berries, alcohol, dark caramel and a touch of vanilla. A bit thin and light body, and I could have wished for a bit more sweetness. Still a very good dubbel, but as opposed to the rest of ratebeer, I like the La Trappe dubbel better. Or maybe I wasnt in a dubbel mood today: I find it very hard to rate sweet, dark, strong beers consistently 
[33 cl bottle, enjoyed ~1.5 years before BB date, from Vinmonopolet Storo, Oslo]
Bottle from Avondwinkel Deli, Amsterdam.  Dark Red/Brown body, thin lace. Sweet aroma, a good bit of fruit around the nostrils.  Quality full bodied sour taste, nice on the palate.

Bottle. Amber with thin lasting head and some lace. Dry alcoholic aroma with some caramel. Taste is very alcoholic and dry. Perfumey and floral. A bit of  fruityness but less than expected. Nice mouthfeel.
nice dubbel style trappist. Ruby color, fine aroma, good taste. Please enjoy this like I do.
Pours dark black with a tannish head.  Tastes mildly fruity with a hint of caramel as well.

750ml bottle, about 1.5 - 2 years old. Have a fond place in my heart for this beer from my honeymoon as it was the first Trappist brewery we stopped at of the 7. Cloudy light brown with a light tan head that eventually disappears to nothing but a patchy film. Nice combination of a belgian yeast and slightly ripe dark fruit (raisin and plum). Dry and mild sweet with vinous and wood notes, quite rich, moderate body and mild carbonation, some caramel and a breath of alcohol on the finish. I really like this beer but admit that I am biased. O well - its a personal rating!
Reddy Brown beer witha thin beige head. Rich but subtle aroma which doesnt over power. Smooth taste with slight tangy bite. Slight taste of banana. Excellent beer but limit to one.

Bottle. Very cloudy dark brown color. Nice aroma of yeast, hints of caramel and malt. Taste is a bit dull though, bit of coffee, bit of caramel, bit of yeast, hint of alcohol. Not a bad beer, just doesnt come together for me.

Pours a dark cloudy amber with a large frothy cream head. Smell fruity, spicy and yeasty. Taste has sweet apple, pear, papaya, and a nutmeg like dull spiciness and a little rum. Body is med-light. Carbonation is almost flat. After taste is short lived with notes of fruit, a hint of tartness and alcohol. This is very elegant and good. Even though, it does not quite strike me as amazing.

Bottle, Poured a slightly cloudy, brown color, with huge frothy head.  Mmm, aroma of raisin, candy sugar, belgium yeast.  Medium light sweetness, ends dry.  Supurb mouthfeel.  Medium body, creamy texture.  Dark fruit and belgium yeast finishes to a nice dry and slightly bitter spicy finish. Great stuff.  Those monks know how to make damn good beer.

Pours with a dark redissh brown color and substantial off white head, aroma is sweet brown sugar, taste of raisins is prominent, nutty, and sweet, light on the carbonation, and light alcohol warmth on the back end.

Aroma of sweet, dry, dark grapes.  Dark reddish brown pour.  Taste is very wine-like after the carbonation dies down, at first it was a bit sharp with carbonation.  It has a dry finish that mingled with the end tart notes of grape.  Really wild that this comes across so much as a wine.  Pretty complex but not extremely so.  Very nice.

Silky, chestnut pour with decent off-white head and good lacing. Strong aromas of hops, malt, wood, bread, dark fruit, red grapes, vanilla, spice and banana peel. Slightly dry and bitter on first sip. Fruity sweetness comes through with the vanilla and a hint of spice and bread. Westmalle Dubbel is well carbonated and the alcohol warmth is subtle but present. 

Excellent!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Appearance is a large brown head with dark amber color. Aroma is reminiscent of tea. Taste is some sweet malt without much kick and a little tea. Overall decent, but not my style.

Pours dark brown ruby red with a small brown head. Nose is dark fruits, figs, caramel malts. Taste is well balanced bittersweet however sides more on bitter. Mouthfeel is crisp and lively. Decent aftertaste. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Very nice dubbel beer.
Dark brown color with a big head.
Nice intense aromas. Sweet dark fruit taste with a nice aftertaste.

Reddish brown with a persitent 0.5cm foam head.
Nose: gooseberry and raspberry fruity notes melted with malt and yeast. Very nice but not intense.
Acid first taste, strange unbalanced palate: something between a gueuze and a Bitter. A terrific lack of body that any trappist should not have.Bitter unpleasant aftertaste that does not make you ask for another one.
Not a great bear.

Pours deep stunning ruby with a nice beige peach like head, aroma of marmalade, raisins, nutty notes, some plum liquor alcohol, flavor of malt, cinnamon, malt sourness, some bitterness, sweet spices, medium bodied.

Bottle at Mogwai. Helsingborg, December 2011. 
 
Nutty dry aroma with dark caramel, syrup, esters and pears. Soft and rich body with notes of belgian yeast, malts fruit and and chocolate. Long smooth finish. A legend!

Giant bottle from Vinmonopolet. Served in a tulip glass, since I dont have a trappist glass. Bottled almost exactly one year ago (2011-03-10). Music listened to while rating: Emmylou Harris magnificent new album "Hard Bargain" (especially the opening song, "The Road"). </br></br>Pours a beautiful deep red-brown with a large crown of off-white creamy head. Smells malty and fruity, like the description says. Notes of banana and something I can only describe as "general fruitiness". Flavor is malty up front, with some vague fruitiness, then goes for chocolate in the finish, and a nice, roasted coffee flavor in the aftertaste. There are also some fruits coming through late in the aftertaste - Im thinking something like cantaloupe melon.  Great balance and mouthfeel, easy to drink. Slightly sweet, slightly bitter. Somewhat lively carbonation. Nice!

Draught at Delirium Monasterium. Chocolate brown with beige/gold creamy head. Aroma is full of beefy dubbel smell, lots of roast malt, bit of caramel, some hops and something floral. Probably how I think all dubbels should smell. Taste is yeasty, roasty, sweet caramel, toffee, creamy malt, bit of chocolate. Touch of parma violet. Very smooth and very lovely. Malty sweet finish. A classic.

Very good. The nose is spice and malt with notes of caramel.  The beer is deep brown with a cream head. The taste is malty with Belgian spice and a lite floral hop definition. The body medium with a distinct smoothness.
Bottle. Rating #1860. Hazy dark brown pour with a tan head. Dark fruity aroma, raisins and grapes. Mild bitterness, more raisins and other dark fruits.  Nice stuff. (2214)
user_location: Redlands, by way of Wisconsin,, California, USA

text: Simply my favorite beer..... No fancy adjectives would do it justice.......

UPDATED: NOV 25, 2012 33cl bottle. Pours deep ruby/brown, small tan head with light lacing. Aroma full of dark fruit, fig, plum, caramel malt. Taste is big on the dark fruits with caramel & choc malt, lovely and smooth; complexity of the Belgian yeast comes through too. A great dubbel.
One of my favourites brown Dubbels, really smooth, a bit smokey and roasted. I like
Westmalle Dubbel (Malle, Belgium) - Overall Score: D - Below Acceptable Standard
Poors brown beige head. Aroma sweet caramel. Taste sweet bitter finish. 33cl bottle.
Transfering data from personal beer file. I drank this beer a long time ago. Ill update this rating if I have the chance to drink it again.
No lacing on the head, very dark and cloudy.  Smelled like there would be overwhelming raisin flavor but beer tastes very balanced with hints of fruit and caramel.  This is a good beer.

(75 cl bottle from local supermarket) Pours a clear brown with microscopic yeast sediments and rich, off-white head. Aroma is dominated by banana, some yeast and some malts. Taste is sweet with acidic notes. Medium carbonation, oily texture, full body and a sweet finish. Not my kind of style apparently.

Pours a dark brown color with an off white head that doesnt retain well. Little to no lacing. Aroma is smoky malt and caramel flavors with slight fruity zest  Definite alcohol presence, nicely spun with moderately sweet caramel and coffee flavors. There was moderately high carbonation and my bottle was slightly dry and leaves and astringent aftertaste with some hints of chocolate.
Aroma is met rood fruit en zoetig. Doch smaak is branderige noten,  peer, behoorlijke bitter, weinig nuance. Het wordt enigszins goedgemaakt door de lange nasmaak. Kraag is goed en romig.
Dark brown, tan head. Nose is caramel, hops, malt, yeast. Taste is slightly grassy, with caramel, fruit, citric notes in a very nice balance. Smooth mouthfeel, medium body. Good stuff.
Dark copper. The nose shows brioche and baking spices. Gorgeous medium bodied palate with spiced figs and some savory/umami notes. The finish shows a hint of citrus zest.

UPDATED: JAN 8, 2013 Cerveza Trapense de la casa Westmalle. Aroma intenso con finales acaramelados. Destacan notas afrutadas por la levadura utilizada.

Color marrón obscuro, con una tenue espuma y cuerpo completo.

En boca, fruta, levadura y finalmente amargor y sequedad.

Al paladar es una cerveza completa y compleja. En primera instancia destacan sabores frutales. Posteriormente cierto dulzor invade la boca, para tetminar con un ligero amargor y una sensacion de sequedad en garganta. Final de mediana duracion.

En reumen, una Dubel agradable y bien equilibrada logrando los sabores acostumrados en cervezas trapenses sin llegar a ser la mejor del estilo.
dough, spruce, butterscotch, coffee, brown, sparkling, brown foam, medium sweetness, medium bitterness, heavily sour, umami, full body, oily feel, bitter, long finish,
375 ml bottle at the Bayou. Burnt sugar, plums, sweet breads, and a nice fruity hop note. A nice beer, enjoyed celebrating my wifes birthday.
Pours dark brown, tan head..Dark fruit tofee, caramel and mixed dark sugars..very nice dubbel.
33 cl bottle @ home. Pours brown with a firm off-white head. smell of yeast, caramel. Carmale, roasted malts and dried fruits in the taste. One of the best Belgian dubbels.
Dark brown colour. Caramel toffee aroma. Taste is sweet and similar to the aroma. Nice beer.
Excellent beer!!  A nice crisp citrus flavor at first. Malty and Chocolate notes too finish.
Pours dark brown. A tiny bit of fizzy head. Very malty smell. Highly carbonated mouthfeel, almost stingy. Sweet but a hint of sourness (not much). Malt, yeast, pear, some caramel aroma. Good!

Very dark brown color with a thick foamy head and a lot of Belgian lace.  Aroma is doughy  Taste is sweet, like baked sour cherries, if you follow me.  Clean crisp finish with a little zing.  Nice brew.
330ml bottle cool. Dark brown, typical fruit and toffee aroma. Prunes, caramel and dried fruit flavour. Quite a bit of sweetshop going on as well. Very tasty.

Poured into a pint after getting it home from GatorBev. 5.59 for the 11.2oz bottle. Definitely less fruity than most Belgium styles, especially dubbels. Hints of yeast, slight coffee or smoke? Poured near 60°f, lots of carbonation. Almost a milky viscosity with a brown/red hue. Light frothy head. Would be great with red meat.

Bottle at The Caley, served in the chalice which was a nice touch. Pours a brown colour with a thin tan head. Aroma of toffee, caramel, raisins, plums and alcohol. Similar flavours with alcohol fairly present. Moderate carbonation and a chewy mouth-feel. Tasty.

deep brown with ruby tones .big beige head that stays around . looks very inviting  .I get citrus and pear underpinned by malts . good so far . rich full bodied malty taste , not too sweet .smooth with big carbonation that carries the full body well . At the long finish I get  spices , florals , a hint of pear drops and grassy hops . A very big beer for a dubbel .Nice

11.2 ounce bottle into chalice, bottled 1/09/2011.  Pours hazy and cloudy dark reddish brown color with a nice 2 finger fairly dense khaki head with fantastic retention that reduces to a thick cap that lasts.  Some spotty lacing clings to the glass as well; with plenty of carbonation streaming up from the bottom creating a creamier head than on the pour.  Aromas of huge raisin, caramel, molasses, prunes, biscuit, roasted nuts, light chocolate, and yeast spices.  Big malty aromas here with good strength and balance.  Taste of big caramel, molasses, pepper, chocolate, roasted nut, biscuit, dark fruit, and spicy yeast.  Lingering notes of biscuit, caramel, chocolate, pepper, and yeast spices on the finish for a bit.  Nice malty flavor with no cloying, and less spiciness than I was expecting from the yeast.  Medium bodied with lively carbonation; with a fairly creamy and very smooth mouthfeel.  Drinks incredibly easily with the high carbonation as well.  Alcohol is essentially non existent with only a slight warming after the finish.  Overall this is a fantastic Dubbel style as I would have expected.  Great balance of flavors and dangerously drinkable.

11.5 oz bottle from Greenwood Market. Im such a sucker for a good dubbel (and sometimes even a bad one!) My favorite of the Belgian styles because it tastes less Belgian-y than the others. Fantastic little brew that smells of modeling glue and wet metal. All malt and ester in the tongue with so many bubbles it makes it taste a tad spicy.
a great Abbey Dubbel beer. beautiful soft nutty aroma .creamy flavour with intense caramel notes .

red, brown, amber, golden, hazy, tan foam, minimal head, bread, cereal, roasty, medium sweetness, light bitterness, light fruityn-ess mixed with a bread and a biscuit malty backdrop. Roasted malt depth with sweetness and light bitterness. very easy to drink. Perfect balance of depth, bitterness, and sweetness from the fruit.medium body, Finish is sticky, slick feel, long finish, and clean.

Lovely rich colouring - hints of ruby in the chestnut mahogany. Tan head, which hangs around and helps with the aromas. Stunning looker. Very mild alcohol on the nose, which is overtaken by the spices and fruits. Raisins, figs, caramel, vanilla. Play with this on the tongue a little and you can coax out a bit of banana, grapes. A veritable fruit salad! A nice malty sweetness and paired bitterness on the clean palate which is hard to fault. A beer THIS easy to drink and delicious should probably be illegal. Fab!

Bottle, poured into trappist glass. Pours a beautiful dark mahogany with red, russet, and purplish highlights. Big tan head, very rocky, with tight carbonation. Nose is out of this world: first raisins, ripe plum and apricot, a bit of caramel and brown sugar. Brandy-soaked figs, Belgian yeast, a bit of cognac as it warms. Taste is slightly mellower, with more raisin, actual grape, hints of earthiness and an effervescent mouthfeel. Ive had quads that arent as flavorful as this.
Dubbel Down!  OR Dubbel Up.  So pleasant and enjoyable.  At 7%, a mid morning beer!
One of the 7 trappist beers pours drak with a big throwfy head. It has a bitter taste with a hint of space and a very clean palate.
Brown colour with with small off-white head. Malty and fruity aroma. Fine dark and roasted taste with fruity notes.

Bottle pour, 2 inch beige head disipated in 3 minutes. Reddish brown, opaque in tulip glass.  Crisp carbonation, dry plumlike flavor masked at first as I served it too cold.  Aroma of yeast, cherries and plum, suggests it would be too sweet but the carbonation and mild hoppiness balances nicely. Complexity grows as it warms. Not my favorite but truly a very good dubbel.

Bottle. Pours dark brown with thick beige head. Aroma is dark fruit, brown sugar, and malt. Flavor is initially sweet with dark fruit notes and finishes with earthy/woody notes. Medium mouthfeel and light carbonation. Solid beer.

This is the third beer of Christmas 2011.  The Dubbel poured a deep brown color with a 2 inch frothy head.  This is only my second Trappist ale.  The medium body with lively carbonation.  Taste of plums and raisins was present.  The more I drink the better this ale becomes.  Smooth finish with no bitterness.

0.75 l bottle from Alko. Dark reddish brown color. Raisiny aroma with fairly strong clovey spiciness, banana and some solvent. Flavors of raisiny caramel, clove, pepper and plenty of fruity esters (banana). Highly carbonated. Either this brew or my taste has changed but ten years ago I liked this a lot more. Fermentation character (spiciness, fruitiness and solvent) seems to be over the top detracting the dark malt character.

75 cl bottle @ Nurmo, bottled 24.08.2011, BBE 24.08.2013
Aroma is earthy with plums and raisins. Also some burned sugar. Flavour is sweetish with raisins, sugar, some plums and hops. Good.

£2.60 for this in Micro Bar, Manchester, had this in a large goblet wine glass. Ive tried Chimay Red and this is a similar percentage, red/brown coloured beer with a fluffy beige head. As for the aroma, malt, raisins, banana. Quite a sweet flavour and a bit of bitter, very tasty. Very pleasant on the palate. I too have had Rochefort 8 and 10 before this, they are better but this is still an outstanding beer.
user_location: Chapel en le Frith, Derbyshire, ENGLAND

text: Kompleks duft måske med noget gær, duft af byg træder frem. Smagen lever ikke helt ikke op til duften, markant humle.

Bottle. Pours red/brown with a fluffy white head. Complex aroma of malt, raisins and brown bread. Big hit of sweet dark fruit at first with a bitter middle that fades into a long sweet finish. An all round great beer.

pours purplish brown with a lasting white head and a very small amount of lacing.  aroma is fruity  but has notes of coffee beans.  there is also some port and candy sugar.  taste is earthy but sweet with notes of red wine, raspberry, and wood.  finish is woody. a fine dubble but Im not sure if its one of the best in the world as its overall rank would suggest.
Myslim si, ze toto se docela hodi. Klidne bych to dal jeste jednou. Co vy ostani na to?

A reddish brown body comes out topped by a light beige cloudy head that last. Dense beverage combining chocolate, yeast and banana aromas. Malty start with fruity and yeasty hints. Watery middle taste with spicy and hoppy finish. Fair bitterness. Sparkling. A bit disappointing. Was hopping for a more finished and complex product. Something more racy. Were very far from Rochefort delightful ale..

On tap in a pub in Aarhus.
Brown body with reddish hues; medium tan head, mostly lasting with a good lacing.
Very complex aroma with notes of malt (caramel, bread), dark fruits (plums?), raisin and spices.
Moderate-to-heavy sweet flavour partly balanced by a moderate bitter note; maybe a light sour character is also present.
Medium body with a creamy texture; soft carbonation.
Excellent!

Pours Medium Brown in the Brewerys Trappist glass with a short lasting tan head.  Aroma of Spice with a smooth well balanced texture on the palate also of spice with a little hop bitterness.  Not too feeling and well crafted.  Dry lasting finish.  Might be the best Dubbel ever created.
Bottle. Muddy brown with white head. Fruity and belgian and whathaveyou. I think this suffered from having been preceeded by the Rochefort range. Still good though.

pours a deep chestnut with a fluffy tanned head. aroma is brown sugar and dark fruits. taste is deep, and fruity, with the spicy bitterness of hops. there is some carbonation, and quite a dry bitter finish. its a nice dubbel.
This is a great solid Belgium. Floral notes, smooth sweet malts. Very good does not leave wanting

11.2 fl oz  bottle poured into a sniffer...Smells of malt and raisin ..Very Fluffy and bellowing tan head, Dark red and getting darker as you look towards the middle of the glass..The taste is hard to describe, But its very well balanced, with dark fruit flavors and never overwhelming..I could throw back a few of these no problem.

Dark brown/black, tan head.
Faint bread aroma.
Bready flavour.
Medium palate.
Disappointing, lacking flavour.
brown, hazy, brown foam, medium bitterness, medium body, creamy, average carbonation, bitter, long finish,

Bouteille de 33 cl. Couleur marron-rouge, une belle mousse qui a de la tenue. Gros aromes de malts torréfiés avec un léger fumé, très légèrement fruitée. Carbonnation importante, belle longueur en bouche. Trouvée à Vanuxeem - Ploegstaert.

A mesmerizing beer to the eyes.  Deep red/brown color with a fluffy, creamy, slightly tan tinged/off white head.  Lots of toast and raisons in the nose; complex spiciness.  Medium creamy texture with a dry, balanced finish.  Little to no hop character yet beautifully balanced and quite dry.  Overall an outstanding beer--when I think of what a dubbel should be this is the beer that comes to mind.

Aromas of raisins and brown sugar come through. The palate replicates the nose, very fruity, nicely sweet, little bit of hop presence. The alcohol comes through in a pleasant way with a slight nutty finish. Very nice.
Bottle 750ml. Pours dark brown with a high frothy head. Aroma vegetables, hops, dried fruits. Leaves a nice aftertaste. Not Bad.

Bottle aged almost a year, purchased that way didnt realize until first sip. Pour is a cola brown with a small dissipating light khaki head. Nose is of some booze, and dark fruits for the most part. Taste was rather boozy for a double, which I chaulk up to a year in the bottle, almost has a wine like kick, though still very refreshing and the aging adds a nice level of intricacy.

UPDATED: FEB 4, 2012 33cl bottle. Pours a dark cherry red with a tanned head. Nose : Very fruity : raspberry, cherry, ananas, pear. Driend fruits. Mettalic. Caramel. Sip : Great body : foamy but not when swallowed. Small carbonation. Dried fruits and spicy notes. Cinnamon. Good beer. (its been a while I havent drink this beer. My rating confirms but this bottle has a strong whysky and dried plums notes. Quite bitter deep toffee tones. I then opened another bottle, from a different batch and it was different again. More like the usual one. What a surprise. Ill keep the strange whiskey 3 bottles I have left so I can confirm the difference with "authorities")

Best by: 27JUL12

A: Dark brown with cherry hues and over a finger of billowed mocha foam. This falls slowly to a quilt of the same. Limited lace. Excellent clarity where allowed. (4.5)
S: nougat, bread (rye), cereal, cocoa, nuts (cashews). A hint of spice Im having a hard time placing (nutmeg?). Slightest finish of praline. (4.5)
T: Cocoa, prune, sugar, bread, raisin, pralines again. Nice flavor, let this one warm up a bit folks. (4.5)
M: Medium on light for the body with carb a little on the hi side. Semi dry finish. All partshere are a bit off for me. (2)
O: Good example of the style. The mouthfeel on this is off for me, and some of the flavors are a bit tough to pick out (part of the fun!). Its a good example of the style IMO. (4)

UPDATED: AUG 25, 2012 Pours the color of prune juice with off white head. dried fruit and yeast on the nose...nice balanced sweetness and booziness on the palate. Almost always have a bottle of this in my fridge. Delicious.
Bottle. Lively and dark. Taste molasses. Full of flavour. This is a beer to savour.
Bottle. (On vacation in WV about a month ago.) Dark + ruby + ample tan head. aroma fresh + herbal + faint gum. Flavor floral + sweet then balanced by dry. Hard in mouth- high carbonation.
bottle from el corte ingles, lisbon. Brown/red/orange color. Light brown and medium head, also quite smooth. Nice texture and carbonation. Light sweet and light bitter. Toast/caramel/fruit aroma.
UPDATED: FEB 2, 2012 Bottle. Deep brown colour with a beige head. Toffee and plum aroma. Rich malt flavour with toffe and moderate fruitiness
reddish-brown with little head. the aroma the fruits are OK but in the flavor not OK. however this is a good beer because this is trappist:)

UPDATED: JAN 14, 2015 Dark fruits, pannetone, and caramel in the aroma. The beer pours a dark, deep mahogany with a medium-sized tan head  a perfect look if poured correctly in a trappist glass. The taste is chiefly sweet and bitter, just as the aroma suggests, with sharp, fruity accents, a bit of yeast, and a broader, mellower background composed of bread and toffee. The palate is nearly perfect, with sufficient carbonation and a medium body that is good for either sipping or even heavy drinking. Rich, balanced.
brilliant beer.  Right from the honest trappist bottle down to the floral taste of Beglian fields.  Bottle in Castros

Fantastica,decisamente estoy enamorado de las Trappist beer,olor a malta y caramelo bien dulce y rico,al paladar un sabor bien redondo y agradable,en fin una de las buenas cervezas que puedo recomendar
user_location: SANTIAGO DE LOS CABALLEROS, DOMINICAN REPUBLIC

text: Brown coloured beer with small off-white head and medium carbonation. Fruity malty aroma. Full sparkling palate. Finish is malty roasted with some spices.

Ah the dubbel fascination continues! The Westmalle Dubbel is a true trappist ale as it is still brewed by monks at the Westmalle Abbey in Belgium. Very complex and full of robust flavors. A perfect brew to pair up with some lamb chops or perhaps a hearty roast beef meal. Not a bad dubbel, and though considered by some as the benchmark for dubbels, there are several others that are to be better appreciated.

Very dark brown with a fluffy, cream colored head. Nice lacing. Aroma of raisins and caramel; its milder than expected. The taste is sweet malt and raisins, and not much else. Medium bodied and a little soapy feeling. Good beer, but much simpler than I would have guessed.

Pours a deep brown. Nice white head that sticks around. Lacing throughout the drink. Smells of candy...gum balls and Belgian yeast. Smells sweet. I love how dry this is. Malty and dry. This lingers and my mouth feels dry yet Im salivating for another drink.

UPDATED: AUG 16, 2014 Pours dark brown with a medium head. Aroma is mostly malts. Flavor is malts and caramel. Pretty decent.

(160814) Tried a bottle from 1997. Would rate 8-4-8-4-17 like this. Very sweet. Still nice!

2 x 10 cl. samples from 75 cl. bottle. Pours a light brown (read:cola) with a very big, very easy, tanned head that hangs around for a long time and leaves a lot of lacing on the sample glass. As expected a complex aroma: Raisins, plums, some light licorice, spicy yeasts, and a light alcohol touch. The initial taste is sweet with notes of raisins and plums. This then goes into light molasses with some spicy yeast on the finish. No or very little alcohol in the taste. Medium body with medium carbonation. Overall a very good beer.

UPDATED: SEP 2, 2014 Pours a very dark brown with a quickly dissipating head. Aroma is very subtle and muddled. Notes of cherry, fig, plum, sweetness, molasses, slight acidity, and butter. Taste of sour cherry, sweet cereal, caramel, molasses, toasted and roasted malt, slightly bitter citrus peel. Very carbonated on the mouth feel, nice and refreshing as well.

Poured from a bottle into a chalice. Appearance is a dark brown with a nice head of khaki colored foam that lingered until the last sip. Aroma is figs, raisins, chocolate, and a touch of coffee. Taste is figs, raisins and chocolate mixing together to create a beautifully palatable beer. Thick and creamy mouthfeel. Very nice beer.

En två år gammal flaska. Bronsfärgad vätska med ganska lågt skum. Mest russintoner i doften. Smaken är mjukare i kanterna än de yngre flaskorna. Lagom sötma, mycket russin, madeira, fikon, och torkade päron, aningens vinös och liten jästkaraktär. Utan att älska dubbel som ölstil tycker jag att den här har en lite stramare, rundare och torrare smakbild vilket den vinner på. Borde nog vertikalprovat när jag hade chansen. Får väl prova igen om två år.
Non sono un grande amante dello stile, ma lei è decisamente la capostipite delle dubbel.

Bottle bought @ Systembolaget and consumed on October 7. Pours deep chestnut brown with a huge light brown head that slowly dissipates leaving some traces on the glass. Smell is very floral, almost perfume-like. Its sweet and malty with roses and tulips. It also has some lemon hints. Taste is sweet and quite bitter with liquorice, oreganon and ash. Its also slightly sour with some lemon juice. Mouthfeel is light and the finish is quite light and slightly bitter.

Verdammt nochmal! Auch bei mir schäumte das Westmalle Dubbel nach dem Öffnen gleich über. 
Eingeschenkt zeigt es sich herrlich dunkel mit feinem hellbraunen Schaum. 
Die Nase nimmt einen hefig-fruchtigen Geruch wahr. 
Der Geschamck ist malzig-fruchtig mit Gewürznelken-Aromen im ausgehenden Mittelteil.Abgang trocken-malzig mit einem späten Alkohol-Nachhall.Das Dubbel hat einen guten Charakter. Vollmundig und kribbelnd auf der Zunge. 
Ja!Test vom 4.2.2007, Gebinde: Glasflasche

Im trying hard to find this on par with the other big trappistes ive tried. But Im just not getting the same depth as, say, Rochefort. Malty with dark fruit. Medium in mouth with big frothy head that has so far lasted 45mins.

33 cl bottle. BBE 17.05.2013.
Originally rated on 20090812.
Pours dark red color with large foamy off-white head. Aroma of ripe fruits, dark malts, belgian yeast, spices, earth and barnyard notes. Flavor of dark malts, sour and ripe fruits, spices such as coriander and cardamom, yeast, sweet caramel, some mild lactic acid and dough. Very strong carbonation, mildly sour palate with a sweetish aftertaste, full-bodied. A bit more sour than I recalled.
3345

11.2 oz. bottle at the Nook. Pours a dark, hazy brown with a thin head. The aroma is nuts, toffee, dates, and a little citrus. The flavor is very sweet and malty. The palate is medium to heavy, syrupy, and grainy. Overall, this is a delicious and well made beer.

33cl Bottle. Poured into Westmalle chalice, nice apperance, deep red with off white head which slowly diminishes and laces the glass as you drink. Aroma of bread and caramel with some yeasty notes. Flavour starts sweet with some raisin and caramel, ends slightly bitter. Alcohol well disguised. Nice on the palate. A great dubbel.

Stone fruits and caramels are very apparent. Beautiful brown and red color. Raisins and chocolate are there at the finish. Creamy and lively with carbonation that is there but not overbearing. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
One of my favorite Dubbels. It is a must if you are checking out the style. This beer is very nice fresh but does tend to take on a bit of oxidation over 18 months.

UPDATED: AUG 11, 2013 Bottle from Waitrose, Morningside [090813] 
Dark brown, ruby edges, frothy bubbly tan head, good lacing
Aroma of fruity malts, soft spicy notes, slight bubble gum, yeast. slight flinty edge
Taste of dark caramel malts, spicy hops, soft yeast, some raisin, not much complexity
Palate - Medium carb and body, some creamy malts. Finish as main flavour, rather dry
Overall - I dont get the fuss over this - its quite good but nowhere near the heights of the best Trappists  3.7 > 3.5

Bottle from Peckham and Ryes, Hyndland. [090711] 7/4/7/4/15
Dark ruby brown, big off-white frothy head, hazy. Gushed out when opened bottle. Bottle only left to settle for 1 day.
Aroma of fruit, dark caramel malt, yeast.
Taste of yeast, dark malts, dark caramel, bit of raisin, bitter hop and spice. Alcohol well masked. Doesnt seem very complex.
Palate Dry, moderately bitter finish. Very high carb. Easy drinking.
Overall - seems good but I have a cold so I cant get much on the aroma - will need a another review, but I didnt get much complexity in the nose and taste. Good but not outstanding.

Bottle 330ml @ home
Pours dark amber with a off-white head. Aroma has notes of malt and dried fruits. Taste is medium sweet and light bitter. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.

Serving glass: Poured from bottle into Tulip.

Appearance: Extremely dark ruby with massive, billowing tan head that leaves bubbles sticking to everything it touches. Wonderful.

Aroma: Very fruity (raisins, apples, banana) with some light clove and caramel. Most of the aroma dissipates after a few minutes.

Taste: Strong raisin and banana, fairly sweet, somewhat offset by clove, nuts, hops and pepper at the finish. There is a little caramel malt undercurrent, but the sweet, earthy and almost funky fruitiness really reigns supreme. A little unbalanced for me, but still very enjoyable.

Palate: Moderately high carbonation, medium but almost thin body. However, it became very smooth after I accidentally overpoured the second half and got foam all over my table.

Overall: Another world class Dubbel that I find to be enjoyable, but does not quite knock my socks off. Not sure why, as I like Quads and Belgian Strong Dark Ales a lot.

bottle from Gomers Lees Summit out of a Westmalle glass purchased there as well.  what can i say that hasnt already been said?  this is the dubbel by which i measure all others, which pretty much means that all others fall short.  small, light brown head- not as much lacing as other bottles ive had.  aroma is sweet bread and malt with hints of caramel and fruit.  palate is soft but not creamy.  carbonation is present but takes a back seat to the flavor.  starts sweet and buttery and develops into dark fruits (plum, cherry, fig) that turn tart towards the finish with just a hint of hops lingering amongst the other flavors.  wonderfully complex but very easy to drink.  i love monks.
Mooi donker bier met flinke lichtbruine schuimkraag. Smaak weinig bijzonders, kan er niet veel van maken. Een behoorlijke tegenvaller dit bier.

Bottle.
